loans.name: Emmanuel

texts.en:
Emmanuel is 27 years old and is married with one child, who is 3 years old. He sells various goods such as soap, cooking oil, sugar, and bread from 6 a.m. until 6 p.m. everyday except during the weekend. 

Emmanuel has requested a loan from Kiva lenders via Vision Finance Company in order to buy various goods such as soap, cooking oil, sugar, and bread for resale. He plans to use any profits generated from this loan to satisfy his family's basic needs, to pay school fees for his children, and to reinvest in his business.

loans.use: to buy various goods such as soap, cooking oil, sugar, and bread for resale

loans.name: Moses

texts.en:
Moses is 24 years old from Ndunyu Njeru and is a single man. He is a farmer and has been at it for the past one year.

Moses has applied for his second loan from KADET LTD to enable him buy a cow which will help in his dairy business. He is optimistic that his business will do well after the loan.

He hopes to expand his business in the near future and to diversify into electronics business.

loans.use: to buy a dairy cow.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy stock of canned goods, snacks and beverages

loans.name: Elmira

texts.ru:
Элмире 49 лет, имеет 3 детей. Элмира работает учителем в местной школе  и в качестве дополнительного дохода уже 14 лет занимается животноводством, начав этот бизнес с суммы в 10,000 сом. Благодаря упорному труду Элмиры в ее хозяйстве на сегодняшний  день имеется  2 дойные коровы с приплодом, 2 головы лошади. Также, Элмира обрабатывает 2,55 га земли с картофелем и эспарцетом, служащим кормом для скота. Благодаря доходам от бизнеса, Элмира  оплачивает обучение младшей дочери.  
В целях дальнейшего развития своего бизнеса, Элмира обратилась в компанию «Бай –Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом в сумме 50,000 сом (KGS)  на покупку скота для откорма и перепродажи.  Доходы от кредита Элмира планирует вложить в дальнейшее увеличение количества домашней скотины, чтобы оплачивать контракт на обучение, и также в этом году планирует построить забор.
texts.en:
Elmira is 49 years old and has 3 children. Elmira works as a teacher in a local school and by way of additional income, she has practiced animal husbandry for the last 14 years. She started this business with 10,000 som. Thanks to Elmira's hard work, she currently has two milk cows with offspring and two horses in her stock. In addition, Elmira tills 2.55 hectares of land with potatoes and sainfoin for the cattle to eat. Thanks to the income from the business, Elmira is able to pay for her youngest daughter's education. 

For the purpose of the further development of her business, Elmira appealed to the company "Bai-Tushum and Partners" for a loan in the amount of 50,000 som (KGS) for the purchase of cattle for fattening up and reselling. Elmira plans to use the income from the loan to further increase the quantity of her livestock in order to pay for education tuition as well as to build a fence, which she plans to do this year.

loans.use: to purchase cattle

loans.name: Awadagbe I Group

texts.fr: AWADAGBE I est un groupement de seize personnes, dont les membres résident dans le même village au Bénin. La représentante du groupe, Christine (dont la main est levée sur la photo), est âgée de 34 ans et est mariée à un cultivateur du nom de Pascal. Le couple a cinq enfants dont certains sont scolarisés et tous à la charge du couple. Christine vit ensemble avec ses enfants et son mari. Le couple assure ensemble les diverses charges. Il y a quelques années que Christine mène comme activité la restauration (vente de pâte de maïs, du riz) dans sa région. Christine s’approvisionne dans un marché du Bénin. Christine mène cette activité afin de pouvoir répondre aux besoins du ménage. Dans la quête de la satisfaction de sa clientèle, Christine sollicite un premier crédit avec les autres membres du groupement AWADAGBE I. Ce crédit leur servira à mieux répondre aux demandes de leur clientèle et à se faire plus de profits.
texts.en: Awadagbe 1 is a group of 16 people, of which the members live in the same village in Benin. The leader of the group, Christine (whose hand is raised in the photo), is 34 years old and is married to a farmer named Pascal. The couple has five children some of which attend school and all of which are dependent on the couple. Christine lives with her children and her husband. The couple shares the various expenses. For some years Christine has been in the catering business (the sale of corn cake, rice) in her region. Christine buys her stock at a market in Benin. She runs this business in order to be able to support the family. Aiming to satisfy her customers, Christine requests a first loan with the other members of the Awadagbe 1 group. This loan will enable them to satisfy their customers better and to make more profit.

loans.use: To buy rice, corn, and condiments.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase 10 more shrimp-catching trawls.

loans.name: Limuna

texts.en:
Limuna is 51 years old, a widow, and has four children. Her two sons are home repair workers. They use their salaries to help her with family expenses. Limuna travels to another city once a month for clothing to sell at her rented place at the local bazaar. She has many plans for the future, and she works hard in order to bring them to life.

Limuna has applied for the loan to buy vacant land near to her home on which to build a house for her son.

loans.use: To buy vacant land near to her home in which to build a house for her son.

loans.name: Mansurjon

texts.ru: Мансурчон родился  1993 года. После окончания школы советом родителей он поступил в Таджикский Государственный Университет. Данное время является студентом 1 курса. Он очень способный молодой человек. Мансурчон увлекается спортом и в свободное время читает зарубежную литературу.  Родители не в состоянии оплатить за его учебу в университете. Он запрашивает займ для оплаты учебы в университет. Он ждет вашу доброту. Давайте вместе поможем молодому специалисту окончить университет и реализовать свои знания в будущем.
texts.en: Mansurjon was born in 1993. After finishing school, on the advice of his parents, he enrolled in Tajik State University. At the present time he is a first-year student. He is a very clever young man. Mansurjon enjoys sports and in his free time reads foreign literature. His parents are unable to pay for his studies at university. He is requesting a loan for his university tuition payment. He awaits your kindness. Together let's help a young scholar graduate from university and implement his knowledge in the future.

loans.use: To pay for his education at the university

loans.name: Jalapilla Group

texts.es:
La señora Veronica es otro de los miembros del grupo Jalapilla tiene la edad de 32 años, estudia Licenciatura en Pedagogía y actualmente se encuentra viviendo en unión libre con el señor Santiago Ruiz con el que tiene un hijo de nombre Juan Diego de 5 años de edad que asiste al preescolar.

Doña Vero (como le llaman en su comunidad) desde hace algunos años siembra caña la cual vende al ingenio azucarero, cría ganado (vacas) y tiene un carro de carga el cual alquila en tiempo de zafra(cuando los ingenios inician su producción) para el acarreo de caña, doña Vero es una mujer muy emprendedora ya que tambien tiene una pequeña tienda de abarrotes en su hogar.

Ella decidió iniciar a trabajar ya que deseaba ayudar a su esposo con los gastos del hogar, darle una mejor calidad de vida a su hijo y terminar su carrera, Doña vero nos dice que cuando mejor le va en sus negocios es en tiempo de zafra ya que es cuando le cortan su caña, renta su carro y se venden mas abarrotes.

Ella necesita este crédito para invertirlo en la compra de fertilizantes, abono, alimento, llantas, galletas, huevos, aceite, sal, azucar, arroz, frijol, cafe, especies, dulces, papel higienico, rastrillos, servilletas, refrescos, saborisantes y productos enlatados .

Doña vero desea que su negocio prospere y deje buenas ganancias ya que desea que su pequeño hijo estudie una carrera y ayudarlo a tener un mejor futuro.

Los demas integrantes del grupo son:

Eva venta de ropa interior, calzado y sabanas
Ana venta de pollo 
Maria de jesus venta de cosmeticos
texts.en:
Veronica is another member of the Jalapilla group.  She is 32, and is studying for a degree in education. Currently she is living in a common-law relationship with Santiago Ruiz. They have a five-year-old son named Juan Diego, who attends pre-school.

Vero (as she is called in the community) has been growing sugarcane for a few years, which she sells to the sugar refinery. She raises cattle (cows), and has a truck that she rents at harvest time (when the refineries begin production), for transporting sugarcane. Vero is a very enterprising woman as she also has a small grocery store in her home.

She decided to start working, as she wished to help her husband with the household expenses, give a better quality of life to her son, and finish her degree. Vero tells us that the harvest time is when it goes best, as this is when they cut her sugarcane, she rents her truck, and more groceries are sold.

She needs this loan to buy fertilizers, manure, food, tires, cookies, eggs, cooking oil, salt, sugar, rice, beans, coffee, spices, candy, toilet paper, safety razors, napkins, soft drinks, flavorings and canned goods.

Vero wishes her business to prosper and provide good earnings, as she wishes her little son to study for a university degree, and to help him have a better future. 

The other members of the group are Eva, who sells underwear, footwear, and sheets, Ana who sells chicken, and Maria de Jesús who sells cosmetics.

loans.use: To buy fertilizers, manure, food, tires, cookies, eggs, cooking oil, salt, sugar, rice, beans, coffee, spices, candy, toilet paper, safety razors, napkins, soft drinks, flavorings and canned goods.

location.town: Aserradero, Acatlan de Perez Figueroa, Oaxaca

loans.name: Arlene

texts.en: Arlene, a 41-year-old married mother of four, lives in the Philippines where she has been providing motorela or motorcycle services with her husband as the driver for eight years. Having joined HSPFI this year, she has requested a loan of PHP 5,000 to pay for motorcycle maintenance. In the future, Arlene hopes to improve her services.

loans.use: to pay for motorcycle maintenance.

loans.name: John

texts.en:
John is a 35-year-old farmer in the business of cattle fattening. He has two children, one of whom is just old enough to be in school. Since 1998, this hardworking man has been buying skinny cows to raise and fatten, selling them for a profit to his hungry customers.

Inflation is very high in Uganda and is a major challenge for John in his business. Now requesting this loan to buy more skinny cows to raise, he dreams of having much more land in the future with many more cows.

loans.use: to buy small skinny cows to raise.

loans.name: Retiro Emprende Con Esperanza Group

texts.es:
Este Banco Comunal se llama “Retiro Emprende con Esperanza” está conformado por 19 emprendedores quienes se dedican a diferentes rubros, entre los cuales se encuentran; almacén, librería, venta de loza, verduras, venta de ropa, pastelería, venta de comida de mascotas, amasandería, productos de belleza, servicios entre otros. Todos ellos pertenecientes a la ciudad de Linares.
Cecilia, integrante del grupo del Banco Comunal , quien en la foto se encuentra sentada en primera fila, ocupando el cuarto lugar de derecha a izquierda, viste una polera de color café, encima lleva puesto un chaleco de color negro, su cabello lo usa corto y es de color castaño oscuro y en sus piernas se encuentra su pequeña nieta Alison.
Ella se dedica al rubro de venta de ropa y articulos para el hogar, desde hace 2 años. Comenta que trabaja en su casa de lunes a domingo y su horario lo distribuye de acuerdo a su disponibilidad.
La mercadería que va necesitando para abastecer su negocio la compra en la ciudad de Santiago, ya que trabaja a pedido de su clientela y trae la ropa y accesorios ya solicitados, los encuentra a bajo costo por lo tanto conveniente económicamente.
Con el crédito comprará ropa para niños y adultos, articulos para el hogar como lámparas, cortinas.
Una de las metas de Cecilia es instalar un bazar en su casa y agrandarlo, para generar mayores ingresos y una buena estabilidad a su familia.
Cecilia vive junto a su esposo y tres hijos de 27, 20 y 8 años de edad. Sus sueños a nivel laboral es estabilizarse con su bazar, y a nivel familiar que no falte nada para sus hijos y una buena calidad de vida para todos.
Ella se encuentra muy contenta y agradecida de la oportunidad brindada por Fondo Esperanza, ya que le permitirá invertir en su negocio. Respecto al grupo del Banco Comunal del cual forma parte, comenta que en éste existe muy buena comunicación. Por otro lado las capacitaciones, le han servido para aprender nuevas estrategias de venta y contabilidad.
Linares es un importante centro urbano de la región del Maule, ubicado en la zona centro del país. En esta zona se desarrolla de manera importante la producción agrícola y también vitivinícola sobresaliendo en el ámbito de las exportaciones. Destacan los cultivos de cereales (arroz, trigo, maíz y avena), hortalizas (remolacha, repollo, lechuga y acelga y legumbres) y frutas. Linares es la principal provincia productora de arroz, en Chile; de hecho, el 78% de la producción nacional de este cereal se da en esta provincia, especialmente en la comuna de Parral.
texts.en:
The name of this communal bank is “Retiro Emprende con Esperanza”.  It is comprised of 19 entrepreneurs who devote themselves to different fields.  Among their businesses are a warehouse, bookstore, selling crockery, vegetables, selling clothes, cake shop, selling pet food, bakery, beauty products, and services, among others.  All of them are from the city of Linares.

Cecilia, a member of the communal bank, is seated in the first row, fourth person going from right to left in the photo.  She is wearing a brown t-shirt with a black vest.  She has short, dark brown hair.  Her little granddaughter, Alison, is on her lap.

Cecilia has been selling clothes and household items for two years.  She says that she works at home Mondays through Sundays.  Her delivery schedule is according to her availability.

She buys the merchandise she needs to stock her business in the city of Santiago.  She works by customer order, and she gets the clothes and accessories that have been ordered.  She finds them at a low cost, which is consequently cost effective.

She will use the loan to buy children’s and adult’s clothes and household items like lamps and curtains.

One of Cecilia’s goals is to set up a bazaar type store in her house.  She also wants to expand it in order to increase her income and provide her family with good stability.

Cecilia lives with her husband and their three children, ages 27, 20, and 8.  Her dreams on a work level are to stabilize with her bazaar type business.  On a family level her dream is for her children to lack nothing and for all of them to have a good quality of life.

She is very happy and grateful for the opportunity given to her by Fondo Esperanza.  It will allow her to invest in her business.  Regarding her communal bank, she says that they have very good communication.  The trainings have served for her to learn new strategies about sales and accounting.

Linares is an important urban center in the Maule region, located in the country's central zone. In this area agricultural production stands out significantly, as well as the wine industry in the ambit of exports. In particular, cereal crops (rice, wheat, corn and oats), vegetables (beets, cabbage, lettuce, chard and legumes) and fruits are grown. Linares is Chile's main rice-producing province; in fact, 78% of the nation's production of this grain takes place in this province, especially in the municipality of Parral.

loans.use: to buy children’s and adult’s clothes and household items like lamps and curtains.

loans.name: Aien

texts.en: Aien, a 33-year-old married mother of three, lives in Bocator, Tangub City where for the past year she has been operating a shop that sells a variety of products. A member of PMPC for one year, Aien has requested a loan of PHP 5000 to purchase more stocks for her general store such as shampoo, toothpaste and beverages. In the future, she hopes to be a successful business woman.

loans.use: to purchase more store stocks such as shampoo, toothpaste, and beverages.

loans.name: Selmira

texts.es: Selmira tiene 31 años y vive con su cónyuge, su hija de cuatro años, con la que sueña ver convertida en una profesional exitosa. Selmira tiene una Miscelánea, donde vende productos de papelería, confitería, calzado, ropa, juguetes, prendas intimas y ofrece el servicio de llamadas a celulares;  su idea de negocio inicio en el año 2006, como una formula de ayudar económicamente a su conyugue, a cubrir los gastos familiares y a no depender de él para sus gastos personales. Con el pasar de los años la miscelánea ha crecido, en ventas y en clientela, por eso sus utilidades e infraestructura y equipamento de  9 Vitrinas, es superior a cuando empezó. Sus clientes son sus vecinos, amigos, familiares, y transeúntes, a quienes les  vende de contado y a crédito; realiza sus compras de contado en almacenes  especializados en el centro de la ciudad. Aunque la competencia es alta,  se sostiene por buenos precios y créditos ajustados a las necesidades y posibilidades de su clientela,. En la actualidad  ha recibido cuatro préstamos de la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, durante cinco años; hoy sus sueño   es tener una casa propia, educar a su hija y convertir la miscelánea en un gran almacén de mayor reconocimiento en la ciudad; aunque su mayor desafío es su liquidez para dar respuesta oportuna a los pedidos de su clientela.  En la actualidad está aplicando a un credikiva, el cual   invertirá en la compra al por mayor y de contado, de productos como calzado, ropa, juguetes, detalles para fechas especiales  como la de  amor y amistad, temporada en la que sus ventas repuntan y ella genera más ingresos que benefician su hogar.
texts.en:
Selmira, 31, lives with her spouse and her four-year-old daughter, whom she dreams of becoming a successful professional.

Selmira has a variety store where she sells paper goods, candy, footwear, clothing, toys, and lingerie, and offers cell-phone service.  Her business plan started in 2006 as a way to help her husband financially to cover the family expenses and not depend on him for her personal expenses.  As the years went by the store grew, in sales and in customers.  This is why her profits, infrastructure, and equipment of nine display cases are superior to when she began.

Her customers are her neighbors, friends, family members, and passersby, to whom she sells in cash and on credit.  She makes her purchases in cash in specialty stores in the downtown of the city.  Although the competition is tough, she supports herself with good prices and credit adjusted to the needs and possibilities of her customers.

Over a period of five years she has received four loans from Fundación Mario Santo Domingo.  Her dream today is to have her own house, educate her daughter, and convert the variety store into a large department store that is better known in the city.  Her greatest challenge is the liquidity to respond opportunely to customer demand.

Currently she's applying for a Kiva loan to invest in buying, wholesale and in cash, products such as footwear, clothing, toys, and gifts for special occasions such as the Day of Love and Friendship, a season in which her sales pick up and she generates more income to benefit her household.

loans.use: to buy footwear, clothing, toys, and gifts for special occasions

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to purchase fertilizer and cover the cost of labor

loans.name: Irma Alicia

texts.es:
Irma, se dedica  a revender CD, Y DVD, y  ha tomado ha bien solicitar otro préstamo para la compra de mas mercaderia en nuevas peliculas y la musica mas reciente en las presentaciones en DVD y CD  y satisfacer  demandas de los clientes, quienes siempre buscan lo mas nuevo.
Ella considera que  el préstamo anterior  fue muy efectivo, ya que le permitió invertir en su negocio y otra parte la ocupo para compra de tratamiento médico ya que le surgio una emergencia, de lo que tuvo que disponer de este dinero, nos manifiesta tambien que su situación familiar se mantiene
texts.en: Irma works reselling CDs and DVDs. She is applying for another loan to buy more merchandise, new movies and the latest music to meet the demands of her customers, who always want the latest thing. She believes the previous loan was very effective, because it allowed her to invest in her business and she had to use another part of the money for emergency medical treatment. She tells us that her family situation is progressing.

loans.use: to buy more CDs and DVDs.

loans.name: Reina De La Paz

texts.es:
Reina, administra una tienda y al mismo tiempo realiza la venta de pupusas y comida, ella vive con sus padres, está casada y junto a su esposo tiene una hija, el negocio de reina inició hace algunos años, lo aprendió trabajando en un cafetín, este trabajo le dio la experiencia para que ella pudiera instalar el negocio en su lugar de residencia, su madre le ayuda a atender a los clientes.

Ella solicita un préstamo para poderlo invertir en surtir de mercadería la tienda, comprándose productos como el aceite, pastas, condimentos, embutidos, también invertirá una parte y en la pupusería, comprando se quesillo, chicharrón, bebidas, con esta inversión logrará incrementar su negocio, logrando mejorar la atención para la clientela.

El sueño de ella y objetivo con el negocio, es tener una fuente rentable de ingresos con los cuales pueda a suplir las necesidades de sus padres, de su hija, ya que necesitan de estos ingresos para cubrir sus gastos, además desea crecer en el negocio fortaleciendo sus ventas.
texts.en:
Reina runs a store, and at the same time sells pupusas and meals. She lives with her parents, is married, and has one daughter. 

Reina's business began a few years ago. She learned how to run a business working in a cafe, which gave her enough experience to establish her own business in her home. Her mother helps attend to the customers. 

She is requesting this loan to stock the supplies of the store, buying goods such as oil, pasta, condiments, sausage, and to invest in the her Pupusa business, buying cheese, pork, and drinks. 

With this investment, she will improve her business, achieving a better service for her customers. 

Her dream and objective for the business is to have a profitable source of income with which she can meet the needs of her parents and daughter. They need the income to cover their living costs. 

In addition, she hopes to grow her business and strengthen its sales.

loans.use: to purchase oil, pasta, condiments, sausage, cheese, pork, and drinks

loans.name: Juna

texts.en: Juna is 43 years old and lives in Tabo-o, Jimenez, Misamis Occidental. She is married and has five children. Juna is engaged in gardening and hog-fattening businesses and earns approximately 3,000 PHP each month doing this. She has requested a loan of 14,900 PHP to purchase feed for her hog-fattening business. Juna has been a member of PMPC for six years. In the future, Juna hopes to expand her business.

loans.use: To purchase feed

loans.name: Angel Maria

texts.es:
Ángel, debido a la falta de recursos está nuevamente solicitando un préstamo para poder realizar una nueva compra de mercadería, en esta ocacion se comprará un lote de medicamentos naturales y también invertirá en blusas, ropa interior, camisetas, para ambos sexos, esta mercadería considera que es necesario adquirirla para dinamizar el negocio y ofrecer nuevos estilos a los clientes.

Ella manifiesta que sus condiciones de vida familiares han cambiado después de tener la oportunidad de los préstamos, ya que le han permitido compararse mercadería y salir a vender, no solo depender de una actividad sino ir ingresando al comercio de varias cosas, por eso se ha trasladado hacia la compra de ropa, pues con estos prestamos podra darle un mayor volumen al negocio.
texts.en:
Due to a lack of resources, Angel is once again seeking a loan to purchase merchandise.  In this instance, she will purchase natural medicines, blouses, underwear and tee shirts for both genders.  She considers these purchases necessary to make her business dynamic and offer her customers new styles.

She mentions that her family's living conditions have changed after obtaining loans as they have allowed her to purchase merchandise and sell not just one item but continue to grow the product offering.  That's why she has transitioned to the sale of clothes - so that her business sees more volume.

loans.use: to purchase medicine, blouses, underwear, and tee shirts for both men and women.

loans.name: Dora Consuelo

texts.es:
Doña Dora es una persona muy trabajadora dedicada a su negocio, vive con su esposo, su hija y su nieto en el departamento de Choluteca en el sur de Honduras. Ella tiene más de 10 años de tener este negocio de pulpería y venta de ropa alli ella vende refrescos, agua y alimentos.
Doña Dora el préstamo lo invertirá en la compra de agua, azúcar, frijoles, pollo, carne, refrescos, camisas, pantalones y bóxer. De esta manera incrementara más sus ventas. Con el préstamo espera incrementar sus ventas teniendo más productos que ofrecerles a sus clientes.
Doña Dora sus sueños es poder darle una mejor calidad de vida a su hija y su nieto  y  darles una buena educación para que tengan un mejor futuro.
Choluteca, Honduras - Agosto del 2012
texts.en:
Dora’s a very hardworking woman dedicated to her business.  She lives with her husband, daughter and grandson in Choluteca Department in southern Honduras.  She’s had this grocery and clothing sales business, selling drinks, water, and food, for more than ten years.

Dora will use the loan to buy sugar, beans, chicken, meat, soft-drinks, shirts, pants and boxer shorts.  In this way she will increase sales more.  She hopes the loan will help her increase sales by having more products available to offer her customers.

Dora’s dream is to give her daughter and grandson a better quality of life and to provide them with a good education so that they can have a better future.

Choluteca, Honduras-August, 2012.

loans.use: to buy merchandise to stock her store.

loans.name: Sol Group

texts.es:
Nora tiene 28 años de edad, es casada y tiene un hijo, su esposo se dedica a la albañileria, pertenece al Grupo Solidario Sol que esta integrado por dos socias que se dedican a diferentes actividades económicas en el municipio de Juticalpa. La coordinadora de este Grupo es Nora, y ella se dedica a la venta de accesorios de plata para mujer.
Hace algunos años atrás Nora siguiendo el ejemplo de una de sus vecinas decidió dedicarse a la venta de productos de cosméticos por catalogo. Luego de unos años decidio mejor dedicarse a la venta de accesorios. Su negocio no tiene nombre porque realiza las ventas de forma ambulante, y de vez en cuando en su hogar cuando sus vecinas o amistades llegan a buscarla. La dificultad más grande que enfrenta Nora es el clima, ya que la temperatura en estos meses es bien caliente y también cuando da la mercadería al crédito porque a veces se tardan mucho en cancelarle. El préstamo que esta solicitando Nora lo necesita para comprar la materia prima para elaborar algunos diseños y accesorios y también comprar estilos actuales y a la moda. Con el apoyo de este financiamiento ella podrá surtir su negocio de más y variados diseños para satisfacer las diferentes necesidades de sus clientes y de ese modo podrá aumentar sus ganancias. Nora ha sido clienta de FAMA desde hace siete ciclos y ha sido puntual con su cuotas de pago.
texts.en:
Nora is 28 years old, married and has one son.  Her husband is a brick layer.  She belongs to The Solidario Group, which is made up of two members who have different businesses in the municipality of Juticalpa.  Nora is the group's coordinator and she sells silver accessories for women. 

Five years ago, Nora followed the example of one of her neighbors and decided to start selling cosmetics through catalogs.  After a few years, she decided it would be better to sell accessories.  Her business does not have a name because she does her selling on foot and occasionally at her home when her neighbors or friends come to see her.  The greatest difficulty Nora faces is the weather, as the temperatures in these months are very high.  It is also difficult when she sells her merchandise on credit because sometimes they take a long time to pay her.  The loan Nora is requesting is to buy raw materials to make some designs and accessories, and to buy current, trendy styles.  With the help of this loan she will be able to stock her business with more and different products to satisfy her customers' different needs, which will allow her to increase her earnings.  Nora has been a client of FAMA for 7 loan cycles and has always been punctual with her payments.

loans.use: to buy jewelry

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy two cows to grow and sell for profit

loans.name: Artesanas Mazahuas De Donaciano Group

texts.es: Arnulfa tiene 53 años de edad y es originaria de una comunidad indígena llamada Donaciano Ojeda donde las personas de la localidad todavía visten y hablan el mazahua, platica que a su grupo le pusieron “Artesanas Mazahuas de Donaciano” por que al principio eran puras mujeres y todas se dedicaban a la misma actividad que es a la artesanía de Ocoshal el cual sacan la materia prima de las palmitas que se desprende por si solas de los pinos y de ahí hacen varios artículos que se ocupan en la casa como servilleteros, paneras, tortilleros, jarrones, alhajeros, sobreros y muchas cosas mas las cuales las vende en la ciudad de México o en las zonas turísticas como en el Santuario de la Mariposa Monarca, dice que tiene con su negocio desde hace mas de 10 años y que le gusta mucho su trabajar, ella dice “a veces a nuestro estado  de Michoacán lo catalogan como un estado conflictivo donde hay problemática con el narcotráfico pero eso es una mentira nosotros los michoacanos somos gente trabajadora y con ganas de vivir mejor, gente que lucha día a día por llevarnos un pedazo de pan a la boca y es un lugar muy bonito lleno de naturaleza donde las personas somos amables y los atendemos con gusto y con mucho respeto por eso los invito a que vengan a conocer las mariposas monarcas a la zona arqueológica de Zirahuato a las aguas termales de San José Purua, a los Azufres al temascal y a tantas cosas hermosas que tiene nuestro país y también los invito a que me compren mi artesanía para poder salir adelante y vivir dignamente” y sonríe. Doña Arnulfa es una mujer muy alegre y trabajadora ella está  pidiendo un crédito para la compra de material para hacer su artesanía de ocoshal y también para comprar un poco mas de "guajolotes" (pavos) pequeños y alimento para estos dice que hará artesanías como paneras, jarros, fruteros, tortilleros y muchas cosas más.  Una de sus metas es hacer más amplia su huerta de aguacate e invertir en planta de este fruto para mejorar sus condiciones de esta. Las otras tres integrantes del grupo se llaman Sofía, Claudio y María Catalina ellos invertirán en comprar materia para hacer artesanías de ocoshal para venderlas.
texts.en:
Arnulfa is 53 years old and is a native of the indigenous community named Donaciano Ojeda where the people of the town still dress and speak mazahua. She says that her group chose the name Mazahua Crafts of Donaciano because, at the beginning, they were all women and all were dedicated to the same activity, which is ocoshal crafts for which they take the raw material from palmitas that they break off themselves from the pine trees and there make various items for the house like napkin rings, bread and tortilla baskets, vases, jewelry boxes, hats and many more things which they sell in Mexico City or in the tourist area like in Santuario de la Mariposa Monarca. She says that she's had her business for more than ten years and she likes to work a lot. She says, "sometimes our state of Michoacan is categorized as a state in conflict where there are problems with drug trafficking but this is a lie. We michoacanos are hard working people with desires to live better, people who strive day after day to take a piece of bread to our mouths and it is a very beautiful place full of nature where people are friendly and we attend them with pleasure and with much respect so I invite them to come to know the monarch butterflies, to the archaeological area of Zirahuato, to the thermal waters of San Jose Purua, to the bathhouses of Azufres and to the many beautiful places that our country has and also I invite them to buy my crafts to be able to get ahead and to live with dignity and happiness."

Arnulfa is a very happy and hard working woman. She is requesting a loan to buy material to make her ocoshal crafts and also to buy a few more small turkeys and the food for them. She says that she will make crafts like bread baskets, vases, fruit baskets, tortilla baskets, and many other things. One of her goals is to expand her avocado orchard and invest in planting this fruit to improve her conditions. The other three members of the group are named Sofia, Claudio and Maria Catalina. They will invest in the purchase of materials to make ocoshal crafts and to sell them.

loans.use: to buy material to make ocoshal crafts and food for turkeys.

loans.name: Gardenias Group

texts.es: Ricarda tiene 51 años de edad y es originara de una población llamada Macho de Agua un lugar lleno de riqueza natural donde la principal fuente de empleo es la elaboración de bordados artesanales y a la cría de borrego, ella pertenece a un grupo  llamado Gardenias y dice que le pusieron ese nombre al grupo por que donde se reúnen en esa casa hay flores de gardenias y para que las ubicaran rápido le pusieron ese nombre, aparte que esa flor es muy bonita. Platica que tiene una tienda de abarrotes desde hace más de 28 años y que la puso para poder ayudar a su esposo con los gastos del hogar ya que antes eran más hijos por mantener por que en ese entonces estaban estudiando. También puso la tiendita de abarrotes por la necesidad de que no había una tienda donde pudieran comprar los productos básicos para uso personal y para comer. Dice que desea un crédito y se lo está pidiendo a Visión Fund para poder surtir su tienda de abarrotes ya que quiere comprar jabón, huevo, leche, cloro, suavizante de telas, frijol, arroz, atún, sardinas, galletas, papel higiénico, pañales desechables, refrescos, jugos de diferentes sabores etc. Dice que  todos esos productos los compra en diferentes tiendas en una población cercana a la de ella donde le dan precios bajos y así ella poder ganarle algo a la hora que los vende. Dice que su máximo sueño es que su hijo el menor tenga una carrera y pueda superarse ya que en la comunidad no hay trabajos estables aunque todavía faltan 2 años ya que ahorita va en la preparatoria, también para su negocio quisiera hacerlo crecer un poco mas y vender lácteos y carnes frías para que la gente no se traslade hasta otras poblaciones a comprar para comer. Las otras siete integrantes del grupo se llaman Domitila, Natalia, Gabriela, Enriqueta, Martha, Laura y Sebastiana ellas invertirán sus créditos en la compra de artículos para surtir tiendas de abarrotes, para la elaboración de prendas artesanales, para alimento para cría de borregos.
texts.en:
Ricarda, 51, is from a town called Macho de Agua, a place rife with natural resources where the main source of employment is artisanal embroidery work and raising sheep.  She belongs to a group called “Gardenias” and she says they named it thus because the house they meet in has gardenias and to quickly identify it they gave it that name; besides it’s a very pretty flower.

She relates that she’s had a grocery store for more than 28 years and that she opened it to help her husband with household expenses because there used to be more children to support who at that time were attending school.  She also opened a small grocery store because of need; there wasn’t any grocery store where they could buy basic staples for personal use and to eat.  

She says that she wants a loan and is asking Visión Fund for it in order to stock the grocery store because she wants to buy soap, eggs, milk, chlorine bleach, fabric softener, beans, rice, tuna, sardines, cookies, toilet paper, disposable diapers, soft-drinks, juices in assorted flavors, etc.  She says that she buys all those products in various stores in a nearby town where she gets them at low prices so that she can earn a bit of profit when she resells them.

She says that her greatest dream is that her youngest son has a career and is able to improve himself because stable employment is scarce in the community where they live; he still has two more years left in high school.  She also wants to make her business grow a bit more and to sell dairy products and cold cuts so that folks don’t have to go to other towns to buy what they need for their meals.

The other seven group members are Domitila, Natalia, Gabriela, Enriqueta, Martha, Laura and Sebastiana and they will use their loans to buy products to stock grocery stores, to make traditional clothing and to buy sheep feed.

loans.use: to buy stock merchandise for her store.

loans.name: La Rinconada Group

texts.es:
Este Banco Comunal se llama “La Rinconada” está conformado por 18 emprendedores quienes se dedican a diferentes rubros, entre los cuales se encuentran; venta de quesillo, venta de ropa, feriantes, venta de harina, venta de pan, venta de café de trigo, almacén, jardinería, venta completos y papas fritas, servicios entre otros. Todos ellos pertenecientes a la ciudad de Concepción.
Veronica, presidenta del grupo del Banco Comunal, quien en la foto se encuentra sentada en primera fila, ocupando el primer lugar de izquierda a derecha, viste una polera de color celeste, usa anteojos, su cabello lo usa corto y es de color castaño claro.
Ella se dedica al rubro de ventas de masa dulces realizando queques, calzones rotos, sopaipillas, pie de limón y pan amasado, desde hace 4 meses. Comenta que trabaja de lunes a viernes en su casa, y su horario lo distribuye de acuerdo a su disponibilidad.
La mercadería e insumos que va necesitando para su negocio las compra en supermercados, distribuidoras y locales donde encuentra accesorios para la venta de sus masas.
Con el crédito comprará harina, aceite, margarina, levadura, bolsas, coco rallado.
Una de las metas de Veronica es seguir con su rubro y seguir vendiendo a Empresas y perfeccionarse para hacer otros productos, así optar a mayores ingresos y calidad de vida. 
Veronica vive junto a su esposo dos hijas de 18 y 13 años de edad y su pequeño nieto de un año de edad. Sus sueños a nivel laboral es tener una cocina más amplia y agrandar su casa.
Ella se encuentra muy contenta y agradecida de la oportunidad brindada por Fondo Esperanza, ya que le permitirá invertir en su negocio. Respecto al grupo del Banco Comunal del cual forma parte, comenta que en éste existe muy buena comunicación. Por otro lado las capacitaciones, le han servido para aprender nuevas estrategias de venta y contabilidad.
Concepción, está asentada en la desembocadura del río Biobío, uno de los más grandes del país, al sur de Chile, en la región del Bíobío. Ha tenido una importante función en nuestra historia, siendo sede de importantes batallas y asentamiento relevante, especialmente durante la Guerra de Arauco, por estar en la frontera con territorio mapuche. Actualmente la ciudad posee un importante desarrollo económico y demográfico, llegando a ser considerada como uno de los núcleos urbanos, demográfico, administrativo, financiero y comercial más relevantes de Chile, después de Santiago y Valparaíso.
texts.en:
This communal bank is called "La Rinconada." It is made up of 18 entrepreneurs who work in different fields. Included among them are cheese sales, clothing sales, outdoor market vending, flour sales, bread sales, wheat coffee sales, neighborhood grocery store operation, landscaping, hot dog and french fry sales, providing services, and others. All of the members are residents of the city of Concepción.

Veronica, the president of the communal bank, can be found in the photo sitting in the front row, in the first position from left to right. She is wearing a blue shirt and glasses and she wears her light-brown hair short.

For the past four months, Veronica has worked selling baked goods. She makes cakes, "calzones rotos" [fried dough dusted with powdered sugar], sopaipillas [another fried pastry], lemon pie, and rolls. 

She says that she works from Monday to Friday in her house on her own schedule. She distributes the pastries according to their availability. 

She buys the ingredients and supplies that she needs for her business in supermarkets, distributors, and shops where she finds incidentals that she needs to sell her pastries.

With the loan, she will buy flour, oil, margarine, yeast, bags, and shredded coconut.

Veronica's goals are to continue in her field, to keep selling to businesses, and to perfect her ability to make other products, so that she can aim for a better income and quality of life.

Veronica lives together with her husband, two daughters who are 18 and 13 years old, and her little one-year-old grandson. Her work-related dream is to have a bigger kitchen, and to enlarge their house.

She feels very happy and grateful for the opportunity given by Fondo Esperanza, since it will allow her to invest in her business. Regarding the communal banking group that she belongs to, she says that they have very good communication. In addition, the training has been useful for learning new sales and accounting strategies.

Concepción is situated at the mouth of the Bíobío River, one of the largest rivers in the country, in the Bíobío region of southern Chile. Concepción has had an important role in Chile's history; it was the site of important battles and significant settlements, especially during the Arauco War, because of its location on the frontier of Mapuche territory. Currently, the city is home to important economic and demographic development, now being considered one of Chile's most important urban, demographic, administrative, financial, and commercial centers, after Santiago and Valparaíso.

loans.use: to buy flour, oil, margarine, yeast, bags, and shredded coconut.

loans.name: Yaneth

texts.es:
La joven Yaneth es una persona muy trabajadora actualmente vive con su esposo y su hijo los cuales vive en el caserío de Guasaule en el Departamento de Choluteca. Ella Se dedica a su negocio propio de pulpería. Yaneth el préstamo lo necesita para la compra de carne, pollo, café, azúcar, harina, refrescos, jugos, y otros productos de consumo.
Yaneth espera en 5 años tener un mini súper. Ya que es una zona muy productiva de mariscos, ganadería y otro tipo de actividades como comercio.
Yaneth los planes a futuro es seguir trabajando duro para terminar de darle a su hijo lo mejor que es la educación y que sea una persona de bien para poder ayudar a su familia a salir adelante.
Choluteca, Honduras - Agosto del 2012
texts.en:
Young Yaneth is a hard worker.  She lives with her husband and son in the village of Guasaule in the Department of Choluteca.  She works in her own general store business.  Yaneth needs a loan to buy beef, chicken, coffee, sugar, flour, soft drinks, juices and other consumer products.  

Yaneth hopes to have her own mini supermarket in five years.  The region is very productive in shellfish production, farming and other activities such as trade.

Yaneth's plans for the future are to keep working hard to be able to give her son the best education possible and to help her family to get ahead.

loans.use: to buy beef, chicken, coffee, sugar, flour, soft drinks, juices and other consumer products for her business.

loans.name: Awadagbe Group

texts.fr: AWADAGBE est un groupement de seize personnes, dont les membres résident dans le même village. La représentante du groupe, Eugénie (dont la main est levée sur la photo), est âgée de 43 ans et est mariée à un certain Bénoit. Le couple a trois enfants tous scolarisés et à la charge du couple. Eugénie vit ensemble avec ses enfants et son mari. Le couple assure ensemble les diverses charges. Il y a quelques années que Eugénie mène comme activité la restauration et la vente des plastiques dans un quartier du Bénin. Eugénie s’approvisionne dans un marché du Bénin. Eugénie mène cette activité afin de pouvoir aux besoins du ménage. Dans la quête de la satisfaction de sa clientèle, Eugénie sollicite un premier crédit avec les autres membres du groupement AWADAGBE. Ce crédit leur servira à mieux répondre aux demandes de leur clientèle et à se faire plus de profits.
texts.en:
AWADAGBE is a group of sixteen persons whose members reside in the same village. The group's representative, Eugénie (whose hand is raised in the photo), is 43 years old and married to a man named Bénoit. The couple support four children, who are all in school. Eugénie lives together with her children and husband. The couple jointly ensure that the diverse expenses are covered. 

For a few years, Eugénie has had a restaurant business and a business selling plasticware in a district in Benin. She gets her supplies from a market in Benin. She works in order to be able to meet the needs of her household. 

Seeking to satisfy her customers, Eugénie is requesting, along with the other members of the group AWADAGBE, an initial loan for responding better to customer demands and making more profit.

loans.use: to purchase corn and rice for her restaurant and some plasticware to sell

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to purchase fertilizer and cover the cost of labor for his farm

loans.name: Washington Nicolas

texts.es:
WASHINGTON NICOLAS tiene 22 años de edad es soltero no tiene hijos, vive en casa de unos familiares en la ciudad de Ventanas provincia de los Ríos.

Es Integrante de la VRC los ÚLTIMOS SERAN LOS PRIMEROS, se encuentran ubicada en Recinto San Gabriel, pertenece al Cantón Ventanas se dedican a Labores Agrícolas y Pecuarias. 

WASHINGTON NICOLAS se dedica a la agricultura a la siembra de maíz, Solicita el crédito para comprar semillas, insumos, insecticidas, fertilizantes, urea, ranger. 

Con la ayuda del crédito podrá comprar los insumos agrícolas y podrá duplicar los ingresos. Las compras lo hará en ventanas. Los desafíos a los que se enfrenta son las plagas en los cultivos. El sueño es poder comprar un terreno. En el tiempo libre le gusta hacer deporte jugar indor.
texts.en:
Washington Nicolás, 22, is single and has no children.  He lives with some relatives in the city of Ventanas, Los Ríos Province.  He's a member of Los Últimos Serán los Primeros Communal Bank, located in the San Gabriel area of Ventanas Canton, where people make a living in agriculture and livestock.

Washington Nicolás works in agriculture growing corn.  He's requesting the loan to buy seed, inputs, insecticide, fertilizer, urea, and pesticide (Ranger).  With the help of the loan he'll be able to buy the agricultural inputs and double his income.  

He's going to make his purchases in Ventanas.  The challenges he faces are crop pests.  His dream is to be able to buy a plot of land.  In his free time he likes to play sports, indoor soccer.

loans.use: to buy seed, inputs, insecticide, fertilizer, urea, and pesticide

loans.name: Duhuzimbaraga/ Rgt Group

texts.fr:
Lazare est le membre et le président du groupe Duhuzimbaraga / Rgt. Le nom du groupe signifie «ressembler les forces pour travailler».Il a 27 ans et il est marié avec 1 enfant de 2 ans.  Son niveau d’éducation est 6ième primaire.

Lazare est cultivateur de riz. C’est son troisième cycle de prêt avec ACB et il dit que le crédit antérieur a aidé ses activités de l’agriculture de riz beaucoup et il n’a pas attendue aucunes difficultés de non remboursement du crédit. Il va utiliser son crédit afin d’acheter des fertilisants et payer la main d’œuvre pour son activité d’agriculture de riz. 

Pour accroitre son agriculture du riz, il planifie de demander d’autres crédit pour renforce ses activités agriculture de riz. Dans les prochaines années, il voudrait être le meilleur  agriculteur et le grand fournisseur de riz dans tous le pays. Avec les profits, il prévoit payer le frais scolaire de ses enfants et construire une  belle maison.
texts.en:
Lazare is a member and the president of the Duhuzimbaraga/Rgt group. The group's name means "joining strengths to work". Lazare is 27 years old and married with a 2-year-old child. He attended school for 6 years at the primary level.

Lazare grows rice. This is his third loan cycle with ACB, and he plans to use the credit to buy fertilizers and pay for the cost of labor. He has stated that the previous loans have helped his activity, and he does not anticipate any difficulties with repayment. 

Lazare plans to expand his business by obtaining additional loans to bolster his activities. In the coming years, he hopes to become the leading rice farmer and supplier in the country. He plans to use his profits to support his children’s education and to build a nice house.

loans.use: to buy chemical fertilizers and to pay for labor costs.

loans.name: Jacinta

texts.es: Jacinta de 66 años, es una mujer tímida. Vive en compañía de Juan, su esposo desde hace 40 años. Ambos tienen 4 hijos, pero solo  viven con su hijo Samuel, al que cuida en la casa que heredó desde hace 42 años. Desde que formó su familia comenzó a sembrar papa, alverja y zanahoria en sus terrenos agrícolas, de eso hace 20 años. Donde todos los días dedica su tiempo al cuidado de sus terrenos agrícolas, cuenta que en cada cosecha lo comercializa los alimentos a la capital del país, donde recibe muchas ganancias. Además comenzó con la crianza de cuyes, cuenta con 400 ejemplares, los cuales vende en la feria que se realiza los fines de semana en la ciudad, tiene clientes fijos, los que elogian la calidad de crianza que tiene. Su secreto es cuidarlos con mucho cuidado, desinfecta las jaulas con cal para que no sufran ninguna enfermedad, además constantemente los cambia de lugar para que no se estresen, de esta manera puede lograr la calidad que espera. Ella pertenece al banco comunal “sicaya 2000” y este es el crédito número 1 con MFP, se siente feliz pues en este tiempo logró obtener muchas ganancias, todo gracias al apoyo económico que le brindan. Por ello promete cumplir con el pago de las cuotas. Además gusta de trabajar en su asociación, donde los integrantes son personas solidarias y trabajadoras. Jacinta; invertirá el dinero en la compra de 300 sacos de fertilizantes orgánicos para esparcir entre sus sembríos.
texts.en:
Jacinta is 66 years old. She is a shy woman. She lives with Juan, her husband of 40 years. Together they have 4 children, but they only live with their son Samuel, whom she takes care of in the house she inherited 42 years ago. Since they started their family, they have been planting crops of potatoes, peas and carrots in their farm land, which they have done for twenty years. Everyday they dedicate their time to taking care of their crops and land. She said that each harvest, they sell the vegetables in the capital, where they receive good profits. 

She also started raising guinea pigs, she currently has 400, which she sells on the weekends in the market in the capital. She has returning customers, whom commend her for the quality of the breed she has. Her secret is to raise them with much care, disinfecting their cages with lime so that they do not catch any diseases. She also moves them around to different locations so that they are not stressed, and in this way she is able to achieve the quality that she hopes for in the matured animals.  

She belongs to the communal bank "Sicaya 2000" and this is the first loan she has taken out through MFP. She is happy because she has recently been making good profits, thanks to the economic support she has been given. For this reason she promises to make her payments. She enjoys working with her communal bank because the members are hard working and supportive. Jacinta will invest the money from the loan in the purchase of 300 sacks of organic fertilizer to scatter amongst her crops.

loans.use: to buy three hundred sacks of fertilizer.

loans.name: Yrupe Group

texts.es:
El comité lleva por nombre Yrupe, debido a que asi se llama la calle de su Barrio, han asumido el compromiso de  mantener unido el grupo y trabajar bajo respeto y responsabilidad, actualmente se encuentran en el  sexto ciclo con calificación excelente, integrada por  15 mujeres.
Una de estas mujeres es la señora Apolinaria, quien cuenta que se dedica a la venta de leche, trabaja en esto desde muy tempranas horas del día para poder poner en la mesa de sus clientes el producto para el desayuno. 
Ella solicita el crédito para la compra de leche, para poder surtirse y de esa forma seguir cumpliendo con los pedidos de sus clientes.
texts.en:
The committee is called “Yrupe” because that’s the name of a street in the neighborhood.  They’ve taken on the commitment of keeping the group together and to work with mutual respect and responsibility.  They are currently in the 6th cycle with a grade of “excellent” and there are 15 women members.

One of them is Apolinaria who says that she works selling milk.  She starts work very early in the morning in order to provide her customers with a product they need on their tables for breakfast.  She’s requesting the loan to buy milk to stock up and continue filling customer orders.

loans.use: to buy milk to sell.

loans.name: Silvio

texts.es:
El Sr. Silvio vive en la ciudad de Encarnación, tiene 4 hijos por quienes lucha incansablemente para poder darles una vida digna y sin privaciones.
Es dueño de una despensa bien surtida en el centro de Encarnación, donde trabaja con su familia hace más de dos años. Cabe destacar que aparte de su despensa tiene un surtidor que atiende en horario nocturno los fines de semana y feriados.
Silvio solicita el crédito para la compra de productos a granel, bebidas, carne, lácteos, verduras y demás insumos para tener bien surtido su negocio. Agradece la oportunidad que está recibiendo ya que gracias a esto podrá seguir trabajando y ayudando a su familia.
texts.en:
Silvio lives in the city of Encarnación; he has four children for who he strives tirelessly to provide with a life of dignity that’s free from want.  He owns a well-stocked grocery store in Encarnación where he’s worked with his family for more than two years.  It’s important to point out that in addition to his grocery store he also has a distributorship that’s open nights weekends and holidays.

Silvio is asking for the loan to buy bulk grains, soft-drinks, meat, dairy products, vegetables and other supplies to keep the store well-stocked.  He is grateful for the opportunity he’s getting because thanks to it he will be able to stay in business supporting and his family.

loans.use: to buy soft-drinks, meat, dairy productgs, vegetables, bulk grains and others.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to purchase chemical fertilizers and pay for the cost of labor.

loans.name: Milcah

texts.en:
Milcah is a young working woman who lives with her parents and siblings. She is the first born in a family of six, and the rest of the siblings are still in school. Milcah currently spends $3 per day on kerosene for lighting and cooking.

A solar lamp provides a far safer and higher quality lighting source than unclean and hazardous kerosene, creating a better and safer nighttime studying environment for her younger siblings. With her savings from reduced kerosene dependence and earnings from her job, Milcah is confident that she can pay back the loan with ease.

loans.use: To purchase a solar lanten and clean cookstove

loans.name: Mary Gathoni

texts.en:
Mary is an elderly widow living in the Kamwangi area in Thika. Her children are grown and married. She is a member of the Kamwangi women's group that pools funds to create small businesses. 

She is a farmer with two dairy cows, which produce five liters of milk per day. Mary then sells four of these liters at the local market and uses one liter for her tea. She also has 10 chickens and sells eggs on a daily basis at the local market. 

She has taken a loan to purchase an improved cookstove that will save her the drudgery of walking long distances to collect and carry back a heavy load of firewood. The cookstove will also save her from a smoky kitchen and thus help her health.

As a group leader, she will also assist in promoting efficient cookstoves to the other group members as well as other women in her community.

Proceeds from Mary's milk and eggs sales will be used to repay the loan.

loans.use: To purchase an efficient cookstove

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy baked goods, condiments, spices, soft-drinks, meat products and others.

loans.name: Divino Niño Group

texts.es:
Las 11 mujeres de la ciudad de Caacupé forman el grupo llamado Divino Niño, ellas son todas madres de familia que se esfuerzan por sus hijos y quieren salir adelante.
Reina es la presidenta y miembro de este grupo, ella es comerciante, y cuenta que tiene una librería bien surtida. Cuenta que tiene muy buena venta en especial en la época de colegio, ya que constantemente está cargando su negocio. Gracias a su trabajo está saliendo adelante y ayuda con los gastos de su hogar.
Reina solicita este préstamo para la compra de libros, cuadernos, lápices, pinceles y demás insumos, los cuales son esenciales para poder seguir con sus ventas y su negocio.
texts.en: The eleven women from the city of Caacupé who form the “Divino Niño” (Holy Child) group are all mothers who strive for their children and who want to get ahead.  Reina is a group member and its president.  She’s a merchant and relates that she has a well-stocked bookstore.  She tells that her sales are very good especially during the school term because she’s constantly stocking her store.  Thanks to her work she’s getting ahead and she’s able to help with household expenses.  Reina is asking for this loan to buy books, notebooks, pencils, brushes and other supplies that are essential for her to continue selling and to stay in business.

loans.use: to buy books, notebooks, pencils, brushes and other supplies.

loans.name: Kariua Women Group

texts.en:
The members of Kariua group come from the Ndakaini Dam area in Thika. The women members are dairy and tea farmers. 
  
They formed their group to campaign against deforestation, as this was affecting the water levels in the nearby dam that supplies water to Nairobi. They promoted reforestation, especially in areas around the dam, and planted tree seedlings to sell to individuals and tea factories, which are the largest consumers of firewood. 

Because biogas is one of the cleanest sources of energy and in line with their campaign against deforestation, the group has borrowed money to construct a biogas plant for their members. 

This way they will teach by example to conserve forests, have access to a cleaner and safer source of fuel, and save money previously used for charcoal and paraffin purchases. These savings, combined with their farm earnings, will allow them to repay the loan.

loans.use: To facilitate biogas construction.

loans.name: Timoteo

texts.en:
Timoteo is a 41-year-old married man and a father of six young children from Talibon, Bohol, Philippines. He is engaged in numerous businesses like hog raising, farming and motorcycle transport. These are the sources of his daily income which he uses to meet the needs of the family and the schooling of his children.
Timoteo is in need of additional capital to expand his business. He is requesting for a loan of 10000 PHP to buy feed for the pigs, fertilizer for the farm and fuel for the motorcycle. Through this loan, he will be able to reach his dream of improving his ventures. Moreover, he wants to keep sending his children to school for better learning and a bright future.

loans.use: to buy feed for the pigs, fertilizer for the farm and fuel for the motorcycle.

loans.name: Kuñ Guapa De 6 Group

texts.es:
El grupo lleva por nombre Kuña Guapa de 6, tiene 10 integrantes, quienes son todas de la ciudad de Caacupé. Ellas se han unido con el objetivo de trabajar todas juntas y de esa forma ayudarse las unas a las otras y por medio del grupo salir adelante.
Todas ellas desean poder superar la pobreza y dar a sus familias todo lo mejor. Una de estas mujeres es Carmen, quien vende comidas de todo tipo. Ella cuenta que tiene muy buena clientela ya que su sazón es muy buena. Cuenta que con mucho esfuerzo está saliendo adelante y quiere seguir trabajando.
Solicita este crédito para invertirlo en la compra de insumos para poder seguir haciendo sus alimentos. Cuenta que desea comprar verduras, condimentos, carnes y demás.
texts.en:
This group is called “Kuña Guapa de 6” and it has 10 members who are all from the city of Caacupé.  They have joined together in order to work as a group and help each other get ahead by means of their teamwork.  They all want to overcome poverty and give the best to their families.  

One of these women is Carmen who sells all types of food.  She says that she has a very good clientele because she prepares very tasty dishes.  She also relates that with much effort she’s getting ahead and wants to continue working.  She’s requesting this loan to buy supplies to continue preparing her dishes.  She says that she wants to buy vegetables, condiments, meats and others.

loans.use: to buy vegetables, condiments, meat and others.

loans.name: Kuña Ikatu Group

texts.es:
El Comité de Mujeres de nombre Kuña Ikatu está iniciándose en el 1er ciclo, en forma conjunta y solidaria dentro del programa. Además del trabajo independiente de cada una, también desarrollan actividades en forma conjunta  para recaudar fondos.
Esta es una historia muy conmovedora es la de la señora Rita que es la presidenta del comité quien se dedica a la venta ropas, y nos comenta que mediante el grupo pudo mejorar mucho en su negocio y de esa forma tener mejores ingresos. Todas ellas se han ayudado mucho y gracias a eso están saliendo adelante.
 La señora Rita solicita el crédito para la compra de prendas de verano de todo tipo, con lo cual desea poder surtir su local y seguir dando la variedad a la que están acostumbrados sus clientes.
texts.en: The “Kuña Ikatu” women’s committee is starting its first cycle as a mutually supportive group in the program.  In addition to each member’s individual work they also carry out group fund-raising activities.  This is a very moving story about Rita who is the committee president.  She sells clothes and she comments that thanks to the group she was able to improve much in her business and earn higher income that way.  All of them have helped each other out quite a bit and thanks to this they are moving forward.  Rita requests the loan to buy summer clothes of all types so that she can stock her stand and continue offering the kind of variety her customers have become accustomed to.

loans.use: to buy clothes to sell.

loans.name: Kuña Aty Group

texts.es:
El Comité de Mujeres de nombre kuña Aty se encuentra en el segundo ciclo con 9 integrantes, donde todas ellas se esfuerzan al máximo por salir adelante y de esa forma ayudar a sus familias.
La Sra. Nilda es miembro del grupo, ella se dedica a la venta de ropas, también a la venta de leche, y queso  nos comenta que gracias a estos trabajos está saliendo adelante. Es una persona muy sacrificada que desea progresar y salir adelante, para que de esa forma pueda seguir ayudando a su familia y a los suyos.
Solicita el crédito para la compra de leche y queso, también de algunas prendas, ya que desea poder surtirse y asi seguir ganándose el sustento del día a día.
texts.en: The “Kuña Aty” women’s committee is in its second cycle with nine members.  All of them strive to the maximum to get ahead and thus help their families.  Nilda is a group member.  She sells clothes, milk and cheese.  She comments that thanks to these jobs she’s getting ahead.  She’s a very self-sacrificing person who very much wants to get ahead and make progress in order to continue helping her family and loved ones.  She requests the loan to buy milk, cheese and also some articles of clothing because she wants to stock up to continue earning her daily sustenance.

loans.use: to buy clothes, milk and cheese to sell.

loans.name: Wangnigni-Nan Group

texts.fr: WANGNIGNI-NAN est un groupe de quatre personnes, dont les membres sont des amies. La représentante du groupe, Vidéhoun Pauline (dont la main est levée sur la photo), est âgée de 32 ans et est mariée à Simplice, un soudeur. Vidéhoun Pauline est mère de deux enfants tous scolarisés et sa charge. Vidéhoun Pauline vit ensemble avec son mari et ses enfants. Le couple assure ensemble les divers besoins du ménage. Vidéhoun Pauline n’a pas fréquenté l’école. Il y a quatre ans environs que Vidéhoun Pauline mène comme activité la vente de bouillie de maïs accompagné des beignets (faits à base de farine de blé). Vidéhoun Pauline exerce cette activité passionnément, ce qui lui permet de subvenir à ses besoins et à ceux de ses enfants. Vidéhoun Pauline s’approvisionne dans une ville du Bénin. Dans la quête de la satisfaction de sa clientèle, Vidéhoun Pauline sollicite un cinquième crédit avec les autres membres du groupe WANGNIGNI-NAN. Ce crédit leur servira à mieux répondre aux demandes de leur clientèle et à se faire plus de profits. Les crédits antérieurs ont été bien remboursés.
texts.en:
WANGNIGNI-NAN is a group of four friends. The group’s representative is Vidéhoun Pauline (with her hand raised in the photo). She is 32 years old and married to a welder named Simplice. Vidéhoun Pauline has two dependent children who both go to school. She lives with her husband and their children, and the couple handle the various household responsibilities together. 

Vidéhoun Pauline did not go to school. She started selling maize porridge and beignets made from wheat flour about four years ago. She is passionate about her activity, which allows her to support herself and her children. She buys her supplies in a city of Benin. 

To achieve customer satisfaction, Vidéhoun Pauline is seeking a fifth loan together with the other members of the group WANGNIGNI-NAN. This credit will help them to meet the needs of their customers and to bolster their profits. All previous loans were successfully repaid.

loans.use: to buy maize and wheat flour.

loans.name: Teofila

texts.en: Teofila is 55 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with three children. Teofila has a food/retail shop or sari-sari store that buys and sells canned goods, snacks, personal care products, home use products and beverages. She had this business for 16 years. She requested a loan of 4,000 PHP to buy stocks of canned goods, snacks and beverages. Teofila has been a member of HSPFI since 2011. In the future, Teofila hopes to improve her business for the education of her children.

loans.use: to buy stocks of canned goods, snacks and beverages.

loans.name: Logoiavailisa

texts.en: Logoiavailisa is 25 years old and married with two children. She has a small garden where she grows taro plants that she can sell in her community or at the market. She has been doing this for two years. Logoiavailisa needs a loan to buy equipment and to expand her garden. She has been a member of SBPD since 2011. Logoiavailisa will use the profits from her sales to pay her children's school fees.

loans.use: to buy shovels, bush knives, a wheelbarrow and gloves,

loans.name: Jennifer

texts.en: Jennifer  is  33 years old, married, has two children and lives in the Philippines. Jennifer  has a food/retail shop or sari-sari store that buys and sells canned goods, snacks, personal care products, home use products and beverages. She had this business for seven years. She requested a loan of  3,000 PHP to buy stocks of canned goods, snacks and beverages. Jennifer  has been a member of HSPFI since 2012. In the future, Jennifer hopes to improve her business for the education of her children.

loans.use: to buy stocks of canned goods, snacks and beverages.

loans.name: Rocio

texts.es:
Rocío, de 42 años es una mujer sencilla. Vive en compañía de Luis, su esposo desde hace 17 años. Ambos tienen 5 hijos a los cuales cuidan en la casa que compró hace 5 años. “Me ingenio para trabajar en cualquier cosa”, comenta Rocío, quien comienza con esta frase a comentar el apoyo que recibe. Sus actividades son diversas, durante el día se dedica al negocio de compra y venta de alfalfa, los que realiza en la plaza de su localidad, aunque en días donde recolecta gran cantidad de pasto, ya sea por ella misma o por terceros; los comercializa a la capital del país, donde obtiene buenas ganancias. Asimismo se dedica a la siembra de maíz, papa, trigo y alfa, en sus terrenos agrícolas, que los cuida con mucha dedicación, a pesar de las actividades que realiza. Paralelamente a ese trabajo, se dedica al cuidado de sus animales entre cuyes y conejos, los cuales comercializa a los clientes que llegan a su misma zona. Ahora desea, abocar todo su tiempo y esfuerzo en mejorar sus condiciones laborales para poder trabajar con más calma y tranquilidad, por ello comenzará a prepararse en los temas de agricultura y ganadería.  Ella pertenece al banco comunal “sicaya 2000” y este es el crédito número 10 con MFP, se siente feliz pues en este tiempo logró obtener muchas ganancias, todo gracias al apoyo económico que le brindan. Por ello promete cumplir con el pago de las cuotas. Además gusta de trabajar en su asociación, donde los integrantes son personas solidarias y trabajadoras.
Rocío, invertirá el dinero en la compra de fertilizantes naturales para nutrir sus sembríos de maíz y papa.
texts.en:
Rocío, 42, is an unassuming woman living with Luis, her husband for the last 17 years.  They have five children they care for in the house she bought five years ago.  Rocío says that she figures out ways to work at all sorts of things; this is how she started her comments about the support she gets.

Her activities are diverse.  During the day she buys and sells alfalfa in her local square although on days when she collects large amounts of alfalfa either on her own or from third parties she sells it in the nation’s capital where profits are good.  She also grows corn, potatoes, wheat and alfalfa on her farmland.  She cares for the crops with much dedication despite the other activities she does.  Alongside this business, she also raises animals like guinea pigs and rabbits that she sells to local customers.

She’d now like to focus all her time and energy into improving her working conditions so that she can work with more peace and tranquility which is why she’s going to start to learn about agriculture and animal husbandry.

She’s a member of the “Sicaya 2000” communal bank and this is MFP loan #10.  She feels happy because she’s earned good profits during this time thanks to the economic support she’s given.  Because of this she promises to make her installment payments.  Also, she likes working with her association because the members are supportive, hardworking people.  Rocío will use the money to buy natural fertilizers to nourish her corn and potato crops.

loans.use: to buy natural fertilizer.

loans.name: Patrisius

texts.en:
Patrisius is a 43-year-old tailor. He is married to Rovina, a 38-year-old housewife and has been blessed with five children: Mila, 14, who is attending first grade of senior high school; Adriana, 10, who is attending fifth grade of elementary school; Kristian, 9, who is attending third grade of elementary school; and Aprilia, 6, who is attending first grade of elementary school.
Patrisius has been involved in the tailoring business for almost 15 years. He is good at sewing many types of women's and men's clothing, including blouses, skirts, trousers and office uniforms. To complete an item of clothing, Patrisius spends up to two days. Patrisius rented a small flat to live in and to run the business from. 
At the moment, Patrisius gets many orders from his customers to sew office uniforms but he needs money to buy fabric and yarn in bulk. Therefore, Patrisius is requesting a loan from TLM amounting to IDR 4,750,000 to purchase those materials. Patrisius hopes to be successful in his business.

loans.use: to provide fabric and yarn in bulk.

loans.name: Juan Carlos

texts.es:
JUAN CARLOS tiene 30 años de edad de estado civil de union libre tiene dos hijos, vive con la esposa y con los hijos en la ciudad de Ventanas Provincia de los Ríos.

Es Integrante de la VRC los ÚLTIMOS SERAN LOS PRIMEROS, se encuentran ubicada en Recinto San Gabriel, pertenece al Cantón Ventanas se dedican a Labores Agrícolas y Pecuarias. 

JUAN CARLOS se dedica a la agricultura a la siembra de maíz, Solicita el crédito para comprar semillas, insecticidas, fertilizantes, urea, ranger. 

Con la ayuda del crédito podrá comprar productos agrícolas para los cultivos de maíz. Las compras lo hará en ventanas cada quince días. Los desafíos a los que se enfrenta son las plagas y los cultivos. El sueño es poder comprar un terreno y darles un mujor futuro para los hijos.

 En el tiempo libre le gusta jugar el boly.
texts.en:
Juan Carlos, 30, is in a common-law marriage and has two children.  He lives with his wife and children in the city of Ventanas in the province of Los Ríos.  He's a member of Los Últimos Serán los Primeros Communal Bank, located in the San Gabriel area of Ventanas Canton, where people make a living in agriculture and livestock.

Juan Carlos makes a living in agriculture growing corn.  He's requesting the loan to buy seeds, insecticide, fertilizer, urea, and pesticide (ranger).  With the help of the loan he'll be able to buy agricultural products for his corn crop.  He's going to make his purchases in Ventanas every two weeks.

The challenges he faces are pests and the crops.  His dream is to be able to buy a plot of land and give his children a better future.  In his free time he likes to play volleyball.

loans.use: to buy seeds, insecticide, fertilizer, urea, and pesticide

loans.name: Audelia Cecilia

texts.es:
Audelia, de 37 años de edad, es dueña de una pulpería, es madre de 4 hijos, pero solo mantiene al menor que tiene 10 años de edad. Empezó con su negocio vendiendo golosinas y helados con los ingresos obtenidos los iba invirtiendo en comprar otro tipos de productos pues de poco en poco fue formando su pulpería, buscando financiamiento. Tenía 20 años de edad. Su esposo trabaja en un carretón el llevando y trayendo cosas de esta manera ayuda con los gastos del hogar.
Está requiriendo el crédito para comprar arroz, azúcar, aceite, frijoles, pan , huevo, galletas, detergentes, jabones, sopas. Pues son productos que a diario le solicitan sus clientes y de los cuales necesitan mantener surtida su pulpería. El deseo de ella es lograr surtir su negocio con productos de alta demanda, ampliar más su pulpería para poder conseguir mejores ingresos que le permitan vivir de manera digna junto a su familia.
texts.en:
Audelia, 37, owns a grocery store.  She’s the mother of four children but still supports only the youngest, a ten-year-old.  She started her business selling sweets and ice-cream and with the income she earned she’d gradually buy other types of products and little by little set up a grocery store seeking financing.  She was 20-years-old.  Her husband works driving a cart moving things from here to there and helps with household expenses this way.

She needs the loan to buy rice, sugar, oil, beans, bread, eggs, cookies, detergent, soap and soup because these are products daily requested by customers and which she must have in stock in the grocery store.  Her wish is to stock the store with high-demand items, to enlarge the grocery store to be able to earn higher income to live a dignified life with her family.

loans.use: to buy stock merchandise for her store.

loans.name: Miguel Antonio

texts.es:
El señor, Miguel de 65 años, casado, padre de 5 hijos, originario de Granada. Es de oficio soldador tiene un pequeño taller de soldadura y  a la vez vende leche. Este oficio lo aprendió de su padre, quien lo llevaba a trabajar con él, esto le sirvió, adquirió experiencia. Con el tiempo se independizo y fue comprando sus propias herramientas, también pensó en busca otras formas de ingresos por eso decidió invertir en la venta de leche. Hoy en día sus hijos mayores le ayudan a dirigir el negocio.
Él está requiriendo financiamiento para comprar material de soldadura como hierro, perlines. Pues esto le ayudara a comprar material que necesita para completar unos pedidos que tiene que hacer, entre ellos elaboración de portones para escuelas. Él dice que una vez que cancele el préstamo desea invertir más en el negocio de venta de leche.
texts.en:
Miguel, 65, is married and the father of five children; he’s from Granada.  He’s a welder by profession and has a small welding shop; he also sells milk.  He learned the occupation from his father who would take him along to work and he gained experience this way.  In time, he became independent and started to buy his own tools.  He also thought of other ways to earn income which is how he decided to invest in milk sales.  Today, his older children help him run the business.

He needs financing to buy welding supplies like iron and purlines because it will help him buy the materials and supplies he needs to complete some pending orders he has, among which is manufacturing gates for schools.  He says that once he repays the loan he wants to invest more into the milk business.

loans.use: to buy welding supplies.

loans.name: San Cayetano Group

texts.es:
El Comité de Mujeres de nombre San Cayetano se destaca en su barrio por la unión que todas sus miembros tienen, todas ellas se esfuerzan dia a dia por salir adelante por medio de su trabajo. El deseo que tienen es de poder salir adelante, no solo en lo económico, sino también en lo personal.
Natalia, es parte de este grupo, ella se dedica a la costura  y venta de ropas, y dice que formo parte del grupo, ya que vio una gran oportunidad, no solo para ella sino también para su familia. Su meta es poder tener una gran tienda y el día de mañana también poder dar trabajo a las demás personas que necesiten.
 La señora Natalia solicita este préstamo para la compra de telas, hilos, gomas, botones, cierres, etc. Cuenta que este préstamo le será de gran ayuda en todo lo que ella anhela para sí y su familia
texts.en:
The “San Cayetano” women’s committee stands out in their neighborhood because of their unity; all the members strive daily to get ahead by means of their work.  Their wish is to be able to get ahead not only economically but personally too.

Natalia is a part of this group.  She works sewing and selling clothes.  She says that she joined this group because she saw a great opportunity in it not just for her but also for her family.  Her goal is to someday have a great store and to be able to employ others who are in need.
