Natalia is requesting this loan to buy fabric, thread, elastic, buttons, zippers, etc.  She relates that this loan will be of great help to her in everything she’s hoping for for her and her family.

loans.use: to buy fabric, thread, elastic, buttons, zippers, etc.

loans.name: Las Emprendedoras Group

texts.es:
El comite es un grupo muy activo y antiguo, que a pesar de tener     inconvenientes siempre saben salir adelante, el grupo se encuentra en el ciclo 12, tienen ahorros y gracias a su trabajo salen adelante.
La Sra. Perseveranda es la tesorera del grupo , y siempre sabe  llevar bien adelante su puesto , ella es lavandera, lava ropas de todos los vecinos en forma semanal y cuenta que con esto ella mantiene a su familia y sale adelante. Nos dice que su meta es tener su propio negocio con su esfuerzo y tambien gracias a la  Fundacion Paraguaya.
Perseveranda solicita el crédito para la compra de jabones en polvo, barra, suavizantes para prendas, etc, con los cuales podrá seguir lavando las prendas de sus clientes.
texts.en: This committee is a very active, longstanding group.  Despite occasional snags they know how to continue forward.  The group is in cycle 12.  They have savings and thanks to their work they get ahead.  Perseveranda is group treasurer and has always carried out her position well.  She’s a laundress; she washes clothes for all the neighbors weekly and she says that this is how she supports her family and gets ahead.  She says that her goal is to have her own business thanks to her own efforts and with help from Fundación Paraguaya.  Perseveranda is asking for a loan to buy powder detergent, bars of soap, fabric softener, etc. to continue washing clothes for her customers.

loans.use: to buy powder detergent, bars of soap, fabric softener, etc.

loans.name: Sinsindagbe 1 Group

texts.fr: SINSINDAGBE 1 est un groupe de cinq personnes, dont les membres sont liés par un lien de parenté. La représentante du groupe, Edwige (dont la main est levée sur la photo), est âgée de 28 ans et est mariée à Franck, un peintre. Le couple a deux enfants tous scolarisés et à leur charge. Edwige vit ensemble avec son mari et ses enfants. Le couple se partage les différentes charges des enfants. Edwige a arrêté l’école au niveau primaire. Il y a près de quatre ans que Edwige mène comme activité la vente de mèches et de produits de beauté à son domicile. Parallèlement à cette activité, Edwige vend des chaussures. Edwige exerce cette activité passionnément, ce qui lui permet de subvenir à ses besoins et à ceux de ses enfants. Edwige s’approvisionne dans une ville du Bénin. Dans la quête de la satisfaction de sa clientèle, Edwige sollicite un troisième crédit avec les autres membres du groupe SINSINDAGBE 1. Ce crédit leur servira à mieux répondre aux demandes de leur clientèle et à se faire plus de profits. Les crédits précédemment reçus ont été bien remboursés.
texts.en: SINSINDAGBE 1 is a group of five people, linked by family ties. The group's representative, Edwige (whose hand is raised in the photo) is 28 years old and married to Franck, a painter. The couple has two children, both in school and in their care. Edwige lives together with her husband and children. The couple shares the responsibility for the children. Edwige stopped school at the primary level. For nearly four years, Edwige has sold hair extensions and beauty products from her home. Along with this business, Edwige sells shoes. Edwige works in this business passionately, which allows her to provide for her needs and those of her children Edwige stocks up in a city in Benin. In order to satisfy her customers, Edwige is asking for a third loan with the other members of the SINSINDAGBE 1 group. They will use this loan to better respond to the demands of their customers and make a higher profit. Their previous loans were repaid in full.

loans.use: to buy hair extensions and beauty products.

loans.name: La Cocha 7 Group

texts.es:
La cocha 7 es un grupo de tres personas emprendedoras que buscan cumplir con sus objetivos y uno de ellos es sacar adelante y mejorar la calidad de vida de sus familias. De este grupo la presidenta es Elvia ya que es una mujer alegre emprendedora, trabajadora y muy responsable.

Elvia y sus compañeras tienen puestos de ventas de comida, negocio que le ayuda en el sustento de su hogar. Actualmente los precios de los víveres estan subiendo constantemente y Elvia y sus compañeras necesitan aprovechar comprando lo que necesitan para sus negocios y seguir brindando el buen servicio a la clientela. El via va a invertir su préstamo en la compra de quintales de arroz, fréjol, arbeja, lenteja.

Elvia sueña en tener unrestaurant grande y brindar un mejor servicio a sus clientes.
En la fotografía Elvia es la señora que está en la mitad.
texts.en:
La Cocha 7 is a group of three entrepreneurs who seek to fulfill their goals. One of the goals is to move forward and improve the quality of life for their families. 

The president of the group is Elvia, because she is a happy and entrepreneurial woman, hard-working and very responsible. Elvia and her partners have food stalls, a business that helps in supporting the household. Currently, food prices are rising constantly and Elvia and her partners need to buy what they need for their businesses to continue providing good service to customers.

Elvia will invest her loan in the purchase of sacks of rice, beans, peas, and lentils. Elvia dreams about having a big restaurant to provide a better service to her customers. In the picture, Elvia is the one in the middle.

loans.use: to buy sacks of rice, beans, peas, and lentils, because prices are rising constantly and she wants her business to continue operating.

loans.name: Daniel Eduardo

texts.es:
DANIEL EDUARDO tiene 20 años de edad es soltero no tiene hijos, vive con la mamá en la ciudad de Ventanas provincia de los Ríos.

Es Integrante de la VRC los ÚLTIMOS SERAN LOS PRIMEROS, se encuentran ubicada en Recinto San Gabriel, pertenece al Cantón Ventanas se dedican a Labores Agrícolas y Pecuarias. 

DANIEL EDUARDO se dedica a la agricultura a la siembra de maíz. Solicita el crédito para comprar semillas, insecticidas, fertilizantes, urea, ranger. 

Con la ayuda del crédito podrá comprar los insumos y mayor producción. Las compras lo hará en ventanas cada 15 días. Los desafíos a los que se enfrenta son las plagas. El sueño es formar una familia y construiruna casa. En el tiempo libre le gusta trabajar y jugar el boly.
texts.en:
Daniel Eduardo, 20, is single and has no children.  He lives with his mother in the city of Ventanas, Los Ríos Province.  He’s a member of the “Los Últimos Seran Los Primeros” (The Last Will Be First) communal bank located in Recinto San Gabriel that belongs to Ventanas Canton; they work in agriculture and animal husbandry.  

Daniel Eduardo grows corn and is requesting the loan to buy seeds, insecticide, fertilizer, urea and Ranger [brand of herbicide].  With help from the loan he will be able to buy the supplies and increase production.  He will do his purchases in Ventanas every two weeks.  The challenge he faces is crop pests.  His dream is to form a family and to build a house.  In his free time he likes to work and to play volleyball.

loans.use: to buy seeds, insecticide, fertilizer, urea and Ranger.

loans.name: Digna Piedad

texts.es:
Digna tiene 22 años, es una persona trabajadora, muy sencilla, humilde y sobre todo muy responsable en el trabajo y sus estudios. Digna vive con su familia en Latacunga.

Digna se dedica a la confección de jeans, este negocio ayuda a su familia en los gastos del hogar y para ella le ayuda para sus estudios. Digna al momento tiene una máquina de cocer que está en malas condiciones y que al momento de producir sus prendas se demora ya que tiene que estar corrigiendo los errores, y ella quiere darle un mejor servicio y en menor tiempo al cliente, es por eso que solicita un crédito el cual va a ser invertido en la compra de una máquina overlook la cual mejorará la calidad de cocido y optimizará mucho tiempo, esta inversión permitirá a Digna obtener más clientes y por ende más ingresos.

Digna sueña en tener un taller de confección grande, donde pueda contratar personal para llegar a ser una microempresaria grande.
texts.en: Digna, 22, is a hardworking, unassuming, humble and above all very responsible person at work and at school.  Digna lives with her family in Latacunga.  She manufactures jeans.  This business helps her family meet household expenses and helps her pay for her schooling.  At the moment, Digna has a sewing machine that’s not in the best shape and she runs into many delays when trying to make clothes because she wastes time correcting errors.  She wants to provide better, quicker customer service and this is why she’s asking for a loan to buy an overlock sewing machine that will improve the quality of the stitching and optimize time quite a bit.  This investment will allow Digna to acquire more customers and thus higher income.  Digna dreams with having a large clothes making workshop where she can hire staff and become a major micro businesswoman.

loans.use: to buy an overlock sewing machine and to buy denim.

loans.name: Las Mercedes Group

texts.es:
En la ciudad de Luque, 15 mujeres se han unido con el deseo de salir adelante y dejar atras todo lo que les impide crecer por medio de su trabajo y ayudandose las unas a las otras.
La Sra.Marta, una de las miembros, se dedica a la costura, trabaja por pedido, es separada, tiene 3 hijos menores que viven con ella. Ella solicito el credito  para la compra de tela, hilo y todos los accesorios que implica la costura, ella desea abrir un pequeño salon frente a su casa o en el centro de luque, para la venta de las prendas que ella elabora, para que de esa forma pueda seguir trabajando y saliendo adelante y tambien seguir ganando el sustento para sus hijos.
texts.en:
In the city of Luque, 15 women have united with the desire to get ahead and leave behind all that holds them back by working and helping each other. 

Marta, one of the members, makes a living sewing, working by order. She is separated and has three dependent children who live with her. She is requesting this loan to buy fabric, thread and all the accessories needed to sew. She wishes to open her own locale in the front of her house or in the center of Luque to sell the garments that she makes. In this way she will be able to continue working, moving forward and also earning enough to provide for her children.

loans.use: to buy fabric, thread, etc.

loans.name: Orly Lenyn

texts.es:
ORLY LENYN tiene 28 años de edad es soltero no tiene hijos, vive con los padres en la ciudad de Ventanas Provincia de los Ríos.

Es Integrante de la VRC los ÚLTIMOS SERAN LOS PRIMEROS, se encuentran ubicada en Recinto San Gabriel, pertenece al Cantón Ventanas se dedican a Labores Agrícolas y Pecuarias. 

ORLY LENYN se dedica a la agricultura a la siembra de maíz. Solicita el crédito para comprar urea, semillas, insecticidas, fertilizantes, urea, ranger. 

Con la ayuda del crédito espera duplicar las ganancias. Las compras lo hará en ventanas cada 15 días. Los desafíos a los que se enfrenta son las plagas. El sueño es comprar una casa y un terreno. En el tiempo libre le gusta trabajar y jugar el boly.
texts.en:
Orly Lenyn is 28 years old, is single and has no children. He lives with his parents in the city of Ventanas in the province of Los Rios. 

He is a member of the VRC Los Ultimos Seran Los Primeros which is located in the Recinto San Gabriel, which belongs to the Ventanas canton. They make a living in agriculture and livestock. 

Orly Lenyn makes a living planting corn. He is requesting the loan to buy urea, seeds, insecticides, fertilizers and round-up. 

With the help of this loan he hopes to duplicate his earnings. He will make his purchases in Ventanas every 15 days. The challenges that he faces are the plagues. His dream is to buy a house and loan. In his free time he likes to work and play volleyball.

loans.use: to buy urea, seeds, insecticides, fertilizers and round-up.

loans.name: Adoubossou Group

texts.fr: Le groupe ADOUBOSSOU est formé de quatre personnes qui sont des soeurs. La représentante de ce groupe, nommée Déyénin Suzanne, est celle dont la main est levée sur la photo. C’est la quatrième fois que ce groupe sollicite l’appui financier de ALIDé en vue d’élever le niveau de leur activité. MLariée à un certain Léonard, Déyénin Suzanne est âgée de 40 ans. Déyénin Suzanne est mère de quatre enfants tous scolarisés et trois à sa charge. Le couple vit ensemble avec les enfants et assure ensemble, les diverses charges de la maison. Déyénin Suzanne n’a pas fréquenté l’école. Il y a près deux ans que Déyénin Suzanne exerce comme activité, la vente des ustensiles de cuisine à son domicile ; ce qui lui permet de répondre sans grande difficulté à ses besoins. Déyénin Suzanne s’approvisionne dans une ville du Bénin. Dans le souci de mieux répondre aux exigences de sa clientèle, Déyénin Suzanne désire renforcer et diversifier son activité. Pour ce faire, Déyénin Suzanne sollicite, ensemble avec les autres membres du groupe ADOUBOSSOU, un quatrième crédit auprès de ALIDé. Les prêts antérieurs ont été bien remboursés.
texts.en: The ADOUBOSSOU group is made up of four sisters. The representative of the group, named Déyénin Suzanne, is the one whose hand is raised in the photo. This is the fourth time that the group is asking for financial support from Alidé with an eye to raising the level of their business. Married to a man named Leonard, Déyénin Suzanne is 40 years old. Déyénin Suzanne is the mother of four children, all of whom are in school, and three of whom are in her care. The couple lives together with the children and takes care of the household responsibilities together. Déyénin Suzanne did not attend school. For nearly two years, Déyénin Suzanne has worked in this business, selling kitchen utensils from her home; this allows her to respond without much difficulty to her needs. Déyénin Suzanne stocks up in a city in Benin. In an effort to better respond to her customers' demands, Déyénin Suzanne wants to reinforce and diversify her business. To do this, Déyénin Suzanne is asking for, together with the other members of the ADOUBOSSOU group, a fourth loan from Alidé. Their previous loans were repaid in full.

loans.use: to buy cooking utensils.

loans.name: Luisa Emilia

texts.es:
Luisa, de 54 años de edad, es comerciante, se dedica a la venta de comidas, actividad que realiza desde muy joven. Cuando vendía de manera ambulante , salía a recorrer los centros, plazas , barrios a vender frescos y enchiladas. Hoy en día tiene su negocio de comideria donde las personas se pueden dar gusto de saborear un delicioso arroz con pollo casero, frescos naturales así como bebidas típicas. En esta actividad la ayudan sus nietas e hijas. 
Gracias a su gran esfuerzo y arduo trabajo ha logrado hacer buenos clientes que le compran a diario.
Ella está solicitando un crédito para comprar arroz, azúcar, aceite, frijoles al por mayor pues son parte de la materia primas que a diario utiliza para vender su comida, además asi podrá conseguir un mejor precio y mantendrá los costos para vender a un precio más accesible a su clientela. Ella espera seguir creciendo y expandir su negocio de comideria y mejorar la infraestructura de su casa.
texts.en:
Luisa, 54, is a merchant; she sells food, an activity she’s done since she was very young.  When she used to sell from place to place she’d go to shopping centers, squares and neighborhoods to sell blended fruit drinks and enchiladas.  Today she has an eatery where people can treat themselves to delicious home-made chicken with rice, blended natural fruit beverages as well as traditional beverages.  Her granddaughters and daughters help her with this activity.  Thanks to her great effort and hard work she’s managed to secure regular customers that buy from her every day.

She’s asking for a loan to buy rice, sugar, oil and beans at wholesale because they are part of the raw materials she uses every day to prepare the food she sells.  She will be able to get better prices this way and be able to keep her prices affordable for her customers.  She hopes to continue growing and expanding the business and will make improvements to the infrastructure of her house.

loans.use: to buy rice, sugar, oil and beans at wholesale.

loans.name: Los 3 Reyes Group

texts.es:
El grupo los 3 reyes es de la ciudad de Luque, tiene 12 integrantes, donde todas ellas son amigas y vecinas de esa ciudad. Ellas se esfuerzan y de esa forma ayudan a sus familias a ir mejorando.
La Sra.Liz, trabaja en un copetin hace ya un tiempo, esta casada con el señor Netor, tienen una hija, por quien luchan incansablemente para darle un futuro digno y sin privaciones. Ella solicita el credito  para la compra de diferentes tipos de cosas para surtir su copetin, como ser bebidas, galletitas, golosinas y demás. Agradece la oportunidad que recibe, ya que este crédito le será de mucha ayuda.
texts.en: The “Tres Reyes” (Three Kings) group is from the city of Luque; it has 12 members.  All of them are friends and neighbors from that city.  They strive to help their families and to make progress.  Liz has worked in a snack bar for some time now.  She’s married to Netor and they have a daughter they strive for tirelessly to provide a future that’s dignified and want free.  She’s requesting the loan to buy various things like beverages, cookies, snacks and others to stock her snack bar.  She’s grateful for the opportunity she’s getting because this loan will be of great help.

loans.use: to buy beverages, cookies, snacks and others.

loans.name: Mujeres Unidas Group

texts.es:
El comité se encuentra en el Decimo Cuarto ciclo con 18  integrantes. Cada una con sus respectivas actividades productivas, son muy unidas responsables y solidarias entre ellas.
La Directora es la Sra. Porfiria quien tiene una despensa para ayudar a generar ingresos en su familia.  Cuenta que su negocio empezó con algo muy pequeño y con poco dinero, pero después gracias a su trabajo fue creciendo y hoy en día ya tiene muy buena clientela y esta saliendo adelante. Cuenta que su sueño es poder seguir trabajando y de esa forma seguir ayudando a su familia y a los suyos.
Solicita el crédito para la compra de insumos de primera necesidad para poder seguir con su negocio. Desea comprar verduras, productos enlatados, bebidas, lácteos, carnes y demás.
texts.en: The committee is in its 14th cycle with 18 members each with her own respective productive activity; they are very united and mutually supportive among themselves.  The leader is Porfiria who has a grocery store to help generate family income.  She relates that the business started out quite small with little money but thanks to her work it gradually grew and today has a well-established regular clientele and is getting ahead.   She says that her dream is to be able to continue working to help her family and loved ones that way.  She requests the loan to buy basic staples to stay in business.  She will buy vegetables, canned goods, beverages, dairy products, meat and others.

loans.use: to buy vegetables, canned goods, beverages, dairy products, meat and others.

loans.name: Oloroun Shoco Group

texts.fr: OLOROUN SHOCO est un groupe de quatre personnes, dont les membres résident dans le même quartier au Bénin. La représentante du groupe, Raïmath (dont la main est levée sur la photo), est âgée de 35 ans et est mariée à un certain Ibrahim. Le couple a trois enfants tous scolarisés et à leur charge. Raïmath et son mari vivent ensemble avec leurs enfants et assurent ensemble les différentes charges de la maison. Raïmath a peu fréquenté l’école. Il y a près de quatre ans que Raïmath mène comme activité la vente des cotons et des éponges par le système de distribution. Raïmath exerce cette activité passionnément, ce qui lui permet de subvenir à ses besoins et à ceux de ses enfants. Raïmath s’approvisionne dans une ville du Bénin. Dans la quête de la satisfaction de sa clientèle, Raïmath sollicite un premier crédit avec les autres membres du groupe OLOROUN SHOCO. Ce crédit leur servira à mieux répondre aux demandes de leur clientèle et à se faire plus de profits.
texts.en: OLOROUN SHOCO is a group of four people who live in the same area in Benin. The group's representative, Raïmath (whose hand is raised in the photo) is 35 years old and married to a man named Ibrahim. The couple has three children, all in school and in their care. Raïmath and her husband live together with their children and together provide for the various needs of the household. Raïmath attended a little bit of school. For nearly four years, Raïmath has been selling cotton balls and sponges by distribution. Raïmath works passionately, which allows her to meet her needs and those of her children. Raïmath stocks up in a city in Benin. In seeking to satisfy the demands of her customers, Raïmath is asking for a first loan with the other members of the OLOROUN SHOCO group. This loan will let be used to better respond to their customers' needs and to make more profits.

loans.use: to buy cotton balls and sponges.

loans.name: Emprendiendo Con Esperanza Group

texts.es:
Este Banco Comunal se llama “Emprendedores con Esperanza” está conformado por 17 emprendedores quienes se dedican a diferentes rubros, entre los cuales se encuentran; venta de pasteles, venta de carbón, almacén, venta de ropa, venta de ensaladas surtidas, productos de belleza, servicios entre otros. Todos ellos pertenecientes a la ciudad de Linares.
Margarita presidenta del grupo del Banco Comunal, quien en la foto se encuentra de pie en primera fila, ocupando el segundo lugar de derecha a izquierda, viste una chaqueta de color negra, su cabello lo usa suelto y es de color castaño oscuro.
Ella se dedica  al rubro de venta de carbón, desde hace 5 años. Comenta que para la temporada de verano comenzara a trabajar con frutas con arándano, trabaja de lunes a domingos desde su casa y su horario de trabajo lo distribuye de acuerdo a su disponibilidad.
La mercadería la compra en la ciudad de Linares en bodegas y mercado de la ciudad a bajo costo, por lo tanto conveniente económicamente.
Con el crédito comprará carbón y bolsas para abastecer  su negocio.
Una de las metas de Margarita es crecer con su negocio para generar mayores ingresos, así con esto optar a una mejor calidad de vida.
Margarita vive junto a sus dos hijos de 11 y 6 años de edad, quienes se encuentran estudiando. Sus sueños a nivel laboral es tener más carbón y agregar leña a su negocio para mayores ingresos, y a nivel familiar son esperar a que sus hijos terminen de estudiar y a futuro obtengan un titulo profesional, y así ver su tarea cumplida.
Ella está muy contenta y agradecida de la oportunidad brindada por Fondo Esperanza, ya que le permitirá invertir en su negocio. Comenta que las capacitaciones han sido fundamentales para su negocio y también para su desarrollo personal, ya que ha aprendido a organizar y distribuir de mejor manera sus ingresos e inversiones. Respecto al grupo del cual forma parte se siente muy cómoda ya que existe comunicación y solidaridad.
Linares es un importante centro urbano de la región del Maule, ubicado en la zona centro del país. En esta zona se desarrolla de manera importante la producción agrícola y también vitivinícola sobresaliendo en el ámbito de las exportaciones. Destacan los cultivos de cereales (arroz, trigo, maíz y avena), hortalizas (remolacha, repollo, lechuga y acelga y legumbres) y frutas. Linares es la principal provincia productora de arroz, en Chile; de hecho, el 78% de la producción nacional de este cereal se da en esta provincia, especialmente en la comuna de Parral.
texts.en:
This communal bank, called Emprendedores con Esperanza, is made up of 17 entrepreneurs who make their livings in different areas, including cake sales, charcoal sales, department store, clothing sales, mixed salad sales, beauty products, services, and others.  All of them are in the city of Linares.

In the photo, Margarita, the president of the communal bank, is standing in the first row, second from the right, wearing a black jacket.  She's wearing her dark-brown hair loose.

She has worked in the area of charcoal sales for five years.  She comments that for the summer season she'll begin working with fruits, with blueberries.  She works from Monday through Sunday from her house, and she arranges her schedule according to her availability.  She buys her merchandise in shops and the city market in the city of Linares at low prices, which is economically advantageous.

With the loan she'll buy charcoal and bags to supply her business.  One of Margarita's goals is to grow with the business to generate more income to have a better quality of life.

Margarita lives with her two children, ages 11 and 6, who are students.  Her dreams for work are to have more charcoal and to add firewood to her business for more income.  Her dreams for her family are for her children to finish their studies and in the future get professional degrees, and so see her work completed.

She's very happy about and grateful for the opportunity from Fondo Esperanza because it will allow her to invest in her business.  She comments that the trainings have been fundamental for her business as well as for her personal development because she has learned to organize and better distribute her income and investments.  With regard to her group, she feels very comfortable because there's communication and solidarity.

Linares is an important urban center in the Maule region, located in the central part of the country.  In this area agriculture and wine production are important and stand out in the area of exports.  The production of grains (rice, wheat, corn, and oats), vegetables (beets, cabbage, lettuce, chard, and legumes), and fruit stands out.  Linares is the main rice-producing province in Chile; in fact, 78% of the country's production of this grain comes from this province, especially in the town of Parral.

loans.use: to buy charcoal and bags to supply her business

loans.name: Maria Esperanza

texts.es:
María, está solicitando un nuevo préstamo para mejorar el negocio, comprándose los materiales de costura que son más utilizados en la sastrería, se comprara variedad de telas de diferentes colores, botones, ciper, y demás productos poder tener una mejor capacidad y salir con los pedidos.
Con el préstamo anterior tuvo un efecto positivo, ya que logro crear nuevos clientes, mantuvo una buena producción de prendas de vestir, esto le ha permitido poder tener el trabajo para generar las fuentes de ingreso para su hogar.
texts.en: María’s asking for a new loan to improve the business buying the sewing supplies she uses the most in her tailor shop.  She will buy a variety of fabrics in different colors, buttons, zippers and other products to have larger capacity and fill orders.   Her previous loan had a positive effect because she succeeded in acquiring new customers; she kept up a good level of clothes production which allowed her to have work to generate household income.

loans.use: Compra de telas, botones, ciper.

loans.name: Ricardo Rodolfo

texts.es:
RICARDO RODOLFO tiene 32 años de edad de estado civil unión libre tiene una hija, vive con la esposa y con la hija en Ventanas Provincia de los Ríos.

Es Integrante de la VRC los ÚLTIMOS SERAN LOS PRIMEROS, se encuentran ubicada en Recinto San Gabriel, pertenece al Cantón Ventanas se dedican a Labores Agrícolas y Pecuarias. 

RICARDO RODOLFO se dedica a la agricultura a la siembra de maíz. Solicita el crédito para comprar insumos, ranger, urea, líquido para la maleza. Con la ayuda del crédito podrá comprar los fertilizantes para los cultivos.

Las compras las realzará en la ciudad de Ventanas. El sueño es tener un terreno y una casa con un negocio. En el tiempo libre le gusta jugar indor, y boli.
texts.en:
Ricardo Rodolfo, 32, is in a common law relationship and has a daughter; he lives with his wife and daughter in Ventanas, Los Ríos Province.  He’s a member of the “Los Últimos Seran Los Primeros” (The Last Will Be First) communal bank located in Recinto San Gabriel that belongs to Ventanas Canton; they work in agriculture and animal husbandry.  

Ricardo Rodolfo grows corn.  He’s requesting the loan to buy supplies, Ranger [brand of herbicide], urea and weed killer.  With help from the loan he will be able to buy the fertilizers for his crops.  He will make his purchases in the city of Ventanas.  His dream is to own land and a house with a business.  In his free time he enjoys playing indoor soccer and volleyball.

loans.use: to buy supplies, Ranger, urea and weed killer.

loans.name: Otila

texts.en: Otilia is a 33 year old woman who is married with 2 children. She has a small bingo business. She has had this business for 3 years. Otilia needs a loan to purchase more equipment that will be used for her business. She will use her profits to save money for her family needs. Otilia joined SPBD in 2010 in order to gain access to financial services.

loans.use: to purchase a new bingo game and bingo papers,

loans.name: Bertha Alexandra

texts.es:
Bertha tiene 39 años, se describe como una persona alegre, respetuosa, amable y de muy buen caracter. Bertha vive con su esposo y su hijo en Machachi muy cerca de Latacunga.

Bertha se dedica a la crianza de cerdos, se dedicaba ayudandole a su mamá y empezó a tener su propio capital y decidió comprar sus propios chanchitos. Al momento Bertha necesita ampliar los corrales de sus chanchos para incrementar el número de cerditos, ahora que va a comprar crías y necesita separarles a los grandes.

Bertha sueña en tener unas chancheras grandes para tener bastantes cerdos ya que su sueño es ser distribuidora al por mayor.
texts.en: Bertha, 39, describes herself as a cheerful, respectful, kind woman of very good character.  She lives with her husband and son in Machachi very near Latacunga.  Bertha raises pigs.  She used to help her mother and started to earn her own capital and decided to buy her own piglets.  At the moment, Bertha needs to enlarge the pigsties so that she can raise a larger number of piglets.  She’s going to buy litters and needs to separate them from the adults.  Bertha dreams with having large pigsties in order to have many pigs since her dream is to become a wholesaler.

loans.use: to repair the pigsties and to buy litters of pink pigs.

loans.name: Jose Amadeo

texts.es:
José, está decidido por un préstamo continuando con la preparación del trabajo agrícola, se comprara los materiales como el abono, herbicidas, semillas, ya que se dispone a trabajar el cultivo de pipián y maíz, este préstamo le servirá para que él se mantenga con todo lo necesario para realizar su trabajo. 
En su préstamo anterior, logro comprarse lo necesario con los fondos prestados, teniendo un efecto positivo ya que hizo la respectiva siembra, hoy quiere realizarla en manzana y media de terreno, su familia ha mantenido un buen nivel en lo económico, su producción de maíz estuvo bastante aceptable.
texts.en: José has opted for another loan to continue doing his agricultural work.  He will buy supplies like manure, herbicide and seeds because he’s planning on planting squash and corn.  This loan will help him have everything he needs to do his work.  He was able to use the previous loan to buy what he needed and the effect was positive in that he was able to plant.  Today, he will be planting one and a half manzanas [Central American unit of land measurement] of land.  His family has maintained a good economic level and his corn crop yield was quite acceptable.

loans.use: to buy manure, herbicide and seeds.

loans.name: Marichu

texts.en:
This is Marichu, 29, a resident of Manila, Philippines. She is a mother to her children. She, together with her children, manage their household while operating the business. She works hard to provide income for their everyday expenses.  

Marichu operates a resale business. What she basically does is buy used general merchandise from wholesalers, then sells it for a little profit. Products can range from furniture to household appliances and like products. Customers are attracted due to the low sales prices and the many options they are offered. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community.  She earns a minimum of Php2000 in sales every week.

To help continue her business operation she is requesting a Php20,000 loan. She will utilize the loan to buy a larger quantity and variety of products to expand her inventory. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business.  

Marichu dreams of being able to give her all her children a good high quality education. She also hopes to have a good life through her hard work in her business. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week. This is where she can draw strength and inspiration from her studies in the word of God.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the word of God, build social capital, and pay micro-finance loans.

loans.use: To pay for additional stocks of supplies and products needed in her business.

loans.name: Marie Rose

texts.en:
Marie Rose is 45 years old and is married with 4 children between the ages of 6 and 15 years old. She owns a business selling cows. She has been in this business for two years. She works from 7 am until 4 pm every day except on the weekend. 

Marie Rose has requested a Kiva loan via Vision Finance Company in order to buy cows for resale. With any profits, she will be able to renovate her house and invest in her business.

loans.use: To buy more cows for resale.

loans.name: Mayra Jaida

texts.es:
Mayra es una joven madre de 25 años, su pequeño tiene 4 años y es el regalo más importante que Dios le ha podido dar, ya que es su motor para vivir y seguir luchando cada día, ya que el padre de su pequeño la abandono y ela se ha convertido en madre y padre para su hijo. Su vivienda se ubica en el distrito de Santiago, Ica, Perú. El distrito de Santiago se caracteriza por tener un clima cálido y acogedor, asimismo desarrolla  la agricultura en especial el cultivo de algodón, uva, esparrago, entre otros. Mayra es una mujer muy trabajadora, pero cuando tiene un tiempito libre le gusta mucho pasear con su pequeña y en ocasiones ver televisión, asimismo le encanta disfrutar de uno de sus platillos favoritos el cual es el riquísimo “Juane”.

Día a día Mayra trabaja como obrera en un fundo agrícola de su distrito, ella trabaja alrededor de 8 horas al día, y con el fruto de su trabajo puede solventar los gastos de su hogar; ella cree que le va bien en su trabajo porque es muy responsable y sobre todo porque quiere salir adelante y ser un orgullo para su hijo.

Mayra está muy agradecida con los prestatarios kiva ya que gracias a la ayuda que le han brindado ella podrá realizar la compra de ventanas y puertas para su vivienda ya que poco a poco la está construyendo de material noble y actualmente sus ventanas son de cartones y plástico, así ella podrá brindarle una mejor calidad de vida a su familia y poder seguir luchando y trabajando  cada día para poder hacer realidad sumas grande sueño:” poder darle una buena educación a su hijo y poder estudiar una carrera universitaria”.
texts.en:
Mayra, 25, is a young mother.  Her little boy is four-years-old and the greatest gift God could have given her; he’s her reason to live and to continue striving daily since his father abandoned them and she’s become both mother and father for her son.  Her house is located in the city of Ica’s Santiago district in Peru.  Santiago district is noted for its hot, welcoming climate.  Agriculture, especially cotton, grapes and asparagus, among others is also common here.  Mayra is a very hardworking woman but whenever she has free time available she likes going out strolling with her little one and occasionally to watch television.  She also enjoys one of her favorite dishes, the very delicious “Juanes.” [Seasoned rice wrapped in a green bijao leaf. Seasoning typically includes turmeric and cumin, giving the rice a warm flavor and a yellowish color. Most juanes also contain a small piece of chicken, a slice of egg and an olive or two]

Mayra works day to day as a day laborer on a large agricultural estate.  She works around 8 hours daily and is able to cover household expenses with the fruits of her labor.  She believes she does well at work because she’s very responsible and above all because she wants to get ahead and be her son’s pride.

Mayra is very grateful to Kiva lenders because thanks to the support they’ve given her she will be able to buy doors and windows for her house since she’s gradually building it out of substantial materials.  Her windows are currently cardboard and plastic.  She’ll be able to provide her family with better quality of life this way and continue striving and working daily towards making her greatest dream reality: to give her son a good education and to be able to study a university career.

loans.use: to buy doors and windows.

loans.name: Kuña Katupyry Group

texts.es:
Kuña Katupyry,  se denomina el excelente grupo de mujeres de  la ciudad de Itá, oficialmente el comité está  trabajando muy a gusto ya en el 2° ciclo, en forma conjunta y solidaria dentro del programa.
Fredesvinda forma parte del grupo, y comenta que por medio de la venta de prendas de todo tipo ella está ayudando a su familia y están saliendo adelante. Cuenta que gracias a la amabilidad que tiene con sus clientes esta ganado más terreno y así gana a muchos más.
Fredesvinda solicita el crédito para la compra de prendas de todo tipo, en especial de verano, ya que se acerca el calor y quiere poder surtirse.
texts.en:
Kuña Katupyry is the name of the excellent group of women in the city of Itá.  Officially the group is working very happily in its second cycle, in unison and solidarity within the program.

Fredesvinda is part of the group, and she comments that by selling all types of clothing she's helping her family and they're getting ahead.  She says that thanks to the kind relationship she has with her customers she's gaining more ground and this way she'll get more customers.

Fredesvinda is requesting the loan to buy all types of garments, especially for summer, because the heat is coming and she wants to be able to stock up.

loans.use: to buy summer clothing to sell

loans.name: Marcos Wilfrido

texts.es:
MARCOS WILFRIDO tiene 34 años de edad es soltero tiene un hijo, vive con la mamá y con el hijo en la ciudad de Ventanas Provincia de los ríos.

Es Integrante de la VRC los ÚLTIMOS SERAN LOS PRIMEROS, se encuentran ubicada en Recinto San Gabriel, pertenece al Cantón Ventanas se dedican a Labores Agrícolas y Pecuarias.

MARCOS WILFRIDO se dedica a la agricultura a la siembra de maíz. Solicita el crédito para  comprar  insumos, urea, ranger, líquido mata monte.

Con la ayuda del credito podrá comprar los fertilizantes. Las compras las realizarán en la ciudad de ventanas.

El sueño es tener un negocio que genere más ingresos. En el tiempo libre le gusta jugar el basquet y el indor.
texts.en:
Marcos Wilfrido, 34, is single and has one child.  He lives with the mother and his son in the city of Ventanas in the province of Los Ríos.  He's a member of Los Últimos Serán los Primeros Communal Bank located in the San Gabriel area of Ventanas Canton, where people make a living in agriculture and livestock.

Marcos Wilfrido works in agriculture growing corn.  He's requesting the loan to buy inputs, urea, pesticide (ranger), and liquid weedkiller.  With the help of the loan he'll be able to buy the fertilizers.  He's going to make his purchases in the city of Ventanas.

His dream is to have a business that generates more income.  In his free time he likes to play basketball and indoor soccer.

loans.use: to buy inputs, urea, pesticide, and liquid weedkiller

loans.name: Hermina

texts.en:
Hermina is 51 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with 1 child. 
Hermina provides motorcycle services with her husband as the driver. She has had this business for 8 years. She requested a loan for 5,000 to pay for the maintenance.
Hermina has been a member of HSPFI since 2012.  In the future,Hermina hopes to improve her services.

loans.use: to pay for maintenance on her motorcycle

loans.name: Pahke

texts.en:
Pashke is forty-six and has three children who she raises on her own. Her husband immigrated some years ago and never came back to his family and never provided any financial assistance. Her family lives in a little town in central Albania. Pashke said that it has been extremely difficult financially for all of them. Five years ago she started selling used clothes and other accessories in the local market hoping to bring home a little income. 

She’s been working very hard, yet the living conditions are very poor. She and all her family live in a one-room rental apartment.  Despite this, she remains positive.

Pashke is requesting a loan now to buy more inventory of used clothes to resell, and is praying that lenders will help her financially.

loans.use: To buy more inventory of used clothes to resell

loans.name: Juan Alfredo

texts.es:
JUAN ALFREDO tiene 32 años de edad es soltero no tiene hijos, vive con la esposa en la ciudad de ventanas Ptovincia de los Ríos.

Es Integrante de la VRC los ÚLTIMOS SERAN LOS PRIMEROS, se encuentran ubicada en Recinto San Gabriel, pertenece al Cantón Ventanas se dedican a Labores Agrícolas y Pecuarias. 

 JUAN ALFREDO se dedica a la siembras de maíz. Solicita el crédito para comprar fertilizantes, insecticidas, ranger, urea. Con la ayuda del crédito para comprar lo neceesario para las siembras.

Las compras lo hará en Ventanas. El sueño es poder cultivar mucho maíz. En el tiempo libre le gusta jugar futbool y boly.
texts.en:
Juan Alfredo, 32, is single and has no children; he lives with his wife in the city of Ventanas, Los Ríos Province.  He’s a member of the “Los Últimos Serán Los Primeros” (The Last will be First) communal bank located in Recinto San Gabriel belonging to Ventanas Canton; they work in agriculture and animal husbandry.

Juan Alfredo grows corn.  He’s asking for the loan to buy fertilizer, Ranger [brand of herbicide], insecticide and urea.  With help from the loan he’ll have what’s necessary for his crops.  He will make his purchases in Ventanas.  His dream is to grow much more corn.  In his free time he enjoys playing soccer and volleyball.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer, insecticide, Ranger and urea.

loans.name: Alex Enrique

texts.es:
Alex tiene 19 años de edad, vive en la ciudad de Nazca, ciudad que se caracteriza por tener un clima cálido y acogedor, asimismo posee muchos atractivos turísticos, los cuales son muy visitados los cuales son las “Líneas de Nazca”, el “Cementerio de Cahuachi”, entre otros, asimismo se desarrolla la agricultura en especial el cultivo de tuna, algodón, maíz, entre otros. Alex es muy trabajador, pero cuando tiene un tiempito libre le gusta mucho ver películas, sobre todo de comedia y en ocasiones comer uno de sus platillos favoritos el cual es el riquísimo “Arroz con Pollo”. 

Día a día Alex trabaja como chofer de taxi, el labora alrededor de 12 horas al día y puede atender hasta 25 clientes diariamente y con el fruto de su trabajo puede apoyar a sus padres con los gastos de su hogar y sobre todo poder solventar los gastos de su universidad ya que se encuentra estudiando la carrera de Mecánica;  el cree que le va bien en su trabajo ya que es muy dedicado y sobre todo tiene muchas ganas de salir adelante.

Alex está muy agradecido con los prestatarios Kiva ya que gracias a  la ayuda que le han brindado el podrá comprar materiales para el pequeño taller de mecánica de su  padre, como alicates, llaves, liquido para soldar, cascos de soldadura, entre otros, de esta manera el podrá seguir trabajando y sobre todo apoyar a su padre y así poder mejorar la calidad de vida de su familia; de esta manera poder seguir trabajando día a día y luchando por terminar su carrera y cumplir uno de sus más grandes sueño:” Tener su propio taller de soldadura”.
texts.en:
Alex, 19, lives in the city of Nazca, a city noted for its hot, welcoming climate.  It has many tourist attractions that are very popular like the Nazca Lines and the Cahuachi Cemetery, among others.  Agriculture, especially cactus apples, corn and cotton, among others is also prevalent here.  

Alex is very hardworking but when he has a little free time available he enjoys watching movies, especially comedies, and on occasion to eat one of his favorite dishes, the very delicious “Arroz con Pollo.” [Chicken with Rice]

Alex works day to day as a taxi driver.  He works around 12 hours daily and can tend to up to 25 customers per day.  He’s able to help his parents with household expenses with the fruits of his labor and above all to pay his university costs since he’s studying auto mechanics.  He believes that he does well at work because he’s very dedicated and above all because he very much wants to get ahead.

Alex is very grateful to Kiva lenders because thanks to the support they’ve given him he will be able to buy materials like pliers, wrenches, soldering liquid, welding masks, etc. for his father’s small auto repair shop.  In this way he will be able to continue working and help his father improve his family’s quality of life.  In this way he will be able to continue working day to day striving to complete his career and reach one of his greatest dreams: to have his own welding shop.

loans.use: to buy tools.

loans.name: Jacinto Jose

texts.es:
JACINTO JOSE tiene 33 años de edad es soltero tiene un hijo vive en casa de un tio en Ventanas Provincia de los Ríos.

Es Integrante de la VRC los ÚLTIMOS SERAN LOS PRIMEROS, se encuentran ubicada en Recinto San Gabriel, pertenece al Cantón Ventanas se dedican a Labores Agrícolas y Pecuarias. 

JACINTO JOSE se dedica a la agricultura a la siembra de maíz. Solicita el crédito para comprar semillas, urea, insecticidas, líquido mata monte. Con la ayuda del crédito podra mejorar los cultivos. Las compras las realizara en ventanas.

El sueño es ir a la luna. En el tiempo libre le gusta trabajar y ahorrar.
texts.en:
Jacinto José, 33, is single and has a son.  He lives in his uncle’s house in Ventanas, Los Ríos Province.  He’s a member of the “Los Últimos Serán los Primeros” (The Last will be First) communal bank located in Recinto San Gabriel belonging to Ventanas Canton; they work in agriculture and animal husbandry.

Jacinto José grows corn.  He requests the loan to buy seeds, urea, insecticide and weed killer.  With help from the loan he will be able to improve his crops.   He’ll make his purchases in Ventanas.  His dream is to travel to the moon and in his free time he likes to work and to save.

loans.use: to buy seeds, urea, insecticide and weed killer.

loans.name: Lidia Yanileth

texts.es: Lidia tiene 37 años de edad, es madre soltera de tres hijos, son buenos hijos, responsables y trabajadores. El negocio lo aprendió  sola ya que tenia que sacar adelante a sus hijos y decidió iniciar con la venta de ropa nueva y usada, también se dedica a la venta de  cosméticos, desde hace algunos años inicio con el negocio. Su horario de atención inicia por las mañanas de 7:00 a.m y culmina como a las 6:00 p.m. Lidia gracias a Dios es una persona sana, muy jovial, amable y muy conocida por sus vecinos. Ella solicita este préstamo para comprar cosméticos, ropa nueva y usada, así surtir su negocio de estilos actuales y acordes a la temporada. Con el apoyo de este préstamo podrá llamar la atención de más clientes y seguirá teniendo una actividad económica que le permita cubrir los gastos de su familia. Su sueño es tener un local propio y surtir bien su negocio. Este es el primer financiamiento que obtiene Lidia en FAMA y espera cancelar puntualmente con el pago de sus cuotas.
texts.en:
Lidia, 37, is a single mother of three children; they are good, responsible, hardworking children.  She learned her business on her own because she needed to support her children.  She decided to sell new and used clothes; she also sells cosmetics.  She went into business a few years ago.  She starts work at 7am and ends at 6pm.  Thanks be to God, Lidia’s healthy, very jovial and kind; she’s well-known by her neighbors.

She requests this loan to buy cosmetics, new and used clothes to stock her business with current, seasonal styles.  With support from this loan she will be able to catch the eye of more customers and will continue having an economic activity that makes it possible for her to cover family expenses.  Her dream is to have her own locale and to stock her business well.  This is the first loan she’s gotten from FAMA and Lidia expects to make her installment payments punctually.

loans.use: to buy clothes and cosmetics.

loans.name: Maria

texts.es:
Maria es de la ciudad de Santaní, es madre de 4 hijos, quienes siempre la ayudan en el negocio, junto a su marido. Esta familia se dedica a la venta de artículos electrónicos, ropas y artículos para el hogar de manera ambulante. Recorren toda la zona de cercanas y parte de Santaní.
Maria solicito el préstamo para poder comprar más prendas y artículos electrónicos y así llegar a más personas y también así poder cumplir con pedidos de sus clientes. Agradece por la gran oportunidad que recibe, ya que esto la ayudará a seguir creciendo como lo ha venido haciendo.
texts.en:
Maria is from the city of Santaní.  She’s the mother of four children who always help her with the business as does her husband.  This family sells electronic devices, clothes and items for the home from place to place.  They travel throughout nearby zones and part of Santaní.  

Maria requested the loan to buy more clothes and electronic devices to reach more people and to be able to fill pending customer orders.  She is grateful for the great opportunity she’s getting because it will help her to continue to grow like she’s been doing to date.

loans.use: to buy clothes and electronic devices.

loans.name: Baken

texts.ru:
Бакен 53 года. Бакен в качестве основного дохода с 1995 года занимается животноводством и полеводством, начав этот бизнес с суммы в 10,000 сом. Благодаря упорному труду Бакен в ее хозяйстве на сегодняшний  день имеется  4 дойные коровы с приплодом, 20 голов мелкого рогатого скота. Также, Бакен обрабатывает 3 га земли с картошкой, ячменем и эспарцетом,  общий доход в месяц составляет около 12,000 сом. 
В целях дальнейшего развития своего бизнеса, Бакен обратилась в компанию «Бай –Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом в сумме 75,000 сом (KGS)  на покупку скота для откорма и перепродажи.  Доходы от кредита Бакен планирует вложить в дальнейшее увеличение количества домашней скотины, а в будущем мечтает сделать капитальный ремонт своего дома.
texts.en:
Baken is fifty-three years old and since 1995 her main source of income has come from farming and raising livestock. She began her business from a starting capitol of 10,000 soms; however, due to hard work and dedication her business has grown to include 4 cows with calves and 20 heads of small-horned cattle. Additionally, Baken owns 3 hectares of land which she uses to grow potatoes, barley and cock's head. All together, her business has a monthly revenue of 12,000 soms. 
In hopes of expanding her business, Baken approached "Bai Tushum and Partners" requesting a loan of 75,000 soms (KGS) in order to purchase livestock for future fattening and resale. Baken plans to use the profits generated by loan as additional investments into her business and buy even more cattle. In the future, she would also like to remodel and repair her home.

loans.use: to purchase cattle.

loans.name: Luisa Amanda

texts.es:
Luisa, originaria de Leon , pero vive en la ciudad de Managua , se dedica a vender frescos y comida, esta casada, es madre de 4 hijos , de la cual la menor de sus hijas estudia administración de empresas. 
Ella inicio con un puesto de tortillas, después fue agregando desayunos, leches  y de últimos agrego la venta de frescos en especial el de cacao y chicha que son los más populares entre sus clientes. Dos de sus hijas le ayudan a elaborar los frescos.  Ella desea ampliar y mejorar las condiciones de su negocio. Por eso solicita el crédito para materia prima como azúcar, frutas, percoladora, bolsas plásticas, vitrinas y mesas plásticas . Un proyecto que tiene futuramente es kiosco para vender más variedad de frescos naturales.
texts.en:
Luisa is from León but lives in Managua.  She sells fruit drinks and food.  She’s married and the mother of four children.  Her youngest daughter is studying business administration.  She started with a tortilla stand and later added breakfasts, milk and lastly the sale of fruit drinks, especially cocoa and chicha [corn based beverage] which are the most popular among her customers.  Two of her daughters help her make them.

She wants to expand and improve her business’ condition which is why she’s requesting a loan to buy raw materials like sugar, fruit, a percolator, plastic bags, display cases and plastic tables.  A future plan she has is to have a kiosk to sell wider variety of natural fruit drinks.

loans.use: to buy sugar, fruit, a percolator, plastic bags, display cases and plastic tables.

loans.name: Reyna

texts.es:
Reyna, casada  de oficio comerciante, es dueña de una tortillería en la cuidad de Managua, es madre de tres hijos quienes trabajan junto con ella en el negocio. Esta actividad la empezó vendiendo pupusas en las universidades, después una amiga de ella le sugirió que vendiera tortilla a las taquerías de la ciudad que siempre solicitan tortillas al por mayor. De esta manera es que logro establecer su negocio. Actualmente distribuye tortillas a todas las taquizas de Managua, snack bars, comideria, cafetines de hospitales. Siempre en busca de nuevos clientes. 
Ella requiere el financiamiento para comprar maseca (maíz )al por mayor ya que es  parte de la materia prima  que utiliza para hacer tortillas.  Una de sus expectativas es expandir su negocio de tortillas , dar empleo a otras personas.
texts.en:
Reyna is married and is a merchant by profession.  She owns a tortilla shop in the city of Managua.  She’s the mother of three children who work with her in the business.  She started the business selling pupusas [filled, grilled corncakes] in the universities and later on a girlfriend suggested she sell tortillas to the taco shops in the city that always request tortillas at wholesale.  This is how she succeeded in establishing her business.  She currently distributes tortillas to all of Managua’s taco shops, snack bars, eateries and hospital cafeterias.  She’s always on the lookout for new customers.

She needs financing to buy Maseca (corn flour) at wholesale because this is part of the raw materials she uses to make tortillas.  One of her expectations is to expand the tortilla business to provide employment for others.

loans.use: to buy Maseca.

loans.name: Ritchel

texts.en:
Ritchel is 26 years old, single and lives in the Philippines.

Ritchel provides motorela, or motorcycle, services. He has had this business for 5 years. He requested a loan of 5,000 PHP to pay for the maintenance.

Ritchel has been a member of HSPFI since 2012. In the future, Ritchel hopes to improve his services.

loans.use: to pay for motorcycle maintenance.

loans.name: Rafael

texts.es:
Rafael, de 46 años de edad, es un hombre emprendedor y trabajador, además de muy jovial y sociable. Es conviviente con Graciela quien es comerciante y madre de sus 02 hijos. Vive en compañía de su pareja y 01 hija,  a los que quiere mucho, habitando cómodamente en su propia casa. La actividad que realiza Rafael es la siembra de palma aceitera para eso tiene un terreno propio de 20 hectáreas de extensión, contando con 07 hectáreas de cultivo de palma aceitera que  están en producción, siendo un cultivo alternativo a la hoja de coca.  Iniciándose hace más 04 años en ésta actividad, cuando logró posesionarse en esa zona contando con el apoyo  técnico de la empresa privada, a la que vende toda su producción, llegando a contratar hasta 02 peones para la actividad de cosecha con un pago diario a cada uno, además de contar con el apoyo de su pareja.
Considera rentable su negocio por la demanda que tiene ese producto y las buenas ganancias que le deja.
Le gusta su actividad pues cuenta con un oficio al cual dedicarse, así como también le gusta el trabajo de campo y los ingresos económicos que le genera con la venta de su producción que le sirve para solventar sus gastos de su hogar. Al contrario, no le gusta  las plagas de afectan las plantaciones, por eso tiene que estar pendiente y alerta de cualquier brote. Además tiene planes de seguir creciendo y comprarse un vehiculo de carga pesada para el transporte de su producto. Este es el préstamo número 16 con la institución MFP, Por ello cuenta con su colaboración para que pueda concretar sus planes. Además dice sentirse bien con su banco comunal, pues los conoce  desde mucho tiempo a sus integrantes a los que considera ser personas responsables y solidarias. Con el monto solicitado de 3500 nuevos soles, los invertirá en su totalidad en la compra de abono para los cultivos de palma aceitera.
texts.en:
Rafael, 46 years old, is a hardworking entrepreneur, and very good-humored and friendly. He is cohabiting with Graciela who is a merchant and mother of two children. He lives with his partner and one daughter, whom he loves very much, living comfortably in his own home.

Rafael works growing oil palms. He has his own land, a tract of 20 hectares, with 7 hectares of oil palm cultivation that are in production, with an alternating crop of coca leaves. He began this activity 4 years ago, when he gained possession of this area with the technical support of a private company, to whom he sells all the production, having to contract up to two laborers for harvest time with daily pay to each one, in addition to the help of his partner. 

He considers the business profitable because of the demand for the product and the good profits he gets. He likes the work as he has an office to work in and he likes the field work too and the financial income that he generates with the sale of his harvest that takes care of the household expenses.

On the other hand, he does not like the pests that affect his plantations, and  so he has to be on the watch and be alert of any outbreak. He also has plans to continue growing and of buying a heavy-load vehicle to transport his crop.

This is his 16th loan with MFP, and with the assistance he can finalize his plans. Furthermore, he says he feels good about the communal bank as he has known the members for a long time and he considers them to be trustworthy and united.

With the requested amount of 3500 soles he will invest the entire amount in the purchase of fertilizer to grow his oil palms.

loans.use: to buy bags of fertilizer for cultivating his oil palms which are in production

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Ana Maria

texts.es:
Ana, una ama de casa, pero que se dedica a alquilar nintendo, está casada, habita en Managua, tiene 4 hijos de 21, 17, 13 y 19 años de edad, de los cuales solo estudian 3 de ellos.
Inicio su negocio a la edad de 30 años, el motivo de poner su propio negocio fue su esposo es era el único que trabajaba y no eran suficiente para cubrir  la necesidad de sacar a sus hijos adelante. Entonces decidió poner el alquiler de nintendo, gracias a este negocio obtiene ingresos que le ayuda a pagar la universidad a sus hijos y además de ofrecer entretenimiento sano a los jóvenes de su vecindario.     
Ella solicita el crédito para comprar televisor, play station y controles de nintendo. Pues necesita reponer algunos equipos  que están dañados. Esto le ayudara a ofrecer un mejor servicio a sus clientes quienes siempre buscan lo que esté de moda en juegos de video.    En lo futuro le gustaría ir acondicionar mejor su casa poner un negocio de repostería. Pero su meta próxima son los estudios de sus hijos.
texts.en:
Ana is a homemaker who rents out Nintendo games. She is married and lives in Managua. Ana has four children (ages 21, 17, 13, and 19), three of whom are in school. She started her business at the age of 30. The reason for establishing her own business was because her husband was the only one working, but his income was not sufficient for covering what her children needed to get ahead. At that point, she decided to rent out Nintendo games. Thanks to this business, she has the income needed to help pay her children’s university expenses. In addition, Ana provides a safe place to entertain the young people who live in her neighborhood.

She is requesting a loan in order to buy a television, PlayStation console, and Nintendo controls. Ana needs to replace a few pieces of equipment that have been damaged. This will enable her to provide better service to her customers who are always looking to play video games. In the future, she would like to remodel her house so that she can set up a pastry shop. Her next goal is to focus on her children’s education.

loans.use: to buy a television, PlayStation console, and Nintendo controls.

loans.name: Mawunan 1 Group

texts.fr: Le groupe MAWUNAN 1 est formé de quatre personnes qui sont des amies. La représentante de ce groupe, nommée Nadège, est celle dont la main est levée sur la photo. C’est la deuxième fois que ce groupe sollicite l’appui financier de ALIDé en vue d’élever le niveau de leur activité. Mariée à un certain François, Nadège est âgée de 30 ans. Nadège est mère de trois enfants tous scolarisés et à sa charge. Le couple vit ensemble avec les enfants et assure ensemble, les diverses charges de la maison. Nadège n’a pas fréquenté l’école. Il y a quelques années que Nadège exerce comme activité, la vente de bouillie (faite à base du maïs) accompagné des beignets de façon ambulante ; ce qui lui permet de répondre sans grande difficulté à ses besoins. Nadège s’approvisionne dans une ville du Bénin. Dans le souci de mieux répondre aux exigences de sa clientèle, Nadège désire renforcer et diversifier son activité. Pour ce faire, Nadège sollicite, ensemble avec les autres membres du groupe MAWUNAN 1, un deuxième crédit auprès de ALIDé. Le prêt antérieur a été bien remboursé.
texts.en:
MAWUNAN 1 is a group made up of four members who are friends.  

The group's representative, Nadège, is the one raising her hand in the photo.  It is the second time that this group is requesting financial assistance from  ALIDé in order to increase the level of its activity.

Married to a man named François, Nadège is 30 years old and the mother of three children, all in school and her dependents.  Husband and wife live together with their children and share the various household expenses.

Nadège never attended school. For the past few years, she has been selling paste (made from maize), served with fritters.  She works as an itinerant seller, and this activity allows her to meet her needs without much difficulty.  She buys her supplies from a town located in Benin.

To ensure the satisfaction of her customers, Nadège would like to strengthen and diversify her business.  To this end, she is requesting a second loan from ALIDé, along with the other members of the MAWUNAN 1 group. 

The previous loan was well repaid.

loans.use: to buy sacks of maize.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a cooking pot and food ingredients for preparing meals for selling

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy more firewood to sell

loans.name: Christine

texts.en:
Christine is a resident of Mariakani area of Coast province, Kenya. She is married and has four children. She owns a second-hand clothes shop, a business that she has been operating for six years. She also owns a retail shop.

She learnt about Milango through an employee and joined the company with an aim of accessing credit to improve the operations of her business. Her main challenges are that some customers do not pay on time and high purchase prices of the clothes.

Christine is applying for a loan of 41,850 Kenya shillings to purchase bales of second-hand clothes. The extra income from the loan will be added to her savings to pay school fees for her children. She aspires to start a transport business in the future.

loans.use: To purchase bales of second-hand clothes.

loans.name: Aidana

texts.ru:
Айдане 35 лет, имеет 4 детей. Айдана в качестве основного дохода с 2002 года занимается обработкой и перепродажей сушеных фруктов, в частности абрикосов, начав этот бизнес с суммы в 10,000 сом. Товар Айдана закупает на сельских рынках Кадамжайского и Баткенского района Кыргызстана, и реализует на Исфаринском рынке в Республике Таджикистан.
Благодаря такому нелегкому  труду и упорству  Айданы, в ее товарообороте находится около 150,000 сом, прибыль в месяц составляет около 30,000 сом.  
В целях дальнейшего развития своего бизнеса, Айдана обратилась в компанию «Бай –Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом в сумме 116,000 сом (KGS)  на закуп сушеного абрикоса для перепродажи.   Доходы от кредита Айдана планирует вложить в дальнейшее увеличение своего бизнеса, а в ближайшем будущем планирует провести свадьбу сына.
texts.en:
Aidana is thirty-five years old and has four children. Since 2002, her main source of income has come from treating and reselling dried fruits, apricots in particular. She stocks up her inventory via small local markets in the Kadamjaisk and Batken regions of Kyrgyzstan and then sells the goods on the Isfarin market in Tajikistan. 

Aidana began this business with a capitol of 10,000 soms; however, due to her hard work and dedication, she now consistently has 150,000 soms circulating as goods and generates a monthly profit of around 30,000 soms. 

Hoping to expand her business, Aidana approached "Bai Tushum and Partners" requesting a loan of 116,000 soms (KGS) in order to buy a batch of dried apricots that she intends to resell. She wants to use the profits generated by the loan as additional investments into her business and also plans to conduct a wedding for her son in the near future.

loans.use: to purchase a batch of dried apricots for resale.

loans.name: Ekaterine

texts.en:
Ekaterine is from Abasha district, West Georgia. She is 41 years old and lives with her husband and two children (12 and 15 years old). The children go to the local school. 

The family is involved in the agricultural business. They have small dairy farm of 7 milk cows whose milk is used for dairy production. Ekaterine produces Sulguni (Georgian pickled cheese) and sells on average 60 kg per month. In addition, they grow nuts and maize on a family-owned land. Part of the harvested productions is sold at the local open market and the rest is used for family needs. Ekaterine works hard, but the family still doesn’t have enough income to save up and improve the living conditions of the family.

She requested a loan to purchase construction materials for a new cattle-shed. The existing one is already too small and doesn’t allow Ekaterine to expand the family’s farming activities. In the future, she is going to develop an animal husbandry business so she can produce and sell more cheese. This will increase the family income and Ekaterine will be able to improve the living conditions of the family.

loans.use: to build a cattle-shed.

loans.name: Nozanin

texts.ru: Нозанин незамужняя девушка, живет с родителями и семья занимается сельскохозяйственными работами.  У них в семье все работают на виноградном поле, которую арендуют в течении нескольких лет и получают от этого бизнеса приличную прибыль, на которую проживают целый год.  Хотя на поле работа трудная и требует многих затрат, родители Нозанин приучают всех членов семьи усердно работать.   Так как на винограднике много корма,семья постоянно держат крупный скот и дойных коров, как дополнительный доход.  В  нашу организацию Нозанин обратилась  чтобы получив кредит, купить еще несколько голов мелкого скота или еще одну дойную корову.   Она сама доит корову и продает молоко и подрабатывает себе на жизнь.  Заранее благодарит Арванд за поддержку.
texts.en:
Nozanin is a single woman and lives with her parents. Her whole family works on some grape fields that they rent, thus generating a decent income. Although work on the fields is tough and demands many sacrifices, Nozanin's parents discipline everyone to work hard. 

Because the grape fields have lots of fodder, Nozanin's family have some large cattle and milking cows as an additional source of income. Nozanin approached Arvand in the hopes of procuring a loan and using it to purchase some small cattle and one more milking cow. She milks the cows herself and then earns money by selling the milk. 
She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to buy some small cattle and a cow.

loans.name: Jahiber

texts.es:
Jahiber tiene 30 años y nació en Manizales, Colombia. Desde los 11 años vive en Cali a donde llega junto con su madre que viene en busca de trabajo y un mejor futuro. Completar sus estudios universitarios significó para él entender que no hay imposibles y que la formación académica es el camino para lograr todo tipo de metas. 

Con esmero y mucho trabajo logra sortear las necesidades económicas para culminar sus estudios, trabajando inicialmente como vendedor de libros puerta a puerta, payaso titiritero y animador de fiestas. Posteriormente trabaja en la universidad como monitor en las clases de estética audiovisiual. Luego, dadas sus capacidades, trabaja como editor de audio y video en el centro de producción de Comunicación Social, culminando con éxito sus estudios e iniciando asi su carrera en el campo audiovisual. 

Hijo de madre soltera y con una hermana adolescente Jahiber se proyecta ahora estudiando una maestría en cine en Estados Unidos y espera obtener el apoyo de Kiva pues actualmente es su única alternativa para lograglo.

Esta es su historia:

Nunca olvidaré la primera vez que estuve en una sala de cine, tenía aproximadamente 7 años y mi madre y abuela, muy católicas, me llevaron a ver “El Mártir del Calvario con Enrique Rambal”. En esa enorme sala oscura experimenté emociones tan fuertes que me sentí como Jesús, lloré montones y fui crucificado, incluso quedaron en mi memoria algunos de sus diálogos que luego representaba en casa molestando a mi abuela, que finalmente terminaba riendo. 

Hoy en día, al recordar tal evento, sonrio al ver como los caminos y las decisiones que he tomado en mi vida se han confabulado para llevarme detrás de las cámaras, a conocer y amar este oficio que tantas experiencias y emociones genera.

Al terminar el colegio era impensable para mi estudiar en la universidad, ya mi madre había hecho todo su esfuerzo por darme el estudio y mi hermana menor hacía poco había llegado a este mundo, asi que  muy claro mi madre advirtió: “Hijo, hasta acá puedo ayudarte con tus estudios”. Esta noticia generó una sola idea en mi cabeza: trabajar para poder estudiar. Pues bien, esto no sucedió, ya que a pesar de mi esfuerzo por encontrar un trabajo en alguna empresa solo hubo gastos en hojas de vida, transporte y solicitudes. Cansado de esta situación, y motivado por una amiga que se alistaba para aplicar a la Universidad del Valle, vislumbré el sueño de ser un profesional. Años despúes, tras múltiples trabajos y mucho estudio, salía de una excelente universidad no sólo con un titulo profesional sino con la convicción del oficio cinematográfico en mi vida, y también con un importante reconocimiento: el “Premio Simón Bolivar a mejor emisión cultural en televisión” por escribir y dirigir mi primer documental.

Ahora tengo mis ojos y mi corazón puestos en una maestría en cinematografía en Estados Unidos y el apoyo de Kiva es una parte fundamental en este proceso de aplicación. Estoy totalmente convencido que a través de la misma, tendré las herramientas necesarias para regresar y contribuir, con la producción cinematográfica,  al desarrollo social y cultural de Colombia.
texts.en:
Jahiber, 30, was born in Manizales, Colombia.  He’s lived in Cali for the last 11 years.  He arrived there with his mother seeking employment and a better future.  Completing his university studies meant that there are no impossibles for him and that academic preparation is the path that leads to all sorts of goals.  With much effort and work he was able to skillfully deal with economic needs in order to finish his studies.  He initially worked selling books door to door, as a clown puppeteer and as a party entertainer.  He then worked at the university as a monitor in the audiovisual esthetics classes.  Later, given his skills, he worked as an audio and video editor in the social communication production center.  He graduated and started his career in the audiovisual field.  He’s the son of a single mother and has a teenage sister.  Jahiber sees himself in the future studying in the United States for a Master’s Degree in Cinematography and hopes to get help from Kiva because this is his only available alternative to do so.

This is his story:

“I’ll never forget the first time I went to the movies.  I was about 7-years-old and my mother and grandmother who were devout Catholics took me to see “The Martyr of Calvary” starring Enrique Rambal.  I felt such strong emotions in that enormous, dark room that I felt like Jesus himself; I cried my eyes out and it was as if I had been crucified too.  In fact, I retained some of the dialogue that I’d later recite at home annoying my grandmother who eventually would end up laughing.

Today, as I recall that event, it makes me smile to see how the roads I’ve taken and the decisions I’ve made in life have led me behind the cameras, to know and love this occupation that generates so many experiences and emotions.

When I finished high school it was unthinkable that I’d be able to attend university because my mother had exhausted all her efforts to provide schooling for me and my younger sister had just recently arrived in this world so my mother said to me quite clearly: ‘Son, this is as far as I can go helping with your schooling.’  This newsflash generated just one thought in my brain: I had to work to be able to continue studying.  Well, this did not happen because despite my effort to secure employment in some firm or other all I ended up doing was spend money to print copies of my curriculum vitae, on transportation costs and in filling out job applications.  Worn out by this situation and motivated by a girlfriend who was getting ready to apply to the Universidad del Valle, I got a glimpse of the dream of becoming a professional.  Years later, after many jobs and much study, I was graduating from an excellent university not only with a professional degree but also committed to a lifetime career as a cinematographer.  I also won an important prize: the Simón Bolívar Award for Best Cultural Television Production for writing and directing my first documentary.


Now, my eyes and my heart are set on getting a Master’s in Cinematography in the United States and Kiva’s help is a fundamental part of the application process.  I am totally convinced that through it I will have the necessary tools to return and contribute to Colombia’s social and cultural development through cinematography production.”

loans.use: to pay application fees for a Master's in Cinematography.

loans.name: Mahoulome Group

texts.fr: MAHOULOME est un groupe de quatre personnes, dont les membres résident dans le même quartier au Bénin. La représentante du groupe, Joselyne Mondoukpè (dont la main est levée sur la photo), est âgée de 32 ans et est mariée à un certain Oscor. Le couple a trois enfants tous scolarisés et à leur charge. Joselyne Mondoukpè et son mari vivent ensemble avec leurs enfants et assurent ensemble les différentes charges de la maison. Joselyne Mondoukpè n’a pas fréquenté l’école. Il y a quelques années, Joselyne Mondoukpè mène comme activité la vente des sachets et des pommades de façon ambulante. Joselyne Mondoukpè exerce cette activité passionnément, ce qui lui permet de subvenir à ses besoins et à ceux de ses enfants. Joselyne Mondoukpè s’approvisionne dans une ville du Bénin. Dans la quête de la satisfaction de sa clientèle, Joselyne Mondoukpè sollicite un troisième crédit avec les autres membres du groupe MAHOULOME. Ce crédit leur servira à mieux répondre aux demandes de leur clientèle et à se faire plus de profits.
texts.en:
MAHOULOME is a group made up of four members who live in the same neighborhood in Benin.

The group's representative, Joselyne Mondoukpè, is the one raising her hand in the photo. She is 32 years old, married to a man named Oscor, and the mother of three children, all in school and their dependents.  Joselyne Mondoukpè and her husband live together with their children and jointly take care of the various household expenses.

Joselyne Mondoukpè did not attend school. For the past few years, she has been selling sachets and ointments.  She works as an itinerant seller, and she is passionate about her work, which allows her to meet her needs as well as those of her children. She buys her supplies from a town located in Benin.

To ensure the satisfaction of her customers,  Joselyne Mondoukpè is requesting a third loan, along with the other members of the MAHOULOME group.  This loan will be used to better meet their customers' expectations, and to increase their profits.

loans.use: to buy sachets and ointments.

loans.name: Opetela

texts.en: Opetela is 25 years old, married and has 1 child. She would like to start growing taro and taamu plants to earn a living. Opetela has requested a loan to purchase farming tools and chemicals to start her business. She has been a member of SPBD for a year. Opetela will spend her profits to buy more farming tools to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy weed killers, a grass cutter, bush knives, and shovels.

loans.name: Viena

texts.en: Viena is a 35-year-old, married woman with 4 children. She would like to start growing cabbages and tomatoes to earn a living. Viena has requested a loan to start her business. She has been a member of SPBD since 2012. Viena will spend her profits to help her kids' education.

loans.use: buy vegie seeds, fertilizer, shovels and weed killer.

loans.name: John

texts.en:
John is 45 years old and is married with five children between the ages of four months and 19 years old. He sells cows from 6 a.m. until 5 p.m. everyday, except on Sunday, and he has two years of experience in this work. 

John has requested a loan from Kiva lenders via Vision Finance Company in order to buy more cows for resale. He plans to use any profits generated from this loan to satisfy his family's basic needs and to reinvest in his business.

loans.use: To buy more cows for resale.

loans.name: Elvin

texts.en: Elvin is 32 years old and lives in Poblacion, Tampilisan, Zamboanga del Norte. He is single. Elvin works in the fish industry and sells fish for a living. He has been doing this for 10 years. He has requested loan of 25,000 PHP to purchase boxes of fish to sell retail. Elvin has been a member of PMPC for 1 year. In the future, Elvin hopes to expand his business.
