He is requesting $2100 a Youth loan to buy a machine specialized for his work. He is aiming to grow his business and increase his profits so he will be able to provide his family better life conditions.

loans.use: to buy a machine specialized for his work

loans.name: Renacer Group

texts.es:
El Comité de Mujeres de nombre Renacer, gracias a su esfuerzo ya está en el ciclo numero 11. Ellas son mujeres jefas de familia que vieron una gran oportunidad de crecimiento para ellas y sus familias y es por ello que decidieron formar parte del grupo.
Zonia, una de las miembros de este grupo vende ropas. Cuenta que cuando empezó le fue muy difícil, pero que con el correr del tiempo fue ganando confianza y hoy en día ya es una buenísima vendedora. Gracias a su trabajo Zonia ayuda a su familia y también aporta con los gastos que día a día surge, ella es muy emprendedora y con ganas de salir adelante y progresar.
Ella solicita el crédito para que por medio de este pueda surtir sus prendas y pueda dar mayor variedad a sus clientes.
texts.en:
The Renacer women's committee is embarking on its 11th round of funding.  The women, all heads of their respective households, started the community bank because they saw it as the best means to provide for themselves and their families.  
Our member, Zonia, operates a clothing sales business.  She tells us that she struggled at first but is much more confident now and considers herself to be a good saleswoman.  Thanks to the business, Zonia can provide for her family and even keep up with ever-rising prices.  She is an enterprising woman with a strong drive to get ahead.
Zonia is applying for a loan that she will use to stock her clothing sales business with the merchandise that her customers most want.

loans.use: to stock her clothing sales business.

loans.name: Divino Niño Jesus Group

texts.es:
Con la confianza de poder ayudar a sus familias por medio de su trabajo, 22 mujeres de la ciudad de Caaguazú se han unido y trabajan juntas y de esa forma ayudan a sus familias.
Jazmin, miembro del grupo se dedica a la venta de zapatillas bordadas. Comenta que tiene mucha venta, ya que las mismas son muy solicitadas por sus clientas, además que siempre tiene muy buen trabajo. Ella es una persona muy creativa y lo muestra en cada zapatilla que hace.
Solicita el crédito para la compra de zapatillas, hilos, lentejuelas, pinzas y demás insumos para seguir vendiendo sus zapatillas bordadas. Jazmin, como las demás miembros agradecen por la oportunidad que están recibiendo.
texts.en:
With the confidence to help their families through their work, 22 women in from Caaguazú have united to work together, and in this way, help their families.

Jazmin, a member of the group, sells embroidered slippers. She says that she has a lot of sales since they are in high demand and always of good quality. She is a very creative person, which shows in each slipper that she makes. 

She is requesting a loan to buy slippers, thread, sequins, tweezers and other supplies to keep selling the embroidered slippers. Jazmin, like the other members, is grateful for this opportunity.

loans.use: to buy slippers, thread, sequins, tweezers and other supplies.

loans.name: Josphat

texts.en:
Josphat is a 39-year-old, married man. He and his wife, Lucy, have two school-going children.

For the last eight years, he has worked in the farming business in Ndunyu Njeru town.

He was introduced to KADET LTD. by one of its field officers. This would be his third loan through KADET, and he explains that he successfully repaid his previous loan on time. He is now seeking a loan in the amount of 40,000 KES, and he plans to use the loan proceeds to buy two bulls and four sheep, which he will care for and sell for profits. In the future, he hopes to save money and to purchase a lorry to aid him for transportation purposes.

loans.use: to expand his business by purchasing two bulls and four sheep

loans.name: Procesa

texts.en:
This is Procesa, 62, a resident of Tondo, Philippines. She is married to Jesus, a vendor. She and her husband manage their household and raise their children while operating the business. At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for her everyday expenses.  

Procesa has a lace making business. She mainly makes laces for curtains, tables and others. She also does repairs and alterations. She also sells native products. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community.  She earns a minimum of Php600 in sales every day.

To help her continue operations of her business, she is requesting a Php 50,000 loan. She will be utilizing the loan to buy more quantities of raw materials like fabric, thread and other items needed in her business. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business.  

Procesa hopes her business grows and dreams to have her house renovated through all her hard work on her business. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week and where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: To pay for threads, cloths and other materials needed in her business.

loans.name: Rosilia

texts.en: Because of her need to generate an income so that she could improve her family’s well-being, Rosilia began her retail shop business. Rosilia is a married woman who lives with her husband and three children. Her main clients are the neighboring community members.  Rosilia is requesting her first loan through Yehu Microfinance Trust, an organization she has been a part of for one year and that made it possible for her to set up her business, in order to give it a more comfortable environment. She will use the money from her first Kiva loan to buy bundles of wheat flour, maize flour, and rice for resale in order to increase her opportunities in the market, such as responding to new customers that have been referred by the current buyers and those whose attention she wants to capture.

loans.use: to buy bundles of wheat flour, maize flour, and rice for resale

loans.name: Vimie

texts.en: Vimie, single, is 36 years old and lives in D-Fernan, Bonifacio. Vimie operates a general store, selling a variety of products to local community members to earn a living. He has been doing this for 12 years and every month he earns PHP 5,000 from this work. He has requested a loan of PHP 8,000 to purchase additional products to sell. In 2010, Vimie joined GDMPC. Vimie hopes to improve the general living conditions of his family.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Burenbuyan

texts.en: Mrs. Burenbuyan is 34 years old, and is one of the hardworking women. Since 2007 she has been working as a salesperson in a trading company. She lives with her husband and her daughter, 3, in a ger (a nomadic Mongolian traditional tent) in the ger district in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. This time she is requesting a loan to repair her old and bad house. Her family owns a house behind their ger and it was built many years ago. Currently her family does not use it due to the cold, chilly inside temperature in winter time. The house suffers heat loss trough its thin and bad walls. She wants to add wall insulation to her house which is currently not insulated. As she said she will complete the work with her husband within this autumn if they can make it in time.

loans.use: To repair her old and bad house.

loans.name: Hassan

texts.en:
Hassan leaves in Mwambalazi, Kenya.  He is a good entrepreneur, and for seven years he has owned his own business. He operates a livestock selling business, selling to butcher operators, neighbours, and passersby. 

Today his dreams continue to grow and his goals are to continue increasing his income so that he can expand to a butcher shop and to be very successful.

His market is growing and so is the amount of capital that he needs to continue providing the products his customers demand. This will be his second loan from Yehu Microfinance Trust. He will use it to buy cows and goats.  He will promote his business with special discounts. He wants to offer great prices to his customers so that he can continue earning their loyalty, and this is why he will be successful in investing his Credit Kiva loan in his business.

loans.use: to buy cows and goats

loans.name: Dionisa

texts.en:
Dionisia is a 56-year-old married woman and mother of three children from Talibon, Bohol, Philippines. Dionisia works really hard to earn a living so that she can support her family especially in meeting their needs.

She has engaged in a hog raising business and fish vending for more than 20 years now. These are the sources of her income.

As of now, Dionisia is in need of additional capital for the expansion of her business. She is asking for a loan of PHP 10,000 to buy feed for the pigs and to buy fish to sell.  Through this loan, Dionisia will be able to augment her income and continually support the education of her children.

loans.use: to buy feed for the pigs and to buy fish to sell

loans.name: Esperanza De Mujer Group

texts.es:
Este Banco Comunal se llama “Esperanza de Mujer” está conformado por 21 emprendedores quienes se dedican a diferentes rubros, entre los cuales se encuentran; venta de ropa, venta de joyas, venta de perfumes, taller de costura, venta de sushi y arrollados primavera, comida rápida, servicios entre otros. Todos ellos pertenecientes a la ciudad de Curicó.
Ivonne, integrante del grupo del Banco Comunal, quien en la foto se encuentra sentada en primera fila, ocupando el segundo lugar de izquierda a derecha, viste polera negra de color negra y con adornos de flores de color gris en el pecho, su cabello lo usa suelto y es de color castaño oscuro.
Ella se dedica a la venta de zapatos, botas, carteras y blue jeans, desde hace 1 año. Comenta que trabaja desde su casa de lunes a sábado y su horario lo distribuye de acuerdo a su disponibilidad, su mercadería la vende en colegios, municipalidades, pero generalmente en su casa.
La mercadería que va necesitando la compra en fábricas donde encuentra loa zapato y los demás accesorios los compra en la ciudad de Santiago a bajo costo, por lo tanto conveniente económicamente.
Con el crédito comprará solamente blue jeans para abastecer su negocio.
Una de las metas de Ivonne es tener un local para tener su mercadería ordenada y atender a su clientela de manera más tranquila.
Ivonne vive junto a su esposo, madre y dos hijos de 21 y 9 años de edad. Sus sueños a nivel laboral es tener su local, y a nivel familiar es darle un buen pasar a su familia.
Ella se encuentra muy contenta y agradecida de la oportunidad brindada por Fondo Esperanza, ya que le permitirá invertir en su negocio. Respecto al grupo del Banco Comunal del cual forma parte, comenta que en éste existe muy buena comunicación. Por otro lado las capacitaciones, le han servido para aprender estrategias de venta y contabilidad.
Curicó se ubica en la región del Maule, zona centro del país. El clima de Curicó es de tipo mediterráneo y es considerado como uno de los más agradables del país. Se caracteriza además por su cultura en torno al vino y sus alrededores de belleza natural.  A pesar de que la fuerza de trabajo se ha  incrementado, esta zona sigue siendo, según el último censo, una de las más pobres del país.
texts.en:
This communal bank is called “Esperanza de Mujer” and is made up of 21 enterprising women who work in different areas.  Among them are clothing sales, jewelry sales, perfume sales, sewing, sushi and spring rolls, fast food, and services among other things.  All of the members live in the city of Curicó.

Ivonne is a member of the communal bank and is sitting in the first row in the photograph, second from the left.  She’s wearing a black top with grey flowers on it.  Her hair is dark and she wears it loosely.

For the past year she has been selling shoes, purses, wallets, and jeans.  She says that she works from her home from Monday through Saturday and makes her schedule according to her availability.  She sells her merchandise in schools and in town, but mostly from her home. 

She buys her merchandise from factories in Santiago, where she can get shoes and other accessories at low cost, and therefore economically.

She will use the money from this loan to buy jeans to stock her business.

One of Ivonne’s goals is to set up a shop where she can have her merchandise organized and be able to serve her customers in a more relaxed way.

Ivonne lives with her husband, mother, and two children, ages 21 and 9.  Her dream is to have her own shop, and be able to provide for her family.

She is happy and grateful for the opportunity giver her through Fondo Ezperanza, because it will allow her to invest in her business.  She says that there is good communication among the members of her communal bank.  Along with that, the training has helped her learn sales and accounting strategies.

Curicó is located in the Maule region, in the country’s central zone.  It has a Mediterranean type climate and it’s considered one of the nicest in the county.  It’s also known for its vineyards and its natural beauty.  Even though the work opportunities have increased, the region continues to be one of the poorest in the nation, according to the census.

loans.use: to buy jeans for resale.

loans.name: Fredy German

texts.es:
FREDY GERMAN TIENE 39 AÑOS DE EDAD DE ESTADO CIVIL UNIÓN LIBRE TIENE CUATRO HIJOS, VIVE CON LA ESPOSA Y CON LOS HIJOS EN LA CIUDAD DE VENTANAS PROVINCIA DE LOS RÍOS.

ES INTEGRANTE DE LA VRC NORTE, SE ENCUENTRA UBICADA EN RECINTO VENTANILLA NORTE, PERTENECE AL CANTÓN VENTANAS SE DEDICAN A LABORES AGRÍCOLAS Y PECUARIAS

FREDY GERMAN SE DEDICA A LA COMPRA VENTA DE CERDOS. SOLICITA EL CRÉDITO PARA COMPRAR CERDOS Y POLVILLO. CON LA AYUDA DEL CRÉDITO PODRÁ COMPRAR LOS CERDOS PARA ENGORDARLOS Y VENDERLOS AÚN BUEN PRECIO.

EL SUEÑO ES HACER UNOS PEQUEÑOS ARREGLOS A LA CASA. LOS DESAFÍOS A LOS QUE SE ENFRENTA SON LAS ENFERMEDADES QUE LES DAN A LOS CERDOS. EN EL TIEMPO LIBRE LE GUSTA CUIDAR A LOS ANIMALES.
texts.en:
Fredy German is 39 years old.  He has four children and lives with his wife and children in the city of Ventanas, within the Los Rios province. 
 
He is a member of the Norte community organization, located in the north Ventanilla area, part of the Ventanas settlement, where the people are farmers and raise livestock.
 
Fredy German buys and sells pigs.  He is asking for this loan to buy pigs and feed.  This loan will help him buy the pigs so that he can fatten them up and sell them for a good price.
 
His dream is to make a few small repairs to his home.  The challenges he faces are the diseases that the pigs get.  He likes to care for his animals in his spare time.

loans.use: to buy pigs and feed.

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en: Josephine is a thirty-year-old married mother of five who describes herself as a very responsible person. She opened up her little neighborhood kiosk five years ago and it has since been doing very well. Josephine has decided to take out her first loan with which she hopes to increase the variety of products she offers in her kiosk. Josephine wants to add stock of basic commodities like flour, snacks, soft drinks, etc, to her kiosk. She is very excited about this next step and hopes that the larger supply of products will attract a wider variety of clients. Her dream is to continue to expand her business in order to stabilize her family's income level.

loans.use: to add stock of basic commodities like flour, snacks, soft drinks, etc

loans.name: Chiphenyo

texts.en:
Chiphenyo is a married woman. She resides in her own house with access to electricity and piped water. Her monthly expenses include food for the family. 
For the past 2 years, Chiphenyo has operated a cereals business. Chiphenyo has applied for a loan of 20,000 KES from Yehu Microfinance Trust to buy more bundles of wheat flour, maize flour, sugar and bundles of fish, cooking oil. Chiphenyo sells to all categories of people and works seven days a week. Her major business challenges include seasonality and transportation of commodities from Mombasa town to her cereals business. Chiphenyo hopes to see her business expand to a wholesale cereals shop in the future.

loans.use: to buy more bundles of wheat flour, maize flour, sugar and bundles of fish, cooking oil.

loans.name: Mohamad

texts.en:
Mohamad is from Iraq. He is 41 years old, married, and has four children, two of who are employed.
Mohamad owns a shop for mobile phones and their accessories. After working in this business for five years Mohamad opened his own store in 2011. He has a good reputation and he is well known in the surrounding areas.
He is requesting $3000 to get signage for the shop and to pay the annual rent. He is aiming to grow his business and increase his profits so he will be able to provide his family better life conditions.

loans.use: to get signage for the shop and pay the annual rent.

loans.name: Bazee

texts.en:
Bazee is 26, married, and has three bouncing children. He is married to Asha who helps him run a coconut selling business. Bazee has been in this business for five years, selling his products at the market. 
He is a person who is dedicated to his job and who always thinks of how he can move forward. He is asking for a 50,000 KES loan to add stock of coconuts to fulfill the orders he has received from his customers.

loans.use: to add stock of coconuts

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To expand her agriculture business by cultivating more rice to sell.

loans.name: Mujeres Emprendedoras Group

texts.es:
l comité Mujeres Emprendedoras de la ciudad de Caaguazú, está conformado de 22 integrantes todas señoras humildes, trabajadoras, y excelentes  personas.
Patricia, miembro de este grupo, comenta que le han ayudado mucho, ya que no solo creció en su negocio, sino también como persona, ya que la interacción con las demás personas es algo muy valioso. Patricia vende prendas, y solicita el crédito para comprar ropas de verano, ya que se acerca el calor y quiere poder tener buena variedad que poder ofrecer a sus clientes.
texts.en:
The Committee of Enterprising Women of the City of Caaguazú is made up of 22 members; all are ladies who are humble, hardworking and excellent people.

Patricia is a member of this group and says that she has been helped a lot since not only did her business grow but she did as well since interacting with other people is something very valuable. Patricia sells clothing and needs a loan to buy summer clothes since the season is approaching and she would like to have variety of items to offer her customers.

loans.use: buy summer clothes to sell.

loans.name: Zouheir

texts.en:
From Iraq, Zouheir is a 41-year-old married father of four children, two of who are employed. Zouheir owns a grocery store selling soft drinks, juices, cheese, dairy products, meat, chicken, detergents and snacks. He established his business in 2009 and now has two employees. He has good experience in this field and a good reputation in his local community.

Zouheir is requesting a $2400 loan to buy a refrigerator and a generator. He is aiming to grow his business and increase his profits so he will be able to provide his family with better living conditions.

loans.use: to buy a refrigerator and a generator.

loans.name: Arlene

texts.en:
Arlene, a 42-year-old married mother of two children, lives in Tangub City where she owns and operates a general store, selling a variety of products to earn a living. She has been in this business for 11 years, each month earning PHP 4,000.

In 2011, Arlene joined GDMPC and is now requesting a loan of PHP 5,000 to purchase new items such as candies, milo, shampoo, soaps, etc. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the loan to improve and expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase new items such as candies, milo, shampoo, soaps, etc.

loans.name: José

texts.es:
El  Sr. José es de la ciudad de Santaní, tiene 51 años, está casado con la señora Gladys de 39 años, tienen 4 hijos todos mayores de edad, trabajan independiente, quienes los ayudan con los gastos de la casa.
El Sr. José tiene una Clínica Dental en el centro de la ciudad, con clientela formada, ya que siempre hace muy buen trabajo a sus pacientes. Es conocido por el buen servicio que da y por la calidez que transmite a las demás personas.
El Sr. José solicita este crédito para la compra de materia prima para su consultorio, ya que no quiere que le falte, pues quiere seguir dando un buen servicio a sus pacientes.
texts.en:
Jose is from Santaní. He is 51 years old and is married to Gladys, 39. They have four grown children who work independently and help them with household expenses.

Jose has a dental clinic in the city center with an established clientele, since he always does good work on his patients. He is known for giving good service and for the warmth that he spreads to others.

Jose is requesting this loan to buy materials for his dental practice since he does not want to be lacking anything, because he wants to keep giving good service to his patients.

loans.use: to buy materials for dental practice.

loans.name: Ivan Ramiro

texts.es:
Iván tiene 27 años, se considera una persona alegre, trabajador, responsable y le gusta emprender para poder cumplir con sus objetivos. Iván vive con su esposa y sus dos hijos en la ciudad de Ibarra.

Iván se dedica a la distribución de frutas, verduras, legumbres al por mayor, este negocio empezó hace tres meses, este era su sueña y lo está logrando, pero para esto necesita comprar constantemente sus productos, es por eso que solicita un crédito a Fodemi el mismo que va a ser invertido en la compra de bultos de zanahoria, arbeja, habas, cebolla paiteña y cajas de tomate para la distribución a sus clientes. Esta inversión permitirá a Iván seguir incrementando sus ventas e ingresos, lo que ayudará a mejorar la calidad de vida de su familia.

Iván sueña en que le vaya bien en el negocio que empezó y en un futuro poder construir su propia casa.
texts.en:
Iván is 27 years old.  He considers himself to be a happy, hard-working and responsible person.  He likes to take on projects to meet his goals.  Iván lives with his wife and their two children in the city of Ibarra.

Iván makes his living selling wholesale fruit, vegetables and legumes.  He started the business three months ago.  It was a dream of his, and he is making it happen.  But to run his business, he is constantly needing to purchase more products, which is why he is requesting a loan from Fodemi.  He will use it to invest in the purchase of bulk carrots, peas, beans, red onion and crates of tomatoes to re-sell to his customers.  This loan will allow Iván to continue increasing his sales and his income, which will help to improve his family's quality of life. 

Iván hopes that the business he started is successful and that, in the future, he is able to build his own home.

loans.use: with the purchase of bulk carrots, peas, beans, red onion and crates of tomatoes for re-sale.

loans.name: Emelda Akanya

texts.en:
Emelda  is 35 years old and a businesswoman.  She lives in Juba, and she is married, with four children between the ages of 3  and 10.  All of them go to school.

Emelda runs a general store, and she has been in business for four years. She has no employees. 

She heard about Finance Sudan through other clients. She is taking a loan of SDG 5,000 to purchase beans, cowpeas, and many others.   In addition to her business, she has no other source of income.  In five years she would like to expand her business.  Her major challenges include high prices in the market.

Emelda says she is happy for the loans given by Finance Sudan through the help of Kiva.

loans.use: for buying more items like beans, cowpeas, etc

loans.name: Halima

texts.en:
Halima is a married mother of four children. She resides with her husband in Mwambalazi, Coast Province, Kenya. 

She has been running a dressmaking shop for more than one year, earning about KES 200 per day. Her husband is a businessman, and he contributes to family basic needs with his earnings. Her children are still in her care and in school. 

To improve her business, Halima is requesting a loan of KES 20,000 to purchase more cloth materials to produce more clothes to sell. By doing so, she will earn more income to support the family. 

In the future, she would like to expand her business and help her children earn bachelor’s degrees.

loans.use: to purchase more cloth materials.

loans.name: Kathem

texts.en:
Kathem is from Iraq. He is 41 years old, married, and has six children, two of who are employed.

Kathem owns a small store for a water purification service. He established his business in 2010 and now he has two employees. What differentiates him is that he offers a delivery service. He has a good experience in this field and a good reputation in his local community.

He is requesting $3,000 as a loan to buy a motorcycle for delivery and a generator. He is aiming to grow his business and increase his profits so he will be able to provide better life conditions for his family and a good education for his kids.

loans.use: to buy a motorcycle for delivery and a generator.

loans.name: Erlinda

texts.en:
From Pangabuan, Tangub City, Erlinda is a 45-year-old widow with three children who help her in growing bananas. In business for five years, she earns PHP 10,000 a month.

This year, Erlinda joined GDMPC and is now requesting a loan of PHP 40,000 to purchase fertilizer and pay for weeding costs. She hopes for a bountiful harvest and wants to expand her cultivated area.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer and pay for weeding costs.

loans.name: Jenny

texts.es: Jenny compró en mayor volumen mercancias y artesanias con la cual surtió su negocio y le fue muy bien; ella se swiente muy satisfecha y con muchos pedidos de mochilas, collares, sombreros, adornos de madera y pulseras, por eso está acudiendo a un nuevo credikiva con el cual los comprará y ampliará su capital de trabajo. Ella envia un mensaje a sus finaciadores de Kiva que dice: "Agradezco enormemente la ayuda recibida y ojalá este programa se extienda por todas las ciudades de Colombia. "
texts.en:
Jenny bought a large volume of merchandise and handicrafts to restock her business. As a result, she has done very well. She feels very satisfied and has received many orders for backpacks, necklaces, hats, wooden ornaments, and bracelets.

For this reason, she is applying for a new Kiva loan so that she can buy more merchandise and increase her operating capital. Jenny sends the following message to the Kiva lenders: “I am extremely grateful for the help I received and hope that this program extends to every city in Colombia.”

loans.use: to buy backpacks, necklaces, hats, wooden ornaments, and bracelets.

loans.name: Semilla De Esperanza Group

texts.es:
Este Banco Comunal se llama “Semilla de Esperanza” está conformado por 18 emprendedores quienes se dedican a diferentes rubros, entre los cuales se encuentran; boutique, venta de estructuras metálicas, venta de ropa, repostería, venta de articulos para el hogar, servicios entre otros. Todos ellos pertenecientes a la ciudad de Concepción.
Maria, integrante del grupo del Banco Comunal, quien en la foto se encuentra sentada en primera fila, ocupando el segundo lugar de derecha a izquierda, viste blue jeans, polera de color naranjo un pañuelo alrededor de su cuello, su cabello es corto, lo usa suelto y es de color castaño claro.
Ella se dedica al rubro de bazar, desde hace 6 meses. Comenta que se ubica en un local dentro de una galería comercial donde ofrece sus accesorios, trabaja de lunes a sábado y su horario es de 10ºº a 20ºº horas.
La mercadería e insumos que va necesitando los compra en la ciudad de Santiago, en diferentes supermercados, distribuidoras y locales donde encuentra su mercadería a bajo costo, por lo tanto conveniente económicamente.
Con el crédito comprará poleras, pañuelos, detergentes, articulos varios para el hogar.
Una de las metas de Maria es continuar en su rubro y crecer diariamente y poder trasladarse al centro de su ciudad para mejorar sus ventas e ingresos.
Maria vive junto a sus dos hijos de 19 y 17 años de edad, quienes se encuentran estudiando. Su sueño a nivel laboral es tener un vehículo para llevar su mercadería y agrandar su negocio, y a nivel familiar tener su casa propia.
Ella se encuentra muy contenta y agradecida de la oportunidad brindada por Fondo Esperanza, ya que le permitirá invertir en su negocio. Respecto al grupo del Banco Comunal del cual forma parte, comenta que en éste existe muy buena comunicación. Por otro lado las capacitaciones, le han servido para aprender nuevas estrategias de venta y contabilidad.
Concepción, está asentada en la desembocadura del río Biobío, uno de los más grandes del país, al sur de Chile, en la región del Bíobío. Ha tenido una importante función en nuestra historia, siendo sede de importantes batallas y asentamiento relevante, especialmente durante la Guerra de Arauco, por estar en la frontera con territorio mapuche. Actualmente la ciudad posee un importante desarrollo económico y demográfico, llegando a ser considerada como uno de los núcleos urbanos, demográfico, administrativo, financiero y comercial más relevantes de Chile, después de Santiago y Valparaíso.
texts.en:
This communal bank is called “Semilla de Esperanza” and is made up of 18 enterprising men and women who work in different areas.  These include boutiques, metal structure sales, clothing sales, and desserts, sale of household goods, among other things.  All of them live in the city of Concepción.

Maria is a member of the communal bank, who is shown in the photograph, seated in the first row, second from the left, wearing blue jeans, an orange top, and a scarf.  She has short hair and wears it loosely.

She has had a general store for the past six months and she says that she has a stall within an inside marketplace, where she sells her accessories.  She works Monday through Saturday from 10:00am to 8:00pm.  

She buys her merchandise in different supermarkets, distributors, and shops in Santiago, where she can get it at lower prices and therefore more economically.  She will use the money from this loan to buy t-shirts, scarves, detergents, and various household items.

One of Maria’s goals is to continue in this business and grow it daily and be able to move it to the city center so that she can increase her sales and income.

Maria lives with her two children, ages 19 and 17, who attend school.  Her dreams are to have a vehicle so that she can transport her merchandise and grow her business.  She also wants to have a home of her own.

She is very happy and grateful for the opportunity provided by Fondo Ezperanza because it helps her to grow her business.  She says that there is good communication among the members of her communal bank and that the training has helped her learn new sales and accounting strategies.

Concepción is located at the mouth of the Biobío river, one of the largest in the country, in the south of Chile, in the Biobío region.  It has an important historical significance, having been the center of important battles and settlements, especially during the Arauco War, being located on the border of the mapuche territory.  Currently the city has an important economic and demographic development, being considered to be one of Chile’s most relevant urban demographic, administrative, financial, and business nuclei, after Santiago y Valparaíso.

loans.use: to buy t-shirts, scarves, detergents, and household goods.

loans.name: Patricia Durley

texts.es:
PATRICIA DURLEY tiene 28 años de edad de estado civil unión libre tiene dos hijos, vive con el conyugue y los hijos en la ciudad de ventanas Provincia de los ríos.

ES INTEGRANTE DE LA VRC NORTE, SE ENCUENTRA UBICADA EN RECINTO VENTANILLA NORTE, PERTENECE AL CANTÓN VENTANAS SE DEDICAN A LABORES AGRÍCOLAS Y PECUARIAS. 

PATRICIA DURLEY se dedica a la compra y venta de cerdos. solicita el crédito para comprar cerdos, polvillo, vacunas. Con la ayuda del crédito podrá comprar lo neceesario para obtener ingresos.

Las compras las hará en la ciudad de ventanas. El sueño es poder comprar un solar. Los dxeasfíos a los que se enfrentan son las enfermedades. en el tiempo libre le gusta cuidar a los animales.
texts.en:
Patricia Durley is 28 years old.  She lives with her husband and has two children.  She and her family live in the city of Ventanas, de los Ríos Province.

She is a member of the communal bank "Norte" (North), which is located in the Ventanilla Norte Precinct of Ventanas Canton.  The members make their livings working in agriculture and with livestock.  

Patricia Durley makes her living buying and selling pigs.  She is requesting the loan to purchase pigs, rice-based animal feed and vaccines.  With the help of the loan, she will be able to make the purchases she needs to earn her living. 

Patricia Durley  will make her purchases in the city of Ventanas.  Her dream is to be able to purchase a plot of land.  The challenges she faces include disease.  In her free time, Patricia Durley  likes to take care of the animals.

loans.use: to purchase pigs, rice-based animal feed and vaccines.

loans.name: Mujeres Unidas Group

texts.es:
El comité  “Mujeres Unidas” se conformo con la iniciativa de la de una de las miembros, actualmente se encuentran  en el segundo  ciclo, con 10 integrantes.
Justina es la presidenta de este grupo, y cuenta que todas están aprendiendo a trabajar juntas y tratan de ayudarse siempre y de esa forma hacer un poco más ligera la carga de cada una de ellas. Ella tiene una pequeña despensa bien surtida, mediante la cual da a su familia todo lo que necesitan. Cuenta que su meta es poder seguir creciendo y de esa forma algún día llegar a tener una gran despensa.
Ella solicita el crédito para la compra de bebidas, lácteos, panificados, y demás artículos de primera necesidad que son los que más venta tienen.
texts.en:
The committee, “United Women” started through the initiative of one of the members, at present they are in their second loan cycle and have 10 members.

Justina is the president of the group and says that all are learning to work together and they try to always help each other to lessen their burden. She has a small store that is well stocked and is the only source of income to provide her family with all that they need. She says that her goal is to keep growing and that someday she will be able to have a bigger store.

Justina needs a loan to buy beverages, dairy products, bread and other basic household goods that are sold most often.

loans.use: buy beverages, dairy products, bread and other basic household goods.

loans.name: Echo Mysterieux De Miniere 1, 2, 3, & 5 Group

texts.fr:
Philamar est le coordinateur de son groupe Echo Mysterieux de Miniere. Ils habite dans la région de Miniere d’Haiti où de l’éléctricité est rare et de l’eau est très limité. Il n'est pas marie il est pere de 15 enfants. Philamar a dirigé son business de menuisier pendant les 5 dernières années. Avant de commencer (menuiserie), il etait a cultivateur seulement.

Philamar voudrait utiliser cet emprunt pour investir avec duit du quincaillerie. Il espère que cet emprunt l’aidera à agrandir son business. Des autres membres du groupe ont besoin d’un emprunt pour tels commerces comme charbon et produits alimentaires. Philamar dit que son but principal est agrandir son business et être possede un moyen pour transporter les materiels.
texts.en:
Philamar is the coordinator of his group Echo Mysterieux de Miniere. He lives in the Miniere region of Haiti, where electricity is rare and water is very limited. He is not married. He is the father of fifteen children. Philamar has had a furniture-making business for the last five years. Before starting (carpentry), he was only a farmer.

Philamar would like to use this loan to invest in hardware. He hopes that this loan will help him to expand his business. The other members of the group have need of a loan for such businesses as charcoal and grocery items. Philamar says that his main goal is to expand his business and to own a means of transporting his materials.

loans.use: to purchase hardware

loans.name: Angela Cecilia

texts.es:
La Sra. Ángela tiene aproximadamente 7 años en el negocio de venta de mariscos. Comenzó trabajando en una fábrica, hasta que decidió establecer su propio negocio de venta de buches de pescado, poco a poco creció y con el pasar de los años fue adquiriendo muy buena clientela.  
Se levanta  a las 6:00am y se dirige al muelle para esperar las embarcaciones que llegan con la pesca. Unas de sus dificultades es que la pesca los últimos meses ha decaído un poco. Angela esta separada tiene 2 hijos 18 y 12 años que estudian en escuela fiscal. Con el prestamo quiere comprar pescado para vender. Unas de sus metas es crecer en su negocio, contar con el capital necesario para poner otro negocio y de esta forma tener otro ingreso.
texts.en:
Sr. Ángela has been selling seafood for approximately seven years. She started out working at a factory, but then decided to establish her own business of selling fish. Ángela gradually grew her business and has built up a good clientele over many years. She wakes up at 6:00 A.M. and heads to the docks where the fishing boats arrive.

One of her difficulties is that the level of fishing has declined a bit in recent months. Ángela is separated from her spouse and has two children (ages 18 and 12) who are studying at a state school. With this loan, she wants to buy fish to sell. Among her goals are to grow her business, have enough capital to start another business, and have another source of income.

loans.use: to buy fish.

loans.name: La Cuadrita De Mi Barrio Group

texts.es:
El comité “LA CUADRITA DE MI BARRIO” se encuentra en el décimo tercer ciclo del programa de Mujeres Emprendedoras de la Fundación Paraguaya,  tiene 17 integrantes y todas ellas ya realizan actividades productivas.
Juana, una de estas mujeres, es modista. Ella hace todo tipo de costuras y prendas, las cuales vende. Juana cuenta que siempre tiene mucho trabajo, ya que es conocida por el buen trabajo que hace, y esa es su mayor publicidad.
Ella solicita el crédito para la compra de telas, hilos, gomas, y demás insumos para seguir haciendo sus prendas y de esa forma seguir ganándose la vida honestamente.
texts.en:
The LA CUADRITA DE MI BARRIO community bank is embarking on its thirteenth round of funding, in conjunction with Fundacion Paraguaya's Mujeres Emprendedors program.  The bank has 17 members, all of whom operate their own businesses.
Our member, Juana, is a seamstress.  She makes and sells dresses and other clothing pieces.  She tells us that she always has work because she takes care of her customers and that, she adds, is the best advertising of all.
Juana is applying for a loan that she will use to buy the supplies she needs--fabric, thread, etc.--to carry on her business and, in turn, continue to make an honest living.

loans.use: to buy supplies for her sewing business.

loans.name: San Cayetano Group

texts.es:
El comite San Cayetano son todas de la ciudad de San Lorenzo, son 19 integrantes  muy responsables que se esfuerzan al máximo para poder ayudar a sus familias a tener todo aquello que ellas no pudieron en su momento.
Blanca, una de estas mujeres, se dedica a la venta de comidas de todo tipo, y dice que desde que forma parte del grupo ha mejorado mucho, ya que las capacitaciones que recibe le son de mucha ayuda.
Solicita el crédito para la compra de verduras, condimentos, carnes, y demás insumos para poder seguir haciendo los alimentos que ella prepara. Agradece por la gran ayuda que representa para ella este crédito.
texts.en:
The San Cayetano communal bank members are all from the city of San Lorenzo, there are 19 members all of which are very responsible people who work their best to be able to help their families have everything that they couldn't.

Blanca is one of these women, she works selling food of all types and says that since she has been a part of this group she has improved a lot since the lessons that she receives are of great help.

She needs the loan to buy vegetables, spices, meats and other items to keep making the food that she prepares. Blanca is grateful for this loan since it will be of great help to her.

loans.use: buy vegetables, spices, meats, and other items.

loans.name: Tet Fret De Dumas 1, 2 & 3 Group

texts.fr:
Andre est le coordinateur de son groupe Tet Fret de Dumas. Il  est un commercant. Il habite dans la région  de Dumas où de l’électricité est rare et de l’eau est très limité. Andre a dirigé son commerce de produit divers  pendant 10 années.

Avant de commencer ce commerce Andre était un Etudiant. Andre voudrait utiliser cet emprunt pour investir dans le produit divers comme  vetements, chaussures, etc. Il espère que cet emprunt l’aidera à agrandir son business.

Des autres membres  militant  ont besoin d’un emprunt pour tels commerces comme  nourriture, charbon, etc.  Andre dit que son but principal et son rêve c'est possède un  gros business avec son  fond et par la  grâce de Dieu.
texts.en:
Andre is the coordinator of his group Tet Fret de Duma. He is a merchant. He lives in the Dumas region, where electricity is rare and water is very limited. Andre has had a business selling a variety of goods for ten years. 

Before staring this business, Andre was a student. He would like to use this loan to invest in various goods, such as clothing, shoes, etc. He hopes that this loan will help him to expand his business. 

The other activist members of the group have need of a loan for such businesses as food, charcoal, etc. Andre says that his main goal and dream is to own a large business with his background and by the grace of God.

loans.use: to purchase clothing, shoes, etc. to sell

loans.name: Pilar Jane

texts.en: Pilar Jane is married and has two children. She is 25 years old and lives in Palomoc, Titay, Zamboanga Sibugay. To earn a living, Pilar Jane owns a general store, a business she has had for three years. Each month, she earns 2,500 PHP doing this work. She has requested a loan of 7,000 PHP to purchase more inventory for her general store such as shampoo, toothpaste, food, and beverages. Pilar Jane is a member of PMPC. In the future, Pilar Jane hopes to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more inventory such as shampoo, toothpaste, food, and beverages

loans.name: Santa Catalina Group

texts.es:
El comité Santa Catalina es integrado por 12 señoras activas y muy trabajadoras que se reunieron para formar un grupo de ayuda, no solo para ellas sino también para su comunidad.
Yrene tiene una despensa y también se dedica a la venta de bebidas, cuenta que gracias a que tiene muy buena variedad de productos, siempre tiene buena clientela, y eso le ayuda a ir creciendo poco a poco. Ella cuenta que empezó con muy poco, pero que después gracias a su esfuerzo está creciendo poco a poco.
Ella solicita el crédito para poder invertirlo en la compra de bebidas y de productos para su despensa, como frutas, verduras, productos a granel y demás. Todas las miembros de este grupo están contentas por la oportunidad de progreso que reciben.
texts.en:
The Santa Catalina communal bank consists of 12 ladies who are very active and hardworking; they got together to form a help group, not only for themselves but for their community as well.

Yrene has a small grocery store where she also sells beverages and says that thanks to having a variety of products she always has a good customer base which has helped her business grow little by little. Yrene says that she stared her business with very little but thanks to her hard work she is growing steadily.

She needs a loan to buy beverages and items for her store like fruits, vegetables, basic household products and other items. All of the members of this group are happy for this opportunity to get ahead.

loans.use: buy beverages and items for her store like fruits, vegetables, basic household products and other items.

loans.name: Emelia Jamba

texts.en:
Emelia is a 38-year-old businesswoman who lives in Juba. She is married and has five children between the ages of 4 and 14. All of them go to school. She runs a general store and has been in business for four years. She has no employees. She heard about Finance Sudan through other clients. She is taking a loan of 5,000 SDG to purchase onions, sapa, soap, and many other items. She has no other source of income in addition to this business.

In five years she would like to expand her business.

Her major challenges include high prices in the market.

Emelia says she is happy for the loans given by Finance Sudan with the help of Kiva.

loans.use: to buy more items likes soap, onions, sapa, tea leaves, etc.

loans.name: Kihondo Abagambakamu Group

texts.en: Valley is a 49-year-old, hardworking woman living in Fort Portal, Uganda. She is a member of the above-mentioned group where each one guarantees the other in accessing a loan. Valley has a bar business that she has been running for 13 years and with the income earned, she has been able to buy land and pay school fees for her children. She has challenges of inadequate capital to buy stock and high taxes by the local government which limits her profits. However, she has a personal goal of educating her children and building a permanent house for residence, while her business dream is to expand her business to new markets. Valley is requesting for money to buy more beers to sell.

loans.use: to buy beers to sell.

loans.name: Catherine

texts.en:
Catherine is 45 years old and is from Nakuru, Kenya, where she is married with two children between the ages of 15 and 20.
She has a business of selling assorted goods including shoes, plastic cups, and plates. Catherine has applied for her second loan to enable her pay for her children's school fees. She hopes to start up a boutique in her area.

loans.use: Pay school fees

loans.name: Carmelita

texts.en: Carmelita is 57 years old and lives in Ubay, Labason, Zamboanga del Norte. She is married with 6 children. To earn a living, Carmelita has a business selling a variety of foods for snacks. She earns about 2,000 PHP each month doing this type of work. Carmelita has requested a loan of 7,000 PHP to purchase more stocks for her snack vending business. Carmelita has been a member of PMPC for 1 year. In the future, Carmelita would like to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more stocks for her snack vending business

loans.name: Kibaale Tweyimuke Coffee Growers Group

texts.en: Godfrey is a 32-year-old, married man with six children living in Kyenjojo, Uganda. He is a farmer and he mainly grows coffee. He has been in the sector for 10 years. He also grows maize and beans. With the income earned, Godfrey has been able to buy more land for farming and educate his children. He faces a problem of seasonal weather changes, like drought, which affects the coffee production. He has a personal goal of educating his children up to the university and a business goal of venturing into mechanized agriculture. He is a member of the above-mentioned group where each member guarantees the other in accessing the loan and that is why they are 10 members and yet only 9 need the loan. Godfrey needs the loan facility to pay workers who are digging his garden.

loans.use: to pay workers who are digging his garden

loans.name: Chandiru Awate

texts.en:
Chandiru is a 32-year-old  businesswoman who lives in Juba. She is married and has three children between the ages of 4 and 10. All of them go to school.

Chandiru runs a general store and has been in business for five years. She has no employee. She heard about Finance Sudan through other clients. She is taking a loan of 5,00 SDG to purchase sapa, sim sims, beans, and many other items. In addition to this business she has no other source of income.

In five years she would like to expand her business. Her major challenges include high prices in the market.

Chandiru says she is happy for the loans given by Finance Sudan through the help of Kiva.

loans.use: to buy items like sim sims, beans, sapa, etc.

loans.name: Tabitha

texts.en:
Tabitha is 24 years old.  She is from Nakuru and is married, with two children who are both in school.

Tabitha has had a clothing business for the past two years. She has applied for her second loan from KADET LTD to enable her to buy clothes to add to her stock. Tabitha is optimistic that her clothing business will do well after the loan.

She hopes to open a boutique in the near future and to be able to meet all her family needs.

loans.use: to purchase stock of new clothes to sell.

loans.name: Ofelia

texts.en:
Ofelia is from Sta. Maria, Tangub City. She is 48 years old and married with 4 children. Ofelia raises pigs to sell, and she has been doing this for 12 years. She earns PHP 30,000 a month. 

In 2009, Ofelia joined Kiva partner GDMPC. Ofelia is requesting a loan of PHP 50,000 which will be used to purchase livestock feed and other supplies. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family.

loans.use: to purchase livestock feed and other supplies

loans.name: Zivamuntuyo Kyamujanju Group

texts.en: Isaac is a married man, age 52, living in Kagadi, Uganda. He owns a retail shop that he has run for a period of 12 years having got start up capital from maize product sales. Inadequate capital is affecting the business. He would like to expand his business to wholesale level and educate his children to attain degrees as minimum qualification. Isaac is requesting a loan to buy sugar, soap and cooking oil to sell. He is a member of Zivamuntuyo Kyamujanju group where each member guarantees the other to access a loan.

loans.use: to buy sugar, soap and cooking oil for sale.

loans.name: Jose Alejandro

texts.es: José  vio en la venta de pescado una fuente de ingreso para su familia. Su trabajo lo hace con su esposa quien lo ayuda. Sale a medio día para entregar pescado a los clientes que tiene. Una de sus dificultades es la delincuencia. Su esposa vende ropa y Avon, tiene 3 hijos pero ya son mayores. Con el préstamo va a comprar mariscos y tachos.  Unas de sus metas es crecer en su negocio y mejorar su vivienda.
texts.en:
José sells fish as a means of generating income for his family. His wife helps him with his work. José begins delivering fish at noon to his existing customers. One of the problems that he must deal with is crime. His wife sells clothing and Avon products. They have three grown children.

With this loan, José will buy seafood and storage containers. Among his goals are to grow his business and make improvements to his home.

loans.use: to buy seafood and storage containers.

loans.name: Teodulo

texts.es:
El Sr. Teodulo es de la ciudad de Curuguaty, el está casado, el cuenta que es comerciante, que se dedica a la venta de baterías, lubricantes, y además de eso también vende prendas de vestir.
Cuenta que su trabajo lo hace, desde hace 4 años atrás, y le está yendo muy bien, ya que él es una persona muy buena para las ventas, pero además de eso siempre da buenos productos a sus clientes. Es una persona muy trabajadora que se nota que desea salir adelante y progresar por todo el esfuerzo que hace.
Teodulo solicita este préstamo para la compra de prendas de vestir, para poder tener buena variedad de prendas, y de esa forma poder seguir ofreciendo buena calidad a sus clientes.
texts.en:
Mr. Teodulo is from the city of Curuguay, he is married and is a salesman. He sells batteries and lubricants as well as clothing.

He has been in this field for 4 years and is doing very well since he is a naturally good salesman and always has the best products for his customers. He is a very hardworking person and one can see that he wants to get ahead in life and progress by all of the efforts that he undertakes.

Teodulo needs this loan to buy clothing and have a greater variety of items to keep offering the best quality to his customers.

loans.use: buy clothing to sell.

loans.name: Edgar Javier

texts.es:
EDGAR JAVIER tiene 38 años de edad es soltero no tiene hijos, vive en casa de unos familiares en Ventanas provincia de los ríos.

ES INTEGRANTE DE LA VRC NORTE, SE ENCUENTRA UBICADA EN RECINTO VENTANILLA NORTE, PERTENECE AL CANTÓN VENTANAS SE DEDICAN A LABORES AGRÍCOLAS Y PECUARIAS. 

EDGAR JAVIER se dedica a la gricultura a la siembra de maíz y a la cría de cerdos. Solicita el crédito para comprar urea, semillas, insecticidas, ranger. Con la ayuda del crédito podrá comprar lo necesario para la agricultura.

Las compras lo hara en ventans. El sueño es ponerce un negocio. En elk tiempo libre le gusta jugar futbool.
texts.en:
Edgar Javier is 38 years old, is single, with no children.  He lives with family in Ventanas, part of the Rios province.

He is a member of the Norte community group, located in northern Ventanilla, part of the Ventanas area, where the people are farmers and raise livestock.

Edgar Javier is a farmer and raises corn and pigs.  He is asking for this loan to buy seeds, urea, and insecticides.  This loan will help him buy the farming supplies he needs.

He will make his purchases in Ventanas.  His dream is to set up a business.  He likes to play soccer in his spare time.

loans.use: to buy farming supplies.

loans.name: Ibrahim

texts.en:
Ibrahim is from Iraq. He is 48 years old, married and has five children. He is the only provider for the family.

Ibrahim owns a grocery store selling soft drinks, juices, cheese, dairy products, detergents and snacks. He established his business in 2010 where he is the only grocery store in the area. He now has good experience in this field and a good reputation in his local community.

Ibrahim is requesting a 2,500 USD loan to buy a generator. He is aiming to grow his business to insure a future business for his children. He also wants more profits going to change the house furniture.

loans.use: to buy a generator

loans.name: Samuel Yope

texts.en:
Samuel is a 40-year-old businessman who lives in Juba. He is married and has 5 children between the ages of 5 and 15, all of them go to school.

Samuel runs a general store, and has been in business for 5 years. He has no employees. He heard about Finance Sudan through other clients. He is taking a loan of 5,000 SDG to purchase shoes, sandals and many other items. Samuel has no other source of income besides this business.

In 5 years, Samuel would like to expand his business and open other branches. His major challenges include high market prices. Samuel says he is happy for the loans given by Finance Sudan through the help of Kiva.

loans.use: for buying more shoes, sandals, etc.

loans.name: Houssein

texts.en:
Houssein is from Iraq. He is a youth client, 28 years old, married and has three children. He is the only provider for the family.

Houssein owns a shoe shop for men and women. He established his business in 2004 and now he has good experience in this field and a good reputation in his local community.

Houssein is requesting 3,000 USD as a youth loan to renovate the shop. He is aiming to grow his business and increase his profits so he will be able to provide his family better life conditions.

loans.use: to renovate the shop

loans.name: Beronico

texts.es:
Beronico, de 53 años de edad, es un hombre trabajador y de ideas firmes con deseos de superación.  Es viudo hace muchos años.  Vive en compañía de su madre y sus 04 hijos, habitando su casa propia, la cual compró con mucho esfuerzo. Las actividades que realiza Beronico, es la agricultura, tiene un terreno propio de 36 hectáreas de extensión,  en donde realizará un  proyecto que tiene en marcha de siembra de palma aceitera de al menos 06 hectáreas  ya que éste producto tiene bastante demanda en la actualidad siendo un cultivo alternativo al cultivo de coca. Lleva en éste negocio más de 07 años, para apoyarse contrata hasta 02 peones a los que paga un jornal de 20 nuevos soles diarios cada uno, además de contar con el apoyo de sus hijos.
Considera rentable su negocio por la demanda que tiene éste producto y las buenas ganancias que le deja.
Comenta le agrada su vida de campo pues le ha traído muchas alegrías como los ingresos económicos para pagar los gastos propios de su hogar, así como el ver como marcha sus proyectos, y viendo los buenos resultados que tiene, piensa continuar en su actividad y expandirse aumentando el número de hectáreas de palma aceitera sembrada al doble del que ya tiene. Este es el préstamo número 02 con la institución MFP, se siente contento de contar con un apoyo financiero para concretar sus proyectos. Además comenta estar a gusto con su banco comunal pues considera a sus miembros ser buenas personas. Con el monto solicitado de 1500 nuevos soles, los invertirá en su totalidad en la compra de abono para sus cultivos de palma aceitera.
texts.en:
Beronico, 53, is a hardworking man with strong ideas and desires to excel. He has been a widower for many years. He lives with his mother and his four children in their own house, which he bought with much effort. 

Beronico works in agriculture. He has 36 hectares of land, where he is engaged in a project that has him sowing at least 6 hectares of oil palms; there is a fair amount of demand for this product since it is actually an alternative crop to the coca plant. He has been in this business for more than 7 years; for support, he contracts up to 2 workers, whom he pays 20 soles a day each, in addition to the support that he gets from his children. He considers his business profitable because of the demand for the product and the profits it provides.

He says he likes the country life as it has brought him much happiness, like the income to pay household expenses. Seeing how his projects are going, and seeing the good results from them, he plans to continue his work and expand the number of hectares sown with palms to twice what he currently has.

This is his second loan with MFP; he is happy to have the financial support to realize his projects. He also says that he is comfortable with his community bank as he considers the members to be good people. With the requested loan of 1500 soles, he will invest the entire amount in he purchase of fertilizer for the cultivation of oil palms.

loans.use: to buy sacks of fertilizer.

loans.name: Lucio

texts.es:
Lucio, de 26 años de edad, es una hombre trabajador y dedicado a su labor en le campo.  Es conviviente con Lisbith que también se dedica a la agricultura, fruto de esa feliz unión tienen 01 hija de 5 años de edad que es su mayor alegría y  se esfuerza en salir adelante, y están cómodamente instalados en su propia casa.
La actividad que realiza Lucio es la agricultura, para eso tiene su terreno propio de 20 hectáreas de extensión, en donde tiene 03 hectáreas de sombríos de cacao, siendo un cultivo alternativo a la hoja de coca, además de  tener cultivos de plátanos, maíz, estos últimos para el consumo de su hogar, como también cría aves de de corral como gallinas y patos. 
Lleva es esta actividad más de  10 años para instalarse y posesionarse en los campos de cultivo, contando en la actualidad con la ayuda de familiares en las  jornada trabajada.
Considera rentable su negocio por la demanda del producto y las buenas ganancias que le deja. Le gusta su actividad al poder estar en el campo, tener contacto con la naturaleza y la tranquilad del campo, donde se siente muy a gusto, además que le brinda lo necesario para vivir cómodamente, y para educar a su  hija, que es su mayor orgullo, por eso se siente con muchas ganas de progresar y mejorando sus técnicas de cultivo comprando un tractor agrícola. Este es el préstamo número 02 con la institución MFP, por tanto cuenta con su colaboración, para continuar con sus objetivos. Por otro lado dice sentirse a gusto con su banco comunal pues considera a sus miembros ser excelentes personas.
Con el monto solicitado de 1500 nuevos soles, los invertirá en su totalidad en la compra de abono  para cacao en mayor volumen para mejorar la calidad de sus cultivos.
texts.en:
Lucio, who is 26 years old, is a hard-working man who is dedicated to his farm-work.  He lives with his wife, Lisbith, who also makes her living in agriculture.  Together they have one 5-year old daughter, who is their greatest joy and for whom they work to get ahead.  The family is comfortably installed in their own home. 
Lucio's business is agriculture.  He has 20 hectares of his own land.  He plants cacao, which is the preferred alternative to coco leaves, in 3 of the hectares.  In addition, he has banana and corn crops, which he plants for his family's consumption.  And he raises fowl, like chickens and ducks.
It has taken Lucio more than 10 years to get settled in and take over in this line of work.  He currently has the help of family members and day laborers. 
Lucio feels that his business is profitable because of the demand for his produce and because he earns good money.  He likes his work because he likes to be in the fields and to be close to nature and the tranquility of the countryside, where he feels very happy.  In addition, his fields give him what he needs to live comfortably and to educate his daughter, which is his greatest source of pride.  And which is why he has a great desire to progress.  He wants to improve his farming technology by purchasing a tractor.  This is his 2nd loan with MFP, and as such he is counting on their collaboration to continue meeting his goals.  He also says that he feels happy with his communal bank; he feels that the members are excellent people. 
Lucio will invest all of the requested sum of 1500 nuevos soles ($600 USD), in the purchase of a large quantity of cacao fertilizer to improve the quality of his crop.

loans.use: to purchase sacks of compost.

loans.name: Zenaida

texts.en:
Zenaida is from Pangabuan, Tangub City. She is 52 years old, married and has 4 children. To make a living, Zenaida has been selling seafood products including fish and shrimp in the local community for 13 years and earns PHP 6,000 a month from these activities.

In 2008, Zenaida joined Kiva's partner, GDMPC. Zenaida is requesting a loan of PHP 10,000 which will be used to purchase new equipment and tools needed for her business. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family.

loans.use: to purchase new equipment and tools needed for her business

loans.name: Creciendo Con Esperanza Group

texts.es:
Este Banco Comunal se llama “Creciendo con Esperanza” está conformado por 17 emprendedores quienes se dedican a diferentes rubros entre los cuales se encuentran; repostería, venta e joyas, almacén, bazar, comida rápida, venta de perfumes, venta de plantas, servicios entre otros. Todos ellos pertenecientes a la ciudad de Chillan.
Patricia , delegada del grupo del Banco Comunal, quien en la foto se encuentra de pie en primera fila, ocupando el segundo lugar de derecha a izquierda, viste pantalón de color negro, encima lleva una chaqueta de color verde, usa cartera de color café oscuro, su cabello lo usa tomado  y es de color castaño oscuro.
Ella se dedica al rubro de venta de bazar, desde hace 3 meses. Comenta que trabaja en un local, el cual lo arrienda, se desempeña en su rubro de lunes a sábado y su horario lo distribuye de acuerdo a su disponibilidad.
La mercadería e insumos que va necesitando los compra en la ciudad de Santiago en distribuidoras e importadoras a bajo costo, por lo tanto conveniente económicamente.
Con el crédito comprará adornos para las fiestas patrias como pañuelos, vestidos y trajes de baile, adornos para abastecer su local.
Una de las metas de Patricia es arrendar un local más grande y tener mas mercadería surtida para vender, así con esto generar mayores ingresos y tener una mejor calidad de vida.
Patricia vive junto a su marido y su sobrina. Sus sueños a nivel laboral continuar con el rubro y tener mucha mercadería, y a nivel familiar que su hija termine su carrera profesional, para ver su tarea cumplida.
Ella se encuentra muy contenta y agradecida de la oportunidad brindada por Fondo Esperanza, ya que le permitirá invertir en su negocio. Respecto al grupo del Banco Comunal del cual forma parte, comenta que en éste existe muy buena comunicación. Por otro lado las capacitaciones, le han servido para aprender nuevas estrategias de venta y contabilidad.
Chillán es una comuna de la zona centro sur de Chile. Su nombre significa “silla del sol” en mapudungun, idioma de nuestros indígenas mapuches. Chillán es conocida como “Cuna de la Patria” o “Tierra de Artistas”, debido a que en la ciudad han nacido destacados personajes de la historia de Chile, como por ejemplo el conocido pianista Claudio Arrau.
texts.en:
This communal bank is called “Creciendo con Esperanza.” It consists of 17 members who are engaged in different areas, among which are: pastries, the sale of jewelry, a grocery store, office supply sales, fast food, the sale of perfumes, plant sales, and services, among others. They all belong to the city of Chillán.

Patricia, a delegate of the communal bank, can be found standing in the photo in the front line, occupying the spot second from the right, dressed in black pants and wearing a green jacket on top, and a dark brown purse. Her hair is pulled back and is dark brown.

She has made a living for three months through office supply sales. She comments that she works in a store which she rents.  She works from Monday through Saturday, and she distributes her schedule according to her availability. The goods and supplies that she needs she buys in the city of Santiago from distributors and importers at a lower cost, and therefore are economically convenient.

With the loan she will buy decorations for national holidays such as handkerchiefs, dresses, and dance costumes- decorations to supply her store.
One of Patricia’s goals is to lease a larger store and to have more merchandise stocked to sell, and with this generate higher income and have a better quality of life.

Patricia lives with her husband and niece. Her dreams for her work are to continue working with her business and have a lot of merchandise, and for her family are that her daughter finish her professional career in order to see her job completed.

She is very happy and thankful for the opportunity provided by Fondo Esperanza since it will allow her to invest in her business. Respecting the community bank of which she is a part, she comments that there is very good communication. Also, the training has allowed her to learn new strategies for sales and accounting.

Chillán is a community in the central southern zone of Chile. Its name means “seat of the sun” in Mapudungun, the language of our Mapuche Indians. Chillán is known as the “Cradle of the Homeland” or “Land of the Artists,” owing to the fact that prominent figures from Chile’s history were born in the city, such as, for example, the famous pianist Claudio Arrau.

loans.use: to buy decorations for national holidays, such as handkerchiefs, dresses and dance costumes- decorations to supply her store.

loans.name: Adelina

texts.es:
La señora Adelina tiene 43 años de edad y vive en la aldea El Centro que pertenece al municipio de San Rafael Lempira. Ella es casada y su esposo es electricista. La pareja tiene 5 hijos con edades entre 14 y 26 años, Los dos menores están estudiando.  
Doña Adelina trabaja como conserje en un centro de educación y también vende plásticos como lavamanos, platos, vasos, maceteros, y sillas plásticas entre otras cosas. Inició el negocio por voluntad propia y porque estos productos eran muy cotizados en la aldea. Empezó el negocio hace más de un año utilizando unas ganancias que tuvo con su negocio anterior, lo cual era una pulpería y comida. Decidió que la venta de plásticos era más rentable.  
Ha solicitado este segundo préstamo de L.21,000 para surtir su inventario con la compra de mercadería de plásticos. Va  a aumentar el negocio e integrar más productos para la venta. Espera que sus ventas aumenten para invertir en los estudios de sus hijos y la alimentación familiar. Agradece mucho a ODEF y a Kiva por el apoyo financiero brindado, ya que su negocio se ha mantenido estable y ha podido aprovechar sus ganancias.
texts.en:
Adelina is 43, and lives in the village of El Centro, which is part of the municipality of San Rafael Lempira. She is married, and her husband is an electrician. The couple has five children, aged 14 to 26. The two youngest are in school.   

Adelina works as a school caretaker, and also sells plastic items such as washbasins, plates, glasses, flower pots, plastic chairs and other things. 

She started her business at her own initiative, and because there was a high demand for these products in the village. She established the business more than a year ago, using some of the earnings she had from her previous business, which was a general store and eatery. She decided that selling plastic items was more profitable.   

She has applied for this second loan of 21,000 lempiras in order to restock her inventory through the purchase of plastic merchandise. She is going to increase her business and include more products to sell.

She hopes that her sales increase so that she can invest in her children's education and in her family's food costs.  

She is very grateful to ODEF and to Kiva for the financial support offered, as her business has remained stable and she has been able to make good use of her earnings.

loans.use: To buy plastic kitchen utensils to stock her business and sell.

loans.name: Kavule Kwekamba Womens Group

texts.en:
Stephen is a 39-year-old married man with 4 children living in Bundibugyo, Uganda. He has a produce business that he has been operating for over 10 years. He started the business after realizing that he could not support his family by depending only on agriculture, since that sector is seasonal. 

His main hardships are customers not paying on time and changes in the weather. Stephen's personal goals are to educate his children and himself while his business goals are to expand into new markets and move to a more permanent location. The purpose of the requested loan is to buy more cocoa to sell.

loans.use: to buy cocoa to sell.

loans.name: Anito

texts.en: Anito, 48 years old, is a married entrepreneur with 5 children living in Tambulig, Zamoboanga del Sur. He earns income from operating a transport service business. It started 10 years ago and he earn PHP 6,000 a month. To improve his business, he is borrowing PHP 50,000 from Kiva's partner, GDMPC, to purchase accessories and tires for his business. He joined GDMPC in 2011. Before long, he is hopeful of the possibility of expanding his business.

loans.use: to obtain accessories and tires

loans.name: Gorreti

texts.en:
Gorreti is a forty-nine-year-old farmer who is married with eight children. She lives in Bundibugyo,Uganda, and she has been in the cocoa business for six years. She started growing cocoa on a small scale, and after realizing the lucrative nature of the business, she bought land and started farming extensively. Like most farmers, she is challenged by seasonal weather variations and pests.

Gorreti's vision is to educate her children to higher levels of learning and to build a good residential home for her family. Her business goals are to diversify her farming to other types of crops like maize and cassava and to expand her business into new markets. The purpose of the loan is to pay workers to harvest her cocoa.

loans.use: to pay workers to harvest her cocoa.

loans.name: Stephen

texts.en:
Stephen has been selling boiled eggs in Naivasha, Kenya for the past year. He is 32 years old and married with a 3-year-old child.

This is his second loan and he plans to use it to buy a bicycle so he can more easily and quickly distribute eggs to various customers, since his business is currently challenged by a lack of mobility. He will use the anticipated income to buy chicks for rearing and later sell them at a profit.

In the future, he hopes to grow his business by supplying eggs and chicken broilers to various hotels in Naivasha.

loans.use: to buy a bicycle so he can distribute boiled eggs faster

loans.name: Felicitation

texts.en:
Felicitation and her husband are engaged in a fishing business in Talibon, Bohol, Philippines. In addition to nets, they use handwoven baskets to catch fish.

Felicitation, who dreams of improving their livelihood, is requesting a loan of PHP 8000 to buy new fishing materials including fishing nets. She hopes to uplift their living conditions and experience the fullness of life.

loans.use: to buy fishing materials such as fishing nets.

loans.name: Reina Adelina

texts.es:
Reina, tiene 32 años de edad, casada desde hace 17 años, tiene 3 hijos entre 3 y 13 años de edad, vive en San Juan, Lempira. Su esposo es motorista.
Hace más de 8 años que vende ropa variada como blusas, pantalones, ropa de niño, camisetas, ropa intima, faldas, y sandalias. Donde vive es una aldea rural y no hay tiendas de ropa, esto la motivo a empezar el negocio de ropa y sus ventas han sido buenas, su forma de vender es a domicilio por pedidos y en su casa. Reina es muy trabajadora, adicionalmente tiene siembra de café, donde obtiene otros ingresos.
Ha solicitado el tercer ciclo de préstamos con el actual que es de 25,000 Lempiras y los ha invertido en su negocio manteniéndolo surtido e incrementando sus ventas, con el actual préstamo comprara ropa para niños, blusas, camisetas, pantalones y sandalias para aumentar el inventario y obtener más ingresos.
Su sueño es graduar a sus hijos y arreglar su vivienda, con las ganancias que obtenga. Agradece mucho a ODEF y a Kiva por la oportunidad brindada.
texts.en:
Reina is 32 years old. She has been married for 17 years, and has three children, aged between 3 and 13. She lives in San Juan, Lempira. Her husband is a driver. 

For eight years, she has been selling a variety of clothing, such as blouses, pants, children's clothing, T-shirts, underwear, skirts and sandals. She lives in a rural village where there are no clothing stores; this is the reason for starting her clothing businesss, and sales have been good. She sells though  orders for home delivery, and at her home.  

Very hard-working, she also grows coffee, from which she earns other income.

She has applied for her third loan, with the current one being for 25,000 lempiras. She has invested it in her business, keeping it stocked and increasing her sales. With the present loan, she will buy children's clothing, blouses, T-shirts, pants and sandals for increasing her inventory and obtaining more income. 

Her dream is to see her children graduate and fix up her house with the earnings she gets. She is very grateful to ODEF and to Kiva for the opportunity provided.

loans.use: To buy children's clothing, blouses, pants, T-shirts and sandals for restocking her store.

loans.name: Viola

texts.en:
Viola is 20 years old and lives in the town of Lugazi in the Mukono region of Uganda. For the past 3 years, Viola has been working hard to manage her small business, which sells clothes. 

To help expand her business, Viola has requested a loan of 600,000 Ugandan Shillings from Kiva's partner, BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy more clothes for resale, and will help Viola to generate greater profits and support her family's basic needs like food and clothes. Viola hopes that in the future she will be able to improve on her business by adding more fashionable clothes for resale. 

Viola is a member of BRAC's Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program. Viola's group is comprised of hard working women. In addition to microfinance loans, the program provides both a safe place for young Ugandan women to take part in group activities, and a forum for life-skills training.

loans.use: to buy more clothes for resale

loans.name: Vecensio

texts.en: Vecensio is a 41-year-old married man living in Kamwenge, Uganda. He has a vision of educating his children and building a permanent home. He has been in the produce business for six years. He started with a capital of one million shillings, and his working capital is now worth twelve million. He faces hardships of inadequate capital to meet the high demand and price fluctuation. He has a vision of expanding his business to new markets and diversifying his business to include farming. Vecensio needs a loan to buy beans and coffee to sell.

loans.use: To buy beans and coffee to sell

loans.name: Rosemary

texts.en: Rosemary is a 49-year-old married woman with four children. She lives in Kamwenge, Uganda. She has a vision of educating her children up to the university level. For fifteen years she has been operating a bar. She started with 100,000 shillings and now has 20,000,000 shillings as a working capital. Her main hardships are price fluctuations and inflation. She has a vision of diversifying her business to include farming and expanding her business to new markets. Rosemary needs a loan to buy more crates of beer and soda to sell.

loans.use: To buy more crates of beer and soda to sell

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Jane

texts.en:
Jane's clothing business is doing well and she has a good credit history with KADET LTD.

She has been selling clothes in the town of Nakuru for the past seven years and has applied for her second loan from KADET LTD to enable her  to buy blazers and blouses to add to her stock to sell in the coming high season. 

She hopes to own a boutique in the near future.

loans.use: to buy more clothes to sell, mainly jackets, jumpers and sweaters.

loans.name: Modesto Miguel

texts.es: Modesto,31 años de edad, es originario de la comarca La Joya,Teustepe se dedica a  sembrar maíz frijol desde los 15 años actividad que realizaba  al lado del papa. Hace 5 años que se casó inicio a trabajar independiente salía a trabajar como jornalero para cubrir los gastos para hacer sus huertas hoy gracias al trabajo tiene sus vaquitas , para hacer sus huerta paga mozos y cuando saca su cosecha la vende  en la misma comarca también  sale a vender trastes plásticos a otros departamento. Modesto está solicitando este crédito para comprar una ternera para desarrollo y  para invertir en el negocio de la venta de traste como porras, calderos. Él dice que el crédito le servirá ya que al invertir más en la compra de calderos porras para salir a vender mejoraran sus  ingresos y dice que cuando pague este crédito sacara otros siempre para comprar animales y como meta próxima tiene  realizar la huerta de frijol y  maíz.
texts.en:
Modesto is 31 years old, is a native of the region of La Joya, Teustepe, and is dedicated to grow corn and beans since he was 15 years old. He used to make this activity with his father.
